luo: E higa mar 2016, ne oloyo dhahabu e tuke mag ITF mag rawere matindo e Africa ma ugwe ngato achiel achiel kod mar ji ariyo ariyo.

eng: She represented Kenya at the All African Games in Rabat, Morocco, last year where they finished fourth before finishing runners up at the East Africa Zonal Championship last year and this year.
luo: Ne o chung ne Kenya e piem mar tuke duto ma Afrika Rabat, Morocco, higa mokalo kama ne gitieko e thuolo mar angwen kapok gitieko e thuolo mar ariyo e tuke mag mag jolar loch mar Africa ma Ugwe higa mokalo gi higani.

eng: Cheruto: From slums to the top of Africa
luo: Cheruto koa e kar dak mongohore nyaka e wi Afrika.

eng: She is keen to stage a comeback after Covid-19 pandemic
luo: Otang ahinya mar keto duogo mare bang dera mar Kovid - 19.

eng: The 15-year-old high school student beat all odds to scale the continent’s heights of fame.
luo: Jahigni 15 ma en puonjre e skund sekendar ne okalo obadho te kotingo nying Afrika malo e loch.

eng: Her slender looks and the swift swings on the courts offer a spectacular sight.
luo: Neno ne ma rapudo kod fyayo bat ma yom ka en e alap mar tugo nyiso ga picha majaber.

eng: And Cynthia Cheruto is a gifted tennis player who dismisses opponents in local and international tournaments without breaking a sweat. The 15-year-old girl is simply a talent in several fronts.
luo: To Cynthia Cheruto en jatugo mar tenis ma nigi were ma ja golo ga oko jotugo morado kode e tuke ma dala kata ma pinje ma oko ma ok ochuero kata luya. Ja higni 15 ma nyako no en mana were eyore mangeny.

eng: In the last seven years, Cheruto has produced remarkable performance in Kenya, Confederation of African Tennis (CAT) and International Tennis Federation (ITF) competitions.
luo: Kuom higni auchiel mokalo, Cheruto osegolo duoko maber mokalo e kenya, tuke mag Afrika Tenis (CAT) gi tuke mag piem mag pinje (ITF).

eng: Apart from winning the Star Challenge under-14 championship last year, she also won the under-14 Kenya Open and ITF/CAT East African Junior championship in Tanzania in 2018.
luo: Kopogore gi loyo piem mar Sulwe ma g Tenis mag jo bwo higni 14 higa mokalo, ne oloyo tugo mag Kenya Open gi ITF/CAT mag Afrika ma Ugwe mag joma tindo Tanzania e higa 2018.

eng: In 2016, she made her international debut in Morocco where he finished fourth in under-14 singles before her second outing in Egypt the same year, where she won a bronze medal.
luo: E higa mar 2016, ne otimo nyagruok mare Morocco e tuke mag pinje kama ne otieko ethuolo mar angwen e jo bwo higni 14 e tugo mar ngato achiel achiel, ka pok owuok oko e tielo mar ariyo e piny Misri e higa onogo, kama ne oloyo e midila mar Mula.

eng: The highlight of her journey to stardom came in 2018 when she won gold at the ITF/CAT East African Junior championship in Tanzania.
luo: Awiye mag wuodhe e bedo sulwe nobiro e higa 2018 ka ne oloyo midila mar dhahabu e tuke mag ITF/CAT Afrika ma Ugwe e piem mag joma tindo e piny Tanzania.

eng: She also 2018 Kenya Open under 14 category in singles and doubles.
luo: Be e higa 2018 tuke mag Kenya Open mar joma tindo e bwo higni 14 mar ji achiel achiel gi ariyo ariyo.

eng: “Winning the Kenya Open was a milestone for me even if it was in the junior category. It motivates me while in the court,” Cheruto, whose father was a footballer and mother a runner, said.
luo: "Loyo Kenya Open, ne omiya ondamo ma duong kata obedo ni ne en e kidieny mar joma tindo. Omiya ga mijingo ka an e alap mar tugo,"Cheruto, ma wuon gi ne en ja adhula to min mare ja ngwech, ne owacho.

eng: Last year, she won the Star Challenge under-14 tournament and reached semi finals of the International Tennis Federation Juniors event at Nairobi Club before taking part in ITF Algeria and South Africa Junior championships.
luo: Higa mokalo, ne oloyo e piem mag sulwe mag jo bwo higni 14 kendo ochopo e tielo mag nus fainol, mag tuke tenis mag jomatindo e pinje mane otimore Nairobi Club kapok otugo e ITF Algeria gi Afrika ma Milambo e piem mar jo matindo.

eng: She also put her young muscles to test in a senior competition at the Women’s Futures championship where she reached the quarterfinals, a feat she longs to beat when she makes her senior debut this year.
luo: Bende oketo lechene matindo go e tem epiem madongo mag joma mine kama ne ochopo e kwota fainals, ma bende ogombo yudoe loch koduogoe kendo kotegno higani.

eng: “I can’t wait to play in senior events. Though I am still young, I believe I have what it takes to compete,” she said.
luo: "Agombo ahinya tugo e okang mar jotene, kata obedo ni pod atin, ageno ni an gi gima dwarore mondo ngato opiem," nowacho.

eng: Cheruto, a student at Mbagathi Road Secondary School, hopes to attain a top 100 ITF ranking.
luo: Cheruto japuonjre e Mbagathi Road skul, ogeno yudore ei ji 100 mokuongo e ITF.

eng: She is currently ranked 2279 in the world junior ITF rankings.
luo: Sani en namba 2279 ekwan mag jomatindo ma jo tenis e ITF piny ngima.

eng: She is keen on stepping out of the shadows of her role model and Kenya seed one Angela Okutoyi.
luo: Okichore e choro tiende oko mar tipo mar jal ma sulwe mare kendo kodhi mokwongo mar Kenya Angela Okutoyi.

eng: As a Kenya tennis seed five, Cheruto has huge ambitions -- to take part in French Open, USA Open and Australia Open.
luo: Kaka koth Kenya  mar abich, Cheruto ni gi gombo madongo--mondo okaw kare e tuke mag Kenya Open, Open mar Amerka  kod mar Australia.

eng: “Okutoyi is my role model. What she has achieved in her career is unbelievable. Her determination and hard work inspires me,” Cheruto said, adding that her role model is former World number one Serena Williams.
luo: "Okutoyi e sulwena. Gik ma oseyudo e tije lich miwuoro. Tije matek gi geno mare miya ga mijingo," Cheruto nowacho, komedo ni sulwe mare en mane en namba achiel e piny ngima serena Williams.

eng: Despite the Covid-19 pandemic, she has a training regimen that she adheres to everyday to keep fit.
luo: Kata obedo ni dera mar Covid-19 nitie, en gi chenro modich mar tiegruok ma orito machiegni mondo dende osik ka otegno.

eng: “I was 10 years old when I heard of tennis. Some organisation came to Kibra offering opportunities to children. I gave it a try and gradually I fell in love with the sport because it kept me busy and away from the streets,” she said.
luo: "Ne an ja higni 10 kane akwongo winjo tenis. Migao moro nobiro Kibira ka chiwo thuolo ne rowere. Ne ateme to bange ne ayudo ni ahere ahinya nikech nomiyo abedo modich kendo aweyora gi osiepe maricho.

eng: Veronica Osogo, who is her coach, said Cheruto has a bright future in tennis.
luo: Veronika Osogo ma en japuonj mare wacho ni Cheruto ni nyalo dhi mabor gi tuk tenis.

eng: “Cheruto is a hard-working player. Even with the challenges she faces, tennis has made her focus,” she said.
luo: Ne owacho ni, "Cheruto en jatugo ma tiyo matek. Kata gi chandruok mokaloe, tenis osemiyo okudo pache."

eng: Born and raised in Kibra, Cheruto started playing tennis while in Standard Four at Shadrack Kimalel Primary School.
luo: Onyuole kendo odongo Kibra, Cheruto ne ochako tugo Tenis ka oja klas angwen e skund praimar ma Shadrack Kimalel.

eng: Living in a place where lack of food and proper shelter were the order of the day, Osogo said tennis gave Cheruto solace from squalid lifestyle.
luo: Kodak e aluora ma onge mar chiemokod ot makare e kit dak ma pile, Osogo nowacho ni tenis nomiyo Cheruto kar jot koa ngima mar chandruok.

eng: It was at Shadrack Kimalel Primary School that she stormed into the world stage.
luo: Ne en e Skund Praimar Shadrak Kimalel, ema ne omuomore e alap mar piny ngima.

eng: “I have been carrying out tennis programmes at the school since 2007 and when I saw Cheruto play, I knew at that time she was talented,” she said.
luo: "Asebedo ka atimo tije chenro mag tenis e skund no chakre 2007 to ka ne aneno Cheruto ka tugo, ne angeyo gi sano ni en gi were," nowacho.

eng: Ariel Okall upbeat of success with Titans in Uganda despite debut loss
luo: Ariel Okall oikore matek ne loch gi Titans e Uganda kata obedo ni nowito rakruok no.

eng: Kenya Morans star Ariel Okall is optimistic of succeeding with the Kampala International University(KIU) Titans in the 2021 National Basketball League of Uganda (NBL).
luo: Suluwe mar Kenya Morans Ariel Okall ni gi geno mar kalo maber ka en gi jotenee Mbalariany mar Kampala (KIU) e piem mar opich okapu ma Uganda higa 2021.

eng: The former Kenya Ports Authority forward signed with the Ugandan university side last week from AlBashaer Basketball Club after suspension of sports in Oman due to the coronavirus pandemic.
luo: Ja tugo ma cho ma nyime e Kenya Ports Authority, ne ondikore gi jo Mbalariany Uganda juma mokalo koa e Klab mar AlBashaer mar opich okapu bang chung mar tuke e piny Oman nekech chandruok mar midhusi mar Korona.

eng: Speaking to The Standard Sports from his base in Kampala, Uganda, Okall said he is confident of helping the Ugandan side win trophies.
luo: Kowuoyo gi  Standard Sport e kare Kampala, Uganda, Okal nowacho ni en gi chir mar konyo  jo Uganda yudo okombe.

eng: This is despite a losing debut for the Morans forward whose side went down 56-68 to second placed JKL Dolphins.
luo: Mano kata bang yudo lal kor Moran ma mbele ma korgi ne odhi piny 56-68 ne KKL Dolphins ma ni e thuolo mar ariyo.

eng: “I had a quiet night but I was trying to fit it getting my chemistry with the team. I was just looking to get to my spots and find my rhythm,” said Okall.
luo: "Ne an gi otieno moling, to ne atemoromo eyi kidieny mar jotukwa ka atemo donjora kodgi maber, ne amanyo kara ma aromoe kendo ayud kaka anyalo sudo mayom eiye," Okal nowacho.

eng: Okall scored five points and six rebounds in 24 minutes played with Feisal Aden finishing as Titans leading scorer with 11 points and four rebounds.
luo: Okal ne oloyo gonde abich gi duoko opiche auchiel e dakika 24 mane gitugo giFeisal Aden, gitieko ka Taitans otelo gi poit 11 kod opiche miduoko angwen.

eng: “The Ugandan fans welcomed me very well. You can see even on social media the KIU fans have showed me a lot of love. There is no better way of repaying that than helping the team win games and trophies,” said the former US Setif player.
luo: "Johera ma Uganda norwaka maber ahinya. Unyalo kata neno e mbui mag oganda, johera ma Uganda nonyisa hera mathoth. Onge yo moro machielo mar duoko ne gi mak mana konyo tukwa loyo tuke gi kod yudo okombe.

eng: Okall noted that the NBL is tough and more physical. He said majority of the teams have very good players with lucrative contracts, a step the Kenyan league needs to make in the near future.
luo: Okall nowacho ni NBL tek kendo mar agoko. Ne owacho ni Kidienje ma moko mag jotugo ni gi jotugo ma thoth mabeyo kendo ma ni gi orak mabeyo, ondamo ma jokenya onego go e kinde mabiro machiegni.

eng: “There are sponsors, contracts etc. Nevertheless, I believe we are slowly growing and Kenya will get there soon,” he said.
luo: " Nitiere joket mwandu, orak gi gik mamoko. To kata kamano, ageno ni pod wadongo kendo Kenya biro chop kanyo machiegni," ne owacho.

eng: Titans are currently eighth in the NBL standings with three points after the defeat but with two games in hand.
luo: Taitans sani ni e namba aboro e kwan mag NBL gi point adek bang rem loyo to pod gidong gi tuke ariyo mapok otugi.

eng: Heavyweights City Oilers lead the standings with eight points
luo: Joma pek City Oilers otelo e kwan go gi point aboro.

eng: High school students benefit from Urbanville Basketball camp in Kisumu
luo: Jopuonjre mag sekendar oyudo sir kuom kambi mar tuk okapu gi Urbanville moket Kisumu.

eng: Students from top basketball performing schools who dominate the Kenya Secondary Schools Sports Association (KSSSA) games in the country benefited from a 30-day camp dabbed Urbanville Basketball Camp.
luo: Jopuonjre ma wuok e skunde ma timo maber e tuke mag opich okapu, mokak e tuke mag sikunde sekondar(KSSSA) e kenya noyudo sir mar ndalo 30 mag tiegruok e kambi mochak ni Kambi opich okapu ma Urbanville.

eng: The 2021 edition took off last month in April and attracted over 50 players drawn from the crème de la crème of basketball schools including former KSSSA National basketball champions Agoro Sare High School.
luo: Tuke mag 2021 nochakore dwe mokalo e dwe mar angwen kendo noywayo jotugo 50 mokwany kuo jotugo mabeyoe mogik e skunde matugo mipich okapunyaka ka joloch machon mag KSSSA epiny Kenya Skul mar sekondar Agoro Sare.

eng: The 30-day program conducted at Manyatta Arabs Primary School through a partnership with KBF Premier League side, Lakeside Basketball Club, trained kids on basketball basics and fundamentals.
luo: Chenro mar ndalo 30 mane obagi e skund primar ma Manyata Arabs kokalo kuom riwruok lig maduong mar mipich okapu e Kenya KBF kama kama Klab mar opich okapu mar Lakeside nopuonjo nyithindo tugo opira mar okapu kod chike ne mochuno.

eng: Speaking to The Standard Sports, Urbanville camp director Oliver Nyawanda said they are aiming at becoming the most elite youth basketball program in Western Kenya.
luo: Kowuoyo gi Standard Sport, ogaye mar kambi Urbanville Oliver Nyawanda nowacho ni ging'iyo bedo jotuk opich okapu marahuma ahinya e Kenya ma yimbo.

eng: “We have ambitious plans to run a full sports academy to offer a chance for young boys and girls to grow, develop and nurture respective sports talents.”
luo: " Wan gi gombo maduong mar tayo sikund tiegruok mar opich okapu mopong ma chiwo thuolo ne yawa matindo macwo gi nyiri mondo odongre, olos kendo orit were mag tuke duto kamano."

eng: “The programme’s main goal is to help develop young boys and girls in acquiring basketball skills and knowledge but also basic life skills and mentorship,” said Nyawanda.
luo: "Dwaro maduong mar chenro ni en konyo yawuoyi gi nyiri matindo mondo oyud lony gi riekni mag tugo opich okapu kaachiel koda ka miyo gi tiegruok e yore mag ngima." Nyawanda nowacho.

eng: “More than 15 members of Urbanville basketball have received scholarships to schools and universities in Kenya, East Africa and beyond through the program. We are aiming at increasing the number in the coming years.”
luo: "Mohingo jokanyo 15 mag kar opich okapu mar mar Urbanville oseyudo jip mar dhi nyime gi somo e sikunde kod mbalariany ma Kenya, Africa ma ugwe kod mokalo kanyo e chenro ni. Wachano medo kwan no e higni ma biro."

eng: Angela Akinyi, Jason McOnyango and Vady Omondi during the Urbanville Basteball Camp in Kisumu.
luo: Angela Akinyi, Jason McOnyango gi Vady Omondi e kinde mag kambi mar opich okapu ma Urbanville.

eng: The young players who participated were between 10 to 20 years from Tigoi Girls, Ng’iya Girls, Obunga Girls basketball, Usenge High School and Kisumu Boys High School.
luo: Jotugo matindo mane otugo gi e king higni 10 gi 20 ma wuok e skunde nyiri ma Tigoi, Ng'iya, Obunga opich okapu, Sikund chuo ma Usenge gi Kisumu.

eng: Others included Maseno School, Agoro Sare, Yala High, Rapogi High, Chulaimbo High, Hilcrest Academy, Chesamisi Boys, Kisumu Day, Muslim Secondary, Kanuainga High, Loreto High, Maseno University and JKUAT University.
luo: Ma moko otingo Sikul Maseno, Agoro Sare, Yala, Rapogi, Chulaimbo, Akademi ma Hilcrest, Sikund chuo ma Chesamisi, sikund odiecheng ma Kisumu, sikund secondari mar jo Islam, Kanuainga, Loreto, Mbalariany ma Maseno gi JKUAT.

eng: ‘Core values of the Urbanville basketball programs are based on God, Family, Education, Friendship and finally basketball. We insist on hard work, discipline and determination," added Nyawanda.
luo: " Chuny nyadhi mar weche opich okapu mar Urbanville, otenore kuom Nyasaye, Jo ot, Somo, Osiep to mogik en opich okapu. Wachuno tich matek, luor kod kinda," Nyawanda ne omedo.

eng: Milton Amadi from Usenge High School said he gained a lot of skills from the camp especially during the coronavirus pandemic period that disrupted learning.
luo: Milton Amadi mawuok e skund Sekondar ma Usenge nowacho ni noyudo lony mathoth kowuok e kambi moloyo to e ndalo mag yueyo ma midhusi mar Korona norocho tiegruok.

eng: “This was a great opportunity for me as a student and athlete to go out of my comfort zone. The lessons and training we got will not only improve my stats as a young upcoming basketballer but also better my point of view when we return to class,” Amadi said.
luo: "Ma ne thuolo  ma ber ne an kaka japuonjre kendo jatugo mondo awuog oko mar kar yueyo mara. Tiegruok gi puonj ma ne wayudo ne ok omedo mana kwan maga kaka jatugo mar opich okapu matin ma eka aa, to bende nomedo bero kaka aparo kod neno gik moko ka adwogo e klas,"Amadi nowacho.

eng: Best performers received shoes, cash awards, basketballs, assorted merchanise with some of the notable players included Moses Odhiambo, Marvin Oduor, Fadelis Opiyo, Samwel Otieno, Eudry Pinto ,Beckham Jack, Nigel Omondi, Philip Omondi and Maria Oloo.
luo: Timo maber moloyo ne miyo ngato yudo wuoche, mich mag omenda, opira mag okapu, mwandu moko mopogore opogore, mgijotugo moko midewo kaka Moses Odhiambo , Marvin Oduor, Fedelis Opiyo, Samwel Otieno,Eudry Pinto, Bekham Jack, Nigel Omondi, Philip Omondi gi Maria Oloo.

eng: Previously in 2019, Urbanville in partnership with Big dream Vision helped two players earn a full scholarship to go to school and play basketball in the United States.
luo: Mokalo e higa 2019, Urbanvile koriwore gi Big Dream Vision nokonyo jotugo ariyo yudo sir mar mopong chuth mar dhi e sikul kod tugo opich okapu e piny Amerka.

eng: Urbanville basketball is also planning a program running for all ages for both boys and girls that begins May 16 with short camps in August and December.
luo: Urbanville opich okapu bende loso chenromar jo higni duto ma chuo gi ma nyiri ma chakre tarik 16 dwe mar Abich gi kambe mochan machuok,e dwe mar Aboro kod Apar gariyo.

eng: The next annual camp will be held between March and May 2022 and is expected to be able to accommodate 50 elite players at a 60-day residential camp.
luo: Kambi machielo mar higa ka higa ibiro tim e dwe mar adek gi dwe mar abich 2022, kendo igeno ni obiro tingo jotugo 50 mong'ith e ndalo 60 mag tiegruok e yor dak.

eng: Basketball: US-based Koranga to lead Kenya ahead of Afrobasket Qualifiers
luo: Opich okapu: Ja Amerka Koranga mondo otel ne Kenya nyime ne laro otiko mag Afrobasket.

eng: US-based forward Felmas Koranga of NCAA side Troy University has been named in a strong Kenya national women's basketball team made up of 24-players ahead of the Afro basket qualifiers to be staged in Cairo in June.
luo: Jatugo ma nyime ma Felmas Koranga mar kor NCCA ma Mbalariany ma Troy oseluong e kidieny mar Kenya ma otegno ma mon mar opich okapu ma otingo jotugo 24 motelo ne laro otiko mar Afro basket ma biro timore Cairo.

eng: Kenya Basketball Federation (KBF) named the squad with the main objective of starting early preparations for the qualifiers which will feature Rwanda, Uganda, Burundi,Tanzania, Somalia and hosts Egypt in the Zone V qualifiers.
luo: Riwruok mar opich okapu mar Kenya (KBF) ne olando jotukgi ka gichano chako ikruok machon ne piem mar larro otiko ma biro tingo jo Rwanda, Uganda, Burundi, Tanzania, Somalia gi jobag tukego Egypt e laro otiko mag jo Zone V.

eng: Fresh from being named the Sun Belt Newcomer of the Year in the US, Koranga will lead a foreign legion comprising of Victoria Wanjara, Brenda Wasuda and Clara Rotich, all who are based in the United States.
luo: Konyien koa kuom luong mare kaka jabiro manyien mar Sunbelt mar higa e piny Amerka, Koranga birotelone kidieny ma wendo motingo Victor Wanjara, Brenda Wasuda, gi Clara Rotich, duto ma ni e piny Amerka.

eng: Mercy Wanyama (Spain), Georgia Adhiambo (Rwanda), Rose Ouma (Dubai) and Purity Auma (Bangladesh) complete the list of foreign based stars.
luo: Mercy Wanyama (Spain), Georgia Adhiambo (Rwanda) Rose Ouma (Dubai) gi Purity Auma (Bangladesh) tieko kwan mag suluwe moa oko.

eng: KPA captain Vilma Achieng will lead the locally assembled stars including sharp shooter Becky Muthoni, Melissa Akinyi, Selina Okumu, Taudencia Katumbi and Rita Okoth among others.
luo: Kapten mar KPA Vilma Achieng birotelone suluwe mochoki e pacho  motingo jasaba mang'ula Becky Muthoni, Melisa Akinyi, Selina Okumu, Taudencia Katumbi gi Rita Okoth e kind mamoko.

eng: Youngsters Medina Okot from Coast’s Kaya Tiwi Secondary School and Ashley Minayo of Riara University also made the cut in the team consisting of a blend of youth and experience.
luo: Sulwe mapod tin Medina Okot mawuok e skund secondar Coast Kaya Tiwi, gi Ashley Minayo mar Mbalariany Riara bende ne ongado e kidieny no motingo rawere gi jo tene.

eng: Speaking after releasing the squad, KBF Secretary-General Ambrose Kisoi also announced that former assistant coach George Mayienga will be taking charge as the new national women's basketball team head coach.
luo: Kowuoyo bang gonyo kidieny no, Jagoro mongirore mar KBF Ambrose Kisoi bende nolando ni jalup japuonj George Mayienga biro kawo ting kaka japuonj maduong mar jotuk opich okapu ma mine.

eng: Mayienga who is currently in Uganda with the JKL Dolphines men and women's teams, will be assisted by KPA's Mike Opel, Eagle Wings coach Eunice Ouma and Strathmore University's Tony Ochieng.
luo: Mayienga ma sani ni Uganda gi kidieny mar joma yawuoyi gi nyiri ibiro sir gi mar KPA Mike Opel, Japuonj mar Eagles Wings  Eunice Ouma gi Tony Ochieng mar Mbalariany ma Strathmore.

eng: “We want to start early preparations to ensure Kenya regains their top spot in the region after finishing second behind Uganda during the last qualifiers held in Kampala two years ago,”said Kisoi.
luo: "Wadwa chako ikruok ma chon mondo omi Kenya otel e thuologi mokuongo bang tieko e thuolo mar ariyo etok Uganda e kinde mag laro otiko mokalo manotimore Kampala higni ariyo mokalo," Kisoi nowacho.

eng: Kenya Morans coach Lizz Mills has also been drafted into the technical bench alongside Sylvia Kamau of Equity Bank.
luo: Koch mar Kenya Morans, Liz Mills bende osegor e kwan mbero mar jolony kaachiel gi Syivia Kamau mar bengi Equity.

eng: Kisoi said the federation has blended the team with both the young and experienced players to ensure continuity, adding that the team is expected to start training on April 30.
luo: Kosoi nowacho ni riwruok osekiko  kanyakla mar jotugo motingo rawere kod jotene mondo okel dhi nyime, komedo ni jotugo go onego chak tiegruok e dwe mar angwen tarik 30.

eng: National women’s Basketball team-Felmas Koranga (USA), Mercy Wanyama (Spain), Victoria Wanjara (USA), Clara Rotich (USA), Purity Auma (Bagladesh), Brenda Adhiambo (USA), Rose Ouma (UAE), Mary Lisa (KPA), Natalie Akinyi (KPA), Melisa Akinyi (Equity), Velma Achieng (KPA), Selina Okumu (KPA),Georgia Adhiambo ( Rwanda),Christine Akinyi (Zetech), Jemmimah Knight (Storms), MaryAnne Nyagaki (Equity), Liz Okumu (UON), Medina Okot (KAYA Tiwi), Ritah Oluoch (Equity), Becky Muthoni (KPA), Taudencia Katumbi (KPA) and Ashley Minayo (Riara) Head Coach-George Mayienga,
luo: Kidieny mar jotugo ma wakeyni mar opich okapu - Felmas Koranga, (USA), Mercy Wanyama (Spain), Victoria Wanjara (USA), Clara Rotich (USA), Purity Auma (Bangladesh),Brenda Adhiambo (USA), Rose Ouma, (UAE), Mary Lisa (KPA), Natalie Akinyi, Melisa Akinyi (Equity), Velma Achieng (KPA), Selina Okumu (KPA),Georgia Adhiambo (Rwanda), ,Christine Akinyi (Zetech), Jemmimah Knight (Storms), MaryAnne Nyagaki (Equity), Liz Okumu (UON), Medina Okot (KAYA Tiwi), Ritah Oluoch (Equity), Becky Muthoni (KPA), Taudencia Katumbi (KPA) gi Ashley Minayo (Riara) japuonj maduog-George Mayienga,

eng: Why Morans new star Bungei chose basketball over athletics
luo: Gima omiyo sulwe manyien mar Moran Bungei ne oyiero tugo opich okapu koweyo ng'wech.

eng: Preston Kiprono Bungei is a true Moran.
luo: Preston Kiprono Bungei en Moran ma adieri.

eng: The American-Kenyan basketball star debuted for Kenya at the Afrobasket Qualifiers played in Cameroon earlier this year in February.
luo: Suluwe ma ja tuk Kenya ma ja Amerka ne otugo ne Kenya e  laro otiko mar Afrobasket ma ne otug Cameroon motelo e higani dwe mar ariyo.

eng: Bungei was among the 12 players that helped Kenya Morans, the national men’s basketball team, qualify for the 2021 Afrobasket tournament for the first time in 28 years.
luo: Bungei ne en achiel kuom jotugo mane okonyo Kenya Morans, team maduon mar piny mar joma chuo, oyudo otiko mar piem mag Afrobasketbal e kinde mokwongo  ei higni 28.

eng: Currently playing for Randers Cimbria Basketball in BasketLigaen, the top league in Denmark, Bungei’s is eyeing to win the Danish Cup after helping his team reach the semifinals playoffs of the cup championship where they will face Horsens on Thursday.
luo: Ma sani tugo ne jotuk opich okapu ma ma Randers Cimbiria, e BsketLigaen, lig maduong e Denmark, Bungei ngiyo loyo Okombe mar Danish bang konyo tim ne chiopo  e nus fainol mar tukego kama gibiro rakore gi Horsens chieng Thursday.

eng: The Standard Sports caught up with the Bungei from his base in Denmark through a phone interview where the basketballer whose roots run deep into the Kalenjin athletic regime narrated his story as follows in a question and answer session.
luo: Standard Sport ne oyudore gi Bungei koa e kare Denmark e penjo mag sime, kama jatuk opich okapu ma tiendene odonjo matut ei jongwech ma Kalenjin ne ogoyo sigande kama kaka penjo gi duoko  go dhi ni.

eng: When and where were you born?
luo: Kanye gi karango mane onyuolie?

eng: I was born and raised in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
luo: Ne onyuola kendo adongo Mexico manyien, Alquerque.

eng: I’ve lived there my whole life until I left for university.
luo: Ne adak kuno kinde duto mag ngima na naya awuok ka adhi e mbalariany.

eng: I’m the only child from my mother and father’s marriage.
luo: An e nyathi kenda e kend mar minwa gi wuonwa.

eng: I have two sisters from my mom’s second marriage.
luo: An gi nyiminena ariyo ma owuo e kend mar ariyo mar mamawa.

eng: Their names are Grace and Carly.
luo: Nyinge gi gin Grace gi Carly.

eng: Grace is 16 and Carly is 14.
luo: Grace en 16 gi Carly en 14.

eng: Did your parents play any sport?
luo: Be jonyuolni ne otugo tugo moro amora?

eng: If yes, which ones and to what level did they reach
luo: Ka Ee, to ne gin tuke mage, ne gi chopo e ranginy mane?

eng: Both my parents ran cross-country and track.
luo: Jonyuolna duto ne jotugo ne giringo ngwe ng'ado gwenge gi mag alap mar ngwech.

eng: They both attended Lubbock Christian University in Texas on running scholarships, which is where they met.
luo: Giduto ne gi dhi e tiegruok e mbalariany mar jokristo Lubock e Texas kuom sir mabiro nekech nguech kendo mano e kama ne gromoe.

eng: My father was a 4-time individual national champion, and in turn, lead his team to 4 national championships as well.
luo: Wuonwa ne en jaloch ma nyadi ngwen ma bange kendo notelo te kidieny ne e piem mag tukego nyadi ngwen bende.

eng: My father turned professional after graduating from LCU and had a career spanning 10 years from 1995-2005.
luo: Wuonwa nolokore jalony bang kose sidho ogudu mar somo e LCU kendo ne en gi tij lony ma dhi nyaka higni 10 chakre 1995 - 2005.

eng: He most notably finished in 2nd place in his first-ever marathon at the LA Marathon in 1999 finishing in a time of 2:10:43.
luo: Ma ochuno ni nyaka nge, en ni notieko e thuolo mar ariyo e ngwech ne mokwongo mar ng'ado gwenge e higa mar 1999 kotieko e sa mar 2:10:43.

eng: Kenya Morans Forward Preston Bungei (left) in action against Senegal during the Afrobasket Qualifiers.
luo: Ja Kenya Moran ma nyime Preston Bungei (koracham) e rakruok gi jo Senegale kinde mag laro otiko mag Afrobasket.

eng: Which sport did you play growing up?
luo: Tuke mage mane itugo ki dongo?

eng: I ran cross-country (but not track, I quit running track after 8th grade) up until 11th grade.
luo: Ne aringo ngwech mag ngado kor gwenge( to ok mag alap, ne aweyo ringo ng'wech mag ngado kor gwenge e kilas 8) malo nyaka e kilas 11.

eng: I also played basketball all 4 years and stopped running cross-country after 11th grade to focus on basketball for my last year of high school
luo: Bende ne atugo opich okapu higni angwen duto to aweyo ringo ng'wech mag kor gwenge e klas 11 mondo achikra tir gi opich okapune hika mogik e sikund sekondar.

eng: When did you start playing Basketball?
luo: Ne Ichako tugo opich okapu kar ang'o?

eng: I began playing basketball when I was 5 years old.
luo: Ne Achako tugo opich okapu ka a ja higni a bich.

eng: Why did you choose Basketball despite other sports? What made you decide to play Basketball?
luo: Ang'o momiyo niyiero tuk opich okapu to ok tuke mamoko? Ang'o ma nomiyo iyiero tugk opich okapu?

eng: My mother started me in basketball when I was 5 because most of my family on my mom’s side were basketball players.
luo: Mama wa nochaka e opich okapu no ka aja higni 5 nekech jowa duto ma kor gi mamawa ne jotugo mag opich okapu.

eng: My grandfather, Phillip Harmon, played for Kansas University in the 1960’s.
luo: Kwarwa, Philip Harmon, ne otugo ne Mbalariany mar Kansas e higni mag 1960.

eng: My aunt and uncle also played basketball growing up and in high school.
luo: Waya na kod Nera na bende ne otugo opich okapu ka gingo kendo nyaks e sikul mar sekondar.

eng: When I was about 2 or 3 my mom got me a plastic hoop for Christmas and she said I would just stand there and shoot on it all day long.
luo: Kan a e kind higa 2 - 3 mama wa nonyiewona gol mar plastik kaka mich mar Krismas to nowacho ni ne anyalo siko ka goyo e saba odiecheng te.

eng: So she signed me up as soon as I was old enough to start playing in the local youth team.
luo: Koro ne ondika mondo achak tugo mapiyo kane aromo tugo girawere.

eng: After high school, how did you progress with Basketball?
luo: Bang somo mar Sekondar ere kaka ne idhi nyime di tuk opich okapu?

eng: After high school, I attended Trinidad State Junior College, in Trinidad Colorado from 2013-2015.
luo: Bang sekondar nadhi e kolej mar Trinidad State Junior, ma ni Trinidad Colorado chakre 2013 - 2015.

eng: Junior Colleges, are two-year schools so while there I was on a basketball scholarship and earned my associates degree.
luo: Somo mar Kolej go gi higni 2 koro ka ne an kuno ne an e sir mar somo mar opich okapu omiyo nayudo ogudu na mar asosiet.

eng: After that, I earned a scholarship to Norfolk State University (NCAA Division 1) in Norfolk Virginia.
luo: Bang mano ne ayudo sir mar Mbalariany Norfolk State (NCAA Division1) e Norfolk Virginia.

eng: I played my first season there 2015-2016, but in the fall of my senior season (2016-2017) I injured my elbow which required surgery and I had to miss the whole season.
luo: Natugo e kinde na mokuongo kanyo 2015 - 2016, to e podho mar kinde na motegno (2016 -2017) ne a hinyo okumbo na mane dwaro bero kendo nochuna ni mondo abed oko e kinde no duto.

eng: I came back and played my redshirt senior season in 2017-2018.
luo: Naduogo mi atugo otamba makwar e kieny mar jo tene 2017-2018.

eng: During your early stages of playing Basketball, who mentored and trained you?
luo: Ndalo ni mokwongo mag tugo opich okapu, ngano ma ne otiegi kendo ojiwi e tugo opich okapu?

eng: Kenya Morans Forward Preston Bungei (left) in action for Randers Cimbria against Bakken Bears in the Denmark League.
luo: Ja Kenya Moran ma nyime Preston Bungei (koracham) e rakruok ne jo Randers Cimbria gi Bakken Bears e lig mar Denmark.

eng: Growing up, I learned the fundamentals from the various teams that I played on.
luo: Ka adongo, ne apuojora gik mochuno kuom kidienje duto mane atugo e.

eng: The coaches would teach you the basics of passing, dribbling, shooting, etc.
luo: Jopuonj ne nyalo puonji diro ne ngato, minruok e kind ji gi loyo kod ma moko.

eng: I would also go outside and shoot on my hoop in the drive way and practice different moves that I would see NBA players doing when I would watch the games.
luo: Be ne anyalo ga dhi loyo e gonda  e pap kod puonjruok tugo e yore moko ma ne ane ga ka jotugo molony timo ka arango gi e tipo.

eng: I learned more technical skills in high school.
luo: Ne apuonjora weche lony mathoth e skund sekondar.

eng: My coaches did a good job of teaching the principles of having proper foot work, using both hands, dribbling with your eyes up, reading screens, etc.
luo: Jopuonj na notimo tich maber kuom puonja chike kod tiyo tij tielo makare, tiyo gi lwedo ariyo, minruok e kind ji ka ichiko wangi malo, somo ndiko e tipo kod mamoko.

eng: My mentor and the person I looked up to is Jorel Johnson.
luo: Jatach na ke ndo ngama chiko wanga kuome en Jarel Johnson.

eng: He and his family are close friends as we attend the same church.
luo: En gi joodgi gin osiepewa ma chiegni ahinya kendo wadhi kodgi e kanisa achiel.

eng: Our families have known each other since before I was born.
luo: Anyuola wa osebedo ka ongere ga kata ka ne pok onyuola.

eng: Jorel is 4 years older than me and I’ve always looked up to him as an older brother.
luo: Jerel oyomba gi higni 4 kendo asega bedo ka agene kaka owadwa ma duong.

eng: He was a very good basketball player himself, so he would always help me practice and teach me things about how to be a successful player.
luo: Ne en jatugo maber mar opich okapu en owuon, koro ne oja puonja ga tugo, kod kaka anyalo bedo jatugo ma dhi maber.

eng: I without a doubt wouldn’t be where I am today if it wasn’t for him.
luo: Ka di ne ok en di koro ok an kama antie kawuono.

eng: Kindly list some of your personal achievements
luo: Kuom ng'uono yie ifulie moko kuom gik ma iseloyo.

eng: What is the most memorable moment in your playing career?
luo: Ang'o ma gin kinde mag rapar madongo e ndalo ni kaka jatugo?

eng: Honestly, representing Kenya and upsetting Angola has been the most memorable moment in my career to date.
luo: Adier chung e lo Kenya kod kuodo wi Angola osebedo kinde moko mag rapar madongo e tijani nyaka kawuono.

eng: To be able to be a part of history and help guide the country back to Afrobasket for the first time in nearly 30 years, there’s nothing else in a career that can top that feeling currently.
luo: Nyalo bedo bath sigana kod konyo piny chopo e piem mag Afobasket e tielo mokwongo ahinya ei machiegni higni 30, onge gimoro machielo manyalo kalo mano kuom rapar duto gi sani.

eng: What are some of your experiences playing basketball? Lessons learnt?
luo: Ango gini ma iseromo go e tugo mar opich okapu? Puonj mage misesomo?

eng: There are many parallels in basketball, or any sport, and life.
luo: Nitie gik moko ma ok nyal romo e opich okapu kata tuke ma moko e ngima.

eng: Sports are a powerful tool which can help to teach valuable life lessons in a way that most other things can’t.
luo: Tuke gin gik ma rateke ma inyalo tigo e chiwo puonj puonjo man gi nengo e ngima e yo ma gik ma moko ok nyal.

eng: For me personally, I’ve learned from basketball about determination, sacrifice, and battling through adversity.
luo: Ne an awuon asesomo kowuok kuom opich okapu weche mag geno, chiwruok, gi kedo ei chandruok.

eng: I was ranked as the 17th best player in my senior class in the state of New Mexico, which isn’t known for producing high level basketball talent.
luo: Ne orieda kaka jatuo maber e thuolo mar 17 ekidieny mar joma otegno e piny mar New Mexico ma bende ok onge e golo jotugo mabeyo man gi were ma malo e opich okapu.

eng: Hardly anyone thought that I was good enough to play in college, and I used that to motivate me to work that much harder and prove them wrong.
luo: Ngang' ne onge ngama ne ong'eyo ni anyalo bedo maber moromo tugo e Kolej, to natiyo gi mano mar miyora mijing'o mar tiyo matek mondo akwed paro gi no.

eng: I only had one scholarship offer after I finished high school which is how I ended up at Trinidad State Junior College (TSJC).
luo: Ne an mana gi chiwruok achiel mar sir mag somo bang' tieko somo e Sekondar ma bende e kaka ne ayiudora e Kolej mar Trinidad State Junior (TSJC).

eng: After my two years at TSJC, I only had one scholarship offer which was to Norfolk State University (NSU).
luo: Bang' higni maga ariyo e TSJC, ne ayudo mana sir achiel mar somo ma ne dhi e Mbalariany mar Norfolk (NSU).

eng: I was always determined to do what it took to play NCAA Division 1 basketball and God blessed me with that opportunity.
luo: Ne aikora ga mar timo gik moko duto ma ne dwarore mondo atug opich okapu e NCAA Division 1 to Nyasaye nonogwedha gi thuolo no.

eng: I also learned that you have to be willing to sacrifice certain things to achieve your dreams.
luo: Bende ne asepuonjora ga ni nyaka ibed gi chuny mar tuonruok gik moko mondo ichop lek magi.

eng: For me, I had to sacrifice time spent hanging out with my friends.
luo: Anto ne ochuna atuonora seche ma abudho go gi osiepe.

eng: While they were out partying and having fun, I was at the gym working on my craft and getting better.
luo: Kane gin oko kanyo ka giwinjo maber kendo gimor, ne an eod orako ka atiyo matek kendo ka amedo berora.

eng: I had to really narrow down my circle of friends and prioritize my time with the ones who had the same mindset as me.
luo: Ne ochuna ni mondo adi aluora na mar osiepe kendo ne ayiero dong mana gi osiepe mani gi paro machal gi mara.

eng: As far as adversity goes, I had to have a major operation that required 7 months of physical therapy.
luo: mna kaka chandruok dhi, ne nyaka adh e bero mane dwaro ni nyaka akaw dweche 7 mag thieth mar ringruok.

eng: Initially, I was having to go 2 times a day 5 days a week so that I could regain the range of motion in my elbow, otherwise, it would’ve been permanently locked up and not straight.
luo: Chon ne chuna ni nyaka adhi diriyo ndalo abich e juma mando okumbo na onyal tiyo makare, ka ok kamano, dine omoko matek kendo ka ok oriere.

eng: Mentally, going through the recovery process is very hard.
luo: Gi eparo, kalo e yor chang tek ahinya.

eng: I couldn’t use my dominant arm for everyday tasks and I didn’t know how my shot would be once I finished the rehab process.
luo: Ne ok anayal tiyo gi lweta ma ongiyo, e tiyo tije na mapile ka pile kendo ne ok angeyo kaka loyo done obedo na ka asetieko kindenda mag kwo.

eng: It’s also difficult sitting on the sidelines the whole season and watching your team take the floor every night without you.
luo: Bende en gima tek oko kinde duto mag tugo ka ing'iyo mana kaka jou tugo oyieno ka otieno ka into ionge kodgi.

eng: I had to fight through the physical and mental pain of that injury and rehab process to get back to being the player that I knew I could be.
luo: Ne nyaka aked ei rem mar ringruok gi mar paro kuom hinyruok na , kod ndalo na mag kwo mondo adog abed jatugo mane anyalo bedo.

eng: These are all lessons and experiences that you aren’t able to get from a lot of other sources.
luo: Magi gin puoj kod lony, ma ok inyal yudo koa kuonde mamoko ma diyudie.

eng: My main goals for the next five years are to begin playing the Australian NBL (top league in Australia), purchase a house, and start a family with my wife.
luo: Dwaro na maduong moloyo e higni Abich ma biro, en chako tugo Australian NBL (lig ma duong e Australia), nyiewo ot kod chako anyuola gi chiega.

eng: This year my main focus is on Afrobasket and doing everything I can to help us have a good showing and surprise a lot of people with our performance there.
luo: Higani kama aketoe tekre na en Afrobasket kod timo duto ma anyalo mondo okonywa e nyisruok ma kare kendo buogo ji mathoth gi tijwa.

eng: I also am focused on our World Cup Qualifiers and helping Kenya qualify for its first ever World Cup.
luo: An bende achiko wang'a e otikowa mar okombe mar piny ma ngima gi konyo Kenya ngado otiko mare mokuongo nyaka nene mar laro okombe mar piny ngima.

eng: As I stated early my main plan is to play in the Australian NBL and have success there.
luo: Kaka ne asewacho motelo dwaro na maduong en tugo e Australia NBL gi yudo gik ma agombo duto kanyo.

eng: Playing in the NBL will allow me to be with my wife for the majority of the year, rather than being separated for 8-9 months while I’m in Europe playing.
luo: Tugo e NBL biro miyo abed gi chiega kinde mangeny e higa, mopogore gi bedo mabor kode dweche 8-9 ka atugo e piny Yurop.

eng: Off the court, I enjoy travelling and exploring new places.
luo: Oko mar pap, a winjo maber ka abayo kendo afwenyo kuonde manyien.

eng: I’m pretty simple though and just like to relax and hang out with friends and family when I do have time off.
luo: A timora nono ahinya to ahero kwe kendo budho gi osiepena kod anyuola na oko ka an gi thuolo ma oko.

eng: I currently play in Basket Ligaen, which is the top league in Denmark.
luo: Sani atugo ne Basket Ligaen, ma e lig maduong e Denmark.

eng: The league is split into two categories, Pro A (which mine and Tylor’s team compete in) and Pro B. The league consists of 10 teams of which the top 8 qualify for playoffs.
luo: Lig no opog e kidienje ariyo, Pro A (ma ema jowa kod jo gi Tylor piemie) gi Pro B. Lig no oting'o kidienje apar mag jotugo ma kidienje aboro motelo yudo thuolo mar yawo tuke.

eng: My team doesn't compete in any international competitions and only plays games against the teams in Basket Ligaen.
luo: Kidieny mara okpiem e tuke moro amora mag pinje ma oko,to otugo mana gi kidienje ma tugo e Basket Ligean.

eng: Since I grew up in the States, I didn’t know of any Kenyan basketball players.
luo: To nokech ne adongo loka, ne ok ang'eyo jatugo moro amora mar opich okapu ma Kenya.

eng: My favourite player growing up and of all time was Kobe Bryant, so he is the one that I looked up to.
luo: Jatuka ma nageno ahinya e dongo na duto ne en Kobe Bryant, en ema ne achiko wang'a kuome.

eng: Jordan to be Bryant's presenter at Hall of Fame enshrinement
luo: Jordan mondo obed ja kaw kar Bryant e kiru mar Hall of Fame.

eng: Former NBA star Kobe Bryant, CEO of Kobe Inc, speaks at the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, U.S., May 3, 2016
luo: Suluwe ma chon mar NBA Kobe Bryant, Jatelo mar Kobe Inc, wuoyo e kar tiegruok mar Milken Institute Global Conference mani Beverly Hills, e California, America dwe mar Abich tarik 3 higa 2016.

eng: Michael Jordan will be Kobe Bryant's presenter when the Los Angeles Lakers great is inducted posthumously into the Basketball Hall of Fame next month.
luo: Michael Jordan ema biro ja chung kar Bryant ka Los Angeles Lakers chiwe ayanga bang tho mare, e Basketbal Hall of Fame dwe ma nyien.

eng: Bryant, a five-time NBA champion with the Lakers, died last year aged 41 in a helicopter crash alongside his daughter and seven others, shocking the world of sport and sending fans into mourning.
luo: Bryant, jaloch nya dibich mar NBA ka en gi Lakers, notho higa mokalo ka en jahigni 41 e ndek kalapapla gi nyare kaachiel gi ji abiryo moko, kokelo buok maduong ne piny tuke kendo keto johera mag tuke e yuagruok.

eng: He will be inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame class of 2020 alongside the likes of Tim Duncan and Kevin Garnett on May 15.
luo: Ibiro sidhe ayanga ei Naismith Memoria Basketball Hall of Fame e klas mar 2020 kaachiel gi machalo Tim Duncan gi Kevin Garnet tarik 15 dwe mar abich.

eng: Members of the Class of 2020 were asked to select previous inductees to present them to their peers during the ceremony.
luo: Jokanyo mag klas 2020 ne okwa ni mindo gi yier jochung mabiro chung ne gi e nyim mbese gi e kinde nyasi no.

eng: Lakers guard Bryant, who idolised Jordan growing up, will be presented by the six-time champion, who made an emotional speech at his memorial.
luo: Jo Lakers orito Bryant, ma bende ne oketo Jordan kaka kido ka odongo, ibiro kaw kare gi jaloch nyadi uchiel ma ne ochiwo neno ma kelo kuyo kod lit ahinya e kinde rapar mare.

eng: Jordan, who led the Chicago Bulls' dynasty in the 1990s and currently owns the Charlotte Hornets, will also present Baylor women's basketball coach Kim Mulkey for her enshrinement.
luo: Jordan , mane otelo ne thuondi mag  Ruedhi ma Chicago (Chicago Bulls) e higni mag 1090 to sani en gi Charlotte Hornets, bende biro chung' ne japuonj mar opich okapu mar wakeyni ma ma Baylor, Kim Mulkey mondo okuong're.

eng: Former Houston Rockets coach Rudy Tomjanovich and 10-time WNBA All-Star Tamika Catchings are among the other members of the highly anticipated Class of 2020.
luo: Japuonj machon mar Houston Rockets Rudy Tomjanovich gi ja loch mar higni apar Suluwe ma kinde duto Tamika Cathingse moko kuoim jo thiringinyi ma ogen ahinya e kilas 2020.

eng: Bryant, an 18-time NBA All-Star, retired from the league in 2016 after one of the most decorated careers in basketball history, and is the NBA's fourth all-time leading scorer.
luo: Bryant, jaloch nyadi 18 e NBA ndalo duto no dhi e yueyo mar rutaya ne lig e higa 2016 bang achiel kuom tije ma owir ahinya e sigana mar opich okapu, kendo ja lo gonde mang'ula namba angwen.

eng: Bungei not ready to drop the ball playing for Kenya Morans
luo: Bungei ok oikore bolo opira piny ka otugo ne Kenya Morans

eng: Currently staring for Randers Cimbria in Denmark, Bungei wants to help Kenya qualify for World Cup after the Afrobasket.
luo: Sani ka obedo suluwe ne Randers Cimbira e Denmark, Bungei dwaro ni okony Kenya oyud otiko mar laro okombe mar piny mangima bang' Afrobasket.

eng: There may never be another basketball player as supreme as Michael Jordan.
luo: Samoro ok nochak obedie jatuk opich okapu ma thiringinyi kendo molony ka Jordan

eng: The argument of who truly deserves the title of ‘Greatest Basketball Player’ is a complicated one, not immune from the interesting nuances of subjectivity.
luo: Mino ewach ni to ng'ano ma adieri owinjore gi sidho ogudu mar jatuk opich okapu maduongie moloyo en wach ma iye ogajore, ok opondo ne kuotho moko mamit ma dhiroe ng'ato.

eng: There will always be those who favour the explosive brilliance of Jordan or the electrifying, self-destructive ingenuity of Kobe Bryant; not to mention the more recent claims staked by the entrancing contemporary works of modern great LeBron James.
luo: Biroga bedoe jok ma siro ber mag Jordan mothianyore e lela, kata oyuma moko mager ka sitima mag kethruok kende mag Kobe Bryant; ka on owachi manyocha otimore machiegni ahinya, lieko ma

eng: Preston Kiprop Bungei may not fall amongst the category of the three great basketball players, but he is a rare kind of an athlete.
luo: Preston Kiprono Bungei samoro ok nyal lwar e kind jotugo adek madongo mag opich okapu, to kata kamano en jatugo ma yore.

eng: Few get the chance to reach a continental final stage in their respective sports in a lifetime, let alone do what he has achieved in his six years as college and professional basketball player.
luo: Ji matin ema yudo ga thuolo mar chopo e fainol e tuke gi mopogore opogore engima gi duto we kata mana yudo thuolo mar timo gik ma osebedo koyudo e higni auchiel mag tiegruok mare kaka jalony mar opich okapu.

eng: “I’ve learned so much to do with determination, sacrifice, and battling through adversity,” Bungei told the Standard Sports during an interview from his base in Denmark.
luo: "Asepuonjora mathoth motudore gi geno, chiwruok gi kedo eyi tembe," Bungei nowacho ne Standard Sport e kinde mag penjo kod mabaka e kare Denmark.

eng: “Very few people thought that I was good enough to play in college, and I used that to motivate me to work harder and prove them wrong.”
luo: "Ji matin ahinya mane paro ni ne aber moromo tugo e mbalariany, to ne atiyo gi mano mondo ojiwa kendo afweny ne gi ni ne ok gingeyo."

eng: Making his debut this year in the national basketball men’s team, Kenya Morans, Bungei said playing for the national team has been his biggest achievement in basketball.
luo: Ka ne odonjo e tugo mar jo opich okapu ma chuo higani ma Kenya Morans, Bungei nowacho ni tugo ne tim mar pin Kenya osebedo yuto ne maduong moloyo e opich okapu.

eng: “Kenya is a part of my heritage. It’s my father’s country, where he was born and raised. All of my father’s family members still live in Kapsabet.”
luo: " Kenya en gikeni mara, en piny gi wuonwa, kama nonywwwolee kendo odongoe. Anyuolo gi wuonwa duto pod odak Kapsabet."

eng: “Kenyans work harder and more determined than any other group of people that I’ve met in basketball especially with the limited facilities. The country is beautiful. Even though I grew up in the US, Kenya feels like my second home,” said Bungei.
luo: "Jokenya tiyo matek kendo ni gi chuny moloyo jomoko duto ma ase romo go e opich okapu moloyo to gi gige tugo go ma ok oromo. Piny no jaber. Kata obedo ni ne adongo e pinje ma loka, Kenya chalo mana kaka dala wa mar ariyo," Bungei nowacho.

eng: Earlier in February, Bungei was among the 12 players who helped Kenya qualify for the 2021 Afrobasket tournament for the first time in 28 years.
luo: Motelo e dwe mar Ariyo, Bungei ne achiel kuom jotugo 12 mane okonyo Kenya ngado otiko mag donjo e piem mar Afrobasket nya di mokuongo e higni 20.

eng: His journey to playing for the national team began on a rather bumpy ride after FIBA prevented him from playing because he did not have a permanent Kenyan passport.
luo: Wuodhe ka odhi e kidieny ma tugo ne pinygi, nochakore e yo ma ochuanyore ochuanyore matin bang ka FIBA otame etugo nikech ne oonge gi otiko mochwere mar bedo e kenya.

eng: Watching the competition from the sidelines, Bungei’s absence from the court was felt as Morans got narrow success in the first round after beating Mozambique 79-62 in their final match after previously losing to Senegal and Angola in Group B.
luo: Ka ni ng'iyo tugo no gi e bath pap, onge mar Bungei ne onenore ayanga ka jo Morans tony gi loch modhero e tielo mokuongo bang' goyo Mozambique 79-62 e tik gi mogik ka ne oselogi gi Senegal kod Angola e Girup B.

eng: “I was disappointed after all the preparations and time and then learning you’re not able to play, it hurt,” said Bungei.
luo: "Ne ane marach ahinya ka bang' ikruok duto gi seche kae to bange ifwenyo ni ok idhi tugo, olit," Bungei nowacho.

eng: But in February, he was handed the opportunity to don the Kenyan colours and despite losing 69-51 to Senegal, Bungei finished the match as Kenya’s best player with 11 points.
luo: To ka ne Ochopo e dwe mar Ariyo ne omiye thuolo mar rwakore gi rangi mag Kenya kata obedo ni ne ologi e tugo no gi Senegal 69-51, Bungei notieko tugo no kaka jatugo maber mogik mar Kenya gi point 11.

eng: He followed his impressive debut performance with another 10 points in Kenya’s historic 74-73 win over Angola, a victory that saw them qualify for the Afrobasket set to be held in Rwanda this year.
luo: Ne oluwo tuke maber no gi tich moro machielo mar point 10 e sigand Kenya ma ne giloyo Angola 74-73, loch mane omiyo goyudo otiko mar donjo e Afrobasket ma onego timre e higa ni.

eng: “I just can’t describe the feeling. Tylor hitting the game winning shot and us qualifying, is a memory that I’ll carry with me forever,” said Bungei.
luo: "Ok anyal kata nyiso kit mor ma an go. Tylor ka loyo gol ma kelo loch  kod gin ka giyudo otiko, en rapar ma abiro tingo nyaka chieng'," Bungei nowacho.

eng: “I give credit to this group of players who started this journey to or three years ago, when nobody knew or cared about who the Morans were. And yes, I plan to continue playing for the Morans moving forward for as long as they’ll have me and want me on board.”
luo: " Achiwo puoch je kidieny mar jotugo ma ne ochako tugo ni higni ariyo kata adek mokalo, e kinde ma ne onge kata ng'ama dewo ni Morans gin ng'ano gini. To ee, achano tugo ne jo Morans ka dhi nyime kuom kinde duto ma gini bed koda kata dwara mondo abed kodgi."

eng: The forward player, who currently plays for Randers Cimbria in Denmark, dreams of honouring his father who died in 2011 by helping Kenya win a continental championship.
luo: Jatugo ma nyime, ma sani tugo ne Randers Cimbira e Denmark, ni gi lek mar chiwo luor ne wuon mare mane otho e higa mar 2011, kokonyo Kenya loyo piem mag Continental Championship.

eng: Bungei, who carries athletic genes from his late father James Bungei, was born and raised in Albuquerque, New Mexico in 1995.
luo: Bungei, ma otingo nyiriri mag nyodo mar jang'wech kowuok juom wuon mare ma ne osenindo James Bungei, ne onyuol e Albuquerque e New Mexico e higa mar 1995.

eng: Just like his father, Preston grew up running cross country and track and field. However, all that stopped as he chose to focus more on basketball.
luo: Mana kaka wuon mare, Preston ne odongo ka oringo ng'we ng'ado kor gwenge gi mag alap. to kata kamano, mago duto ne ochung ka ne oyiero chiko wange e opich okapu.

eng: “My mother introduced me to basketball when I was five years old because most of my her relatives were basketball players. When I was about three years, she got me a plastic hoop for Christmas and said I would just stand there and shoot on it all day long,” said Bungei.
luo: "Mama wa norwaka e tuk opich okapu ka a ja higni abich nekech anyuola gi mathoth ne jotugo mag opich okapu. Ka ne a ja higni  adek, ne oyudo na gol mar plastik ka mich mar Krismas kendo owacho ni abiro ga mana chung' e nyim gol no ka a diro saba eiye odieng duto.

eng: Despite falling short of a state championship while he was in high school and college, Bungei started making strides after going professional in 2018.
luo: Kata obedo ni ne orem yudo loch ne piny gi ka ne en e sikund sekondar kata e mbalariany, Bungei ne ochako goyo ondamo ka osebedo jalony e higa mar 2018.

eng: After a successful stint with Trinidad State Junior College and Norfolk State University which featured in the NCAA Division 1, Bungei joined Jazine Arbanasi in Croatian Prva Liga.
luo: Bang' kinde ma ok oromore gi mbalariany mar Trinidad State Junior gi Mbalariany mar Norfolk State mane ochopo e NCAA Division 1, Bungei ne oriwore gi Jazine Arbanasi e Croatian Prva Liga.

eng: In Croatia, Bungei recorded impressive stats as he averaged 17 points per game.
luo: E piny bCroatia, Bungei ne ondiko rekod ma lombo wang' ka ne ondiko point ma dirom 17 e tugo ka tugo.

eng: He was named in the All-Croatian Prva Liga Honorable Mention and won the League Player of the Week four times for the 2018-2019 season.
luo: Ne oluong nyinge e nyadhi mar joma oluor mag Prva Liga kendo noloyo thuolo mar Jatugo ma ber mogik mar juma e lig no nyadingwen e higa 2019-2019.

eng: Why sports ban won’t slow down Kisumu Lakeside’s hunger for success
luo: Gima omiyo chungo tuke ok no dwok chien kech mar jo Kisumu Lakers ma loch.

eng: Kisumu Lakeside Basketball Club is optimistic of performing well in the 2021 Kenya Basketball Federation (KBF) Men’s Premier League despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic which is continuing to disrupt sporting activities across the country.
luo: Jo opich okapu ma Kisumu Lakeside ni gi chir mar timo maber e higa tuke mag Kenya Basketball Federation ma 2021 (KBF) mar joma chwo kata obedo ni chandruok mag midhusi mar Korona ma pod dhi nyime gi chando tuke e piny.

eng: Last month, the KBF topflight league was suspended temporarily by the Government due to rising cases of COVID-19 in the country, hitting a huge blow to the Kisumu side which had just started building their momentum.
luo: Dwe mokalo chakruok mar tuke mag KBF ne ochungi apoya gi piny owacho ne kech medruok mar Covid 19 e piny Kenya, ka mana nogoyo chuny jo Kisumuma ne osechako iko tegruok gi.

eng: Prior to the halting of the league, Lakeside had played five games losing four against EMYBA, Thunder, Eldonets and KPA.
luo: Motelone  chung' mar lig, jo Lakeside ne osetugo tuke a bich ka giwito loch gi ne EMYBA, Thunder, Eldonets gi KPA.

eng: Their only win came against Ulinzi Warriors, with the Kisumu team shocking the defending champions 61-59, a win Lakeside Secretary General Bria Lusaga believes would have set the momentum heading towards facing other opponents.
luo: Loch gi makende owuon ne en ka gitugo gi Ulinzi Worriors, ka jo kisumu go buogo jo ting' loch mag tugono gi seche go 61-59, loch ma jagoro mongirore mar Lakeside Brian Lusaga ogeno ni dine ochako ayanga tekruok mag rakruok gi gi jo piem ma moko.

eng: Speaking to The Standard Sports, Lusaga, who also doubles as the assistant coach, said they were disappointed by the ‘no sports’ Government order but remain buoyant of achieving success this calendar year.
luo: Kowuoyo gi The Standard Sports, Lusaga ma bende en konchiel kaka japuonj matin, nowacho ni ok gimor gi lendo mar piny owacho mar "onge tuke' to omor gi geno ni gibiro yudo loch e higa ni.

eng: “The team had picked momentum and was ready to take on the next opponents. Some players had already made job schedules that would allow them honour matches and with the ban, it means their plans have been interfered with and that may affect us when sports resume.”
luo: "Tieng mar jotugo no nesemako chir kendo oikore mar rakruok gi jotuge ma moko. Jotugo moko ne ose kwayo thuolo e tije gi mondo giyud kinde ma kende mar miyo luor tuke gi go, to mano nyiso ni chenro gi osekethore kendo mano biro miyo wa chandruok e kinde ma tuke oduogo ayanga."

eng: “The management had also paid for training facility for the year, that would go to waste too. However, we are choosing to remain positive and hopeful for a better year and not a sports-less season that was 2020,” said Lusaga.
luo: "Jotelo bende ne osechulo  kuonde tiegruok mar higa, mano bende biro kethore nono. Kata kamano wayiero mar mondo wabed gi geno kendo gi ilo to ok ne higa ma onge tuke ma ne en 2020," Lusaga nowacho.

eng: Lakeside head coach Dismas Oketch echoed his assistants’ sentiments by saying other teams are lucky because of the temporary suspension of the league otherwise they would have faced a totally different Lakeside team compared to the side that lost four straight games.
luo: Japuonj maduong mar Lakeside nochoro weche go mag jalupne kowacho ni timbe mamoko ni gi hawi kokalo kuom chungo mar tukego nekech ka ok mano to di ne giromo gi Lakeside moro mopogore gi ma ne owito tuke angwen moriere ka.

eng: “Winning against the defending champs to break our losing streak was big, it's an eye opener that any team is beatable in the league. This would of cause psyched the team heading to our next matches but unfortunately, the league was suspended.”
luo: "Loyo joting okumba e tukego mondo watiek hawi mar wito tuke no ne en gima duong', en rayaw wang' ni tim moro amora inyalo loo e truke go, mano dine omedo maw kuom jotugo, to kata kamano tuke go ne ongad oko."

eng: Being at 1-4, we are maintaining our focus by doing what's been working and improving on our weaknesses. We had used the previous four losses in understanding where our systems were faulty, analysing and rectifying on our mistakes during current practice,” said Oketch, commonly referred to as ‘DC’.
luo: Bedo e kind 1-4, medo chik ma wachiko go wang'wa kuom timo mana gik ma osebedo ka tiyo kod jiwo kuonde nyaw wa.Ne wasetiyo gi loch ma ne olowago ang'wen ka mondo wang'e go kuonde ma gige wa ne nyap go, nono kendo loko kuonde mane ok watimee maber e kinde magwa mag orako ma sani," Oketch ma bende ong'ere kaka 'DC' ne owacho kamano.

eng: “For the previous seasons it's been a mental kind of thing that winning on the road is something else, but I believe the current team is set to make that perception a thing of the past.”
luo: "Kuom kinde tuke mokalo, ose bedo gimoro mar paro ni yudo loch e ndara en gimoro nono, to ageno ni tim ma sani oikore mar nyiso ni paro ma kamano en en mana wach kinde mosekalo.

eng: Lusaga said Oketch, who joined the club during their maiden season win against Ulinzi will be a key figure in turning out Lakeside into a serious basketball force.
luo: Lusaga nowacho ni Oketch, ma ne oriwore gi jotugo go e kinde mane eka giyudo loch ma miaha, e kindgi gi Ulinzi, nobed siro ma ongirore mar loko Lakeside obed gi teko mongi'th.

eng: “Oketch was an instant hit. He is a long-serving lakeside player who understands the structures of the team. After retiring the management helped facilitate for his coaching course. DC is firm and reads the game well.  He is the next big thing in the coaching world,” said Lusaga.
luo: "Oketch ne en koch mowinjore. En jatugo ma ndalo malach mar Lakeside, ma winjo fuonde tim kaka tiyo. Bang dhi e rutaya, jotelo ne okonye yudo tiegruok mag puonjo. DC ogurore kende osomo ga tugo maber.En e gimoro macielo maduongie ei alap mar jopuonj tugo," Lusaga nowacho.

eng: Lakeside signed Ocholla Bryan from KPA, Marko Odhiambo from KU Pirates, Joshua Carter from Barcelona, George Collins, Jayden Simiyu and Allan Kibira seeking to better their last season’s quarterfinals playoffs achievements.
luo: Lakeside ne ondiko Ocholla Bryan kowuok KPA, Marko Odhiambo mar KU Pirates, Joshua Carter mawuok Barcelona, George Collince, Jayden Simiyu gi Allan Kibira ka gidwaro bero tukegi mokalo fainol mag kwota.

eng: “Joshua Carter is a talented guard standing at 6.2', he is still adjusting to the physicality of the league, he is picking up well and his commitment to training is impressive. He will surely bring us the wins we want,” said Lusaga on their international player who used to play in Spain.
luo: "Joshua Carter en ja rito man gi were ka borne ochung e 6.2', pod ojiwore e tekruok ma lig, okwanyo maber kendo kindane e tiegruok kelo mor. Adiera obiro kelonwa loch duto mawadwaro," lusaga ne owacho mago e wi jatuk gi mar pinje ma ne tugo ga e piny Spain.

eng: Lusaga added that they have come up with a training program, where the team does morning run to keep fit, individual workouts and online discussions during this temporary suspension of sports.
luo: Lusaga ne omedo ni gise tuch gi chenro mar tiegruok, kama jotugo ringoe ng'wech gokinyi mondo dendgi ojiwre, orako mar ji giwegi kod mbaka mag mbuyi e kinde mag kum ma awiye mag tuke gi.

eng: Kenya Morans star Ongwae voted Danish Cup Defensive Player of the Year
luo: Suluwe ma ja Kenya Morans, Ongwae ne ogone ombulu kaka jatugo ma jarit chien maberie moloyo mar higa e piem mag okombe Danish Cup.

eng: Kenya Morans star Taylor Ongwae is the Danish Defensive Player of the Year.
luo: Suluwe mar Kenya Morans Tylor Ongwae  e jatugugo mar geng'o maberie mar piem mag Danish Cup mar higa.

eng: Ongwae was awarded after an impressive show where he helped his club Bakken Bears win the Danish Cup.
luo: Ongwae ne osidh lojno bang ka ne osetimo nyisruok makare kama ne okonyoe jokorgi Bakken Bears loyo okommbe mar Danish.

eng: Ongwae scored seven points and had 10 rebounds with an assist to inspire Bakken Bears to the Danish Men’s Cup by beating Horsens 80-82 in the final.
luo: Ongwae ne oloyo point abiriyo kendo ne nigi opiche ma duogo 10 kod kony mar jiwo jotukgi Bakken Bears loyo okombe mar Danish e kidieny mar joma chuo ka gigoyo Horsens 80-82 e fainol.

eng: In his third season with the Danish giants, Ongwae has been instrumental for the champions on the defensive end.
luo: E kinde ne mar adek gi Robede ma Danish, Ongwae osebedo mober ne joloch go e kare mar rito chien.

eng: Cameroon has made its debut on the global streaming platform Netflix.
luo: Piny Cameroon ne odonjo mokuongo tik e kar neno tipo mag filim mar piny ngima mar Netflix.

eng: The debut saw two movies filmed and produced in the central African country.
luo: Donjo mokuongo tik ne omiyo onyisi filim ariyo go kendo ogol e seteshen mar piny onogo mar afrika madiere.

eng: The two Cameroonian movies, Therapy and Fisherman's Diary, are now streaming on the American over-the-top content platform and production company headquartered in Los Gatos, California.
luo: Tipo mag filim ariyo mag piny Cameroon, ma Therapy kod Fisherman's Diary, gisani nenore e kambi maduong' kendo magolo kido mag sinema e piny amerika ma apise maduong' yudore Los Gatos, California.

eng: According to local reports, Ermelinde Simo Sakah Jing produced the movie Therapy, going down in history books as the first Cameroonian film to be aired on Netflix.
luo: Kaluore kod lupode mek gwenge, Ermelinde Simo Sakah Jing ne ogolo tipo mar filim mar Therapy, mane ondiki e buge sigana kaka ranyisi mar ja Cameroon mokuongo tang' e  Netflix.

eng: The film stars Nigeria's Richard Mofe-Damijo, Ireti Doyle alongside Jing, Alenne Menget, Lucie Memba, Neba Godwill, child actor Kayla Merits.
luo: Sulwe mag filim mar piny Nigeria Richard Mofe-Damijo, Ireti Doyle komakore gi Jing, Alenne Menget, Lucie Memba, Neba Godwill, Kayla Merits, ma en jatugo kaka nyathi.

eng: The Forkwa Babila scripted film follows the story of a dysfunctional couple who enlists an unconventional therapist's services in a bid to resolve their marital woes.
luo: Filimb tugo mar Forkwa Babila luwo sigand keny manitiere gi ywaruok, kendo gimanyo luwo puonj koa kuom jolony eweche mag dak milieko mondo okonygi e keto winjruok e podgruok gi mag keny.

eng: The Cameroonian debut is co-directed by Anurin Nwunembom and Musing Derick, while Anthill studio's Victoria Akujobi is credited as the film's editor.
luo: Donjo mokuongo mar filim mar Cameroon ne otaa e buo Anurin Nwunembom gi Musing Derick, e kinde ma steshen mar Anthill ,Victoria Akujobi imiyo pak kaka jandiko filim.

eng: The Fisherman's Diary by Kang Quintus and Enah Johnscott, which has been one of Cameroon's best movies of 2020, was early this year pre-selected for the 93rd Oscars.
luo: Filim mar 'The Fisherman's Diary' ma ogol gi Kang Quintus kod Enah Johnscott, ma osebedo achiel kuom filimbe mabeyo e piny mar Cameroon e higa mar  2020, e kinde chakruok higani ne oyier e piem mar 93 mar Oscars.

eng: Unfortunately, the film did not make the final cut.
luo: Kuom hawi marach filimno ok ne ochopo e okang' mogik.

eng: Speaking about the Oscars pre-selection, the Executive Producer of the Film, Kang Quintus, excitedly explained that the opportunity to make it to the Oscars was enough recognition to put the Cameroonian film industry on the global map.
luo: Ka owuoyo e wi chak-yiero mar Oscars, jagol film maduong', Kang Quintus, ne olero gi mor ni thuolo mane Cameroon oyudo mar donjo e piem mar Oscars oromo keto kambi filim mar Cameroon kama maber e piny mangima.

eng: "We are happy to have made history with this film. For us, aside from being a good reward for hard work, this deal grants the opportunity for our content to reach a global audience. Hopefully, this would be the first amongst many, not just for me and the team, but for other Cameroonian filmmakers," Kang Quintus said in a press release.
luo: "Wamor ni waloso sigana kod filim. Kor kakorwa, ka opogore kod mich mar tich matek, winjruogni chiwo thuolo mar chopo tugowa ne joneno mag piny mangima. Wageno ni mae biro bedo mokuongo e wi mang'eny ma osebetie ok ne an awuon kata riuruok to kendo kata ne kembe mag filim mar piny Cameroon," Kang Quintus nowacho e duoko penjo mar jolendo.

eng: The movie, The Fisherman's Diary, follows the story of a 12-year-old Ekah (Faith Fidel) who got inspired by Malala Yousalzai, the youngest noble prize winner.
luo: Filim mar The Fisherman's Diary, luwo sigand Ekah (Faith Fidel) ja higa 12 mane oyudo jip koya kuom Malala Yousalzai, jaloch matin mogik mar mich.

eng: In the film, Ekah is determined to go to school in a fishermen's village where it is considered taboo.
luo: Eyi filim, Ekah neni gi geno mar dhi sikul e gwenge mag jolupo mane nenore kaka chira.

eng: The film features other actors such as Ramsey Nouah, Onyama Laura.
luo: Filim nyiso jotugo moko kaka Ramsey Nouah, Onyama Laura.

eng: Commenting about this latest achievement for the Cameroonian movie, the film's Executive Producer, Kang Quintus, could not hold back the excitement.
luo: Kane owuoyo e wi yuto masani mar tipo mar bidio mag  Cameroon, jagol filim maduong', Kang Quintus, ok ne nyal pando mor mare.

eng: "After making it to the Oscars list, The Fisherman's Diary has now become the 1st Cameroonian Film to be acquired by Netflix. This is big news for the Cameroon Film Industry and a proud moment for all Cameroonians… Many more Cameroon Films to follow," Kang Quintus wrote.
luo: "Bang' yiero mar Oscars, Fisherman's Diary gisani osebedo filim mokuongo mar Cameroon ma osekau kod  Netflix. Ma en wach maduong' ne kembe mag filim e piny Cameroon kendo kinde mor ne jo Cameroon duto… Filimbe mang'eny mag Cameroon biro luwe," Kang Quintus ne ondiko.

eng: Cameroonians have taken to social media platforms to congratulate the movie producers and for the outstanding achievement.
luo: Jo Cameroon osetero puoch kod pak e kor lwasi/mbui ne weg filim ne ondamogi maduong' miwuoro.

eng: How the wine tasting event went down at The Local Grill
luo: Kaka nyasi mar bilo kong'o ne obedo e kar math mar Local Grill.

eng: Africa head of Astrazeneca Dr.Sylvia Vito(Left) and Carole Kinoti (Right) during Durbaville hill collector reservoir wine from Cape town during Wine tasting at Village market in Nairobi.
luo: Jatelo mar Astrazeneca afrika, Dr.Sylvia Vito(kor acham) kod Carole Kinoti (kor achwich) ekinde bilo kuong' mar  Durbaville hill collector reservoir ma owuok  Cape town mane timore Village market mayudore  Nairobi.

eng: Did you ever imagine that the world’s most expensive beef, Wagyu, is available locally?
luo: Bende isegaparo ni ringo ma nengo ne ni malo mogik, Wagyu, yudore machieg'ni kodwa?

eng: Well, The Local Grill in Village Market and KWAL and Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserves recently treated wine enthusiasts to an evening filled with food and wine, introducing us to some of the most premium wines and of course, good food.
luo: Kamano, ndalo matin ma osekalo,  Local Grill mayudore Village Market kod KWAL gi Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserves ne omiyo johera mag kong'o chiemo mar odhiambo kod kuong', mane oketowa e ng'eyo moko kuom mich mag kuong' kod chiemo.

eng: For only Sh6,000 per person, one had the rare chance of enjoying a variety of wines from the South African wine company that crafts wine using the best grapes from Cape Town’s best vineyards, with the evening’s host being wine expert and sommelier Victoria-Mulu Munyoki.
luo: Kuom Sh6,000 kende e wi ng'ato ka ng'ato, ng'ato ne nitiere kod thuolo mar mong'o kido mopogore opogore mar kong'o ma owuok e kambi mayudore e piny afrika mamilambo, ma loso kuong' katiyo kod olembe mabeyo mowuok e puothe olembe mabeyo e boma mar  Cape Town, kaa jataa chenro ne en jalony kendo jaus kong'o  Victoria-Mulu Munyoki.

eng: In an evening filled with laughter, we got to talk about life, love and eat the best food available, including chicken mshikaki.
luo: E midhiambo mopong' kod mor, newatwak e yore ng'ima, hera kendo newachamo chiemo mabeyo mane yudore kanyakla kod gwend mshikaki.

eng: Learning how to tell the flavours of wine just from tasting it and being able to tell which grape was used in making the wine is also key.
luo: Ng'eyo mit mopogore mag kuong' e yor bilo, kendo fwenyo olemo mane otigo e loso kuong'no en gima duong'.

eng: Identifying how sweet, dry or acidic wine is also helps in choosing the best bottle of wine.
luo: Fwenyo mit, kech kata wach mar kuong' bende konyo e yiero chupa maber mar kuong'.

eng: For the starter, we had grilled Octopus in tropical slaw and Mediterranean relish with a Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserve – ‘The Cableway’ chardonnay 2018, and chicken mishkaki in sugarcane speared chicken thighs with spicy peanut sauce with a glass of Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserve.
luo: E chakruok ne wan gi okela mowang' eyor tropical slaw gi Mediterranean relish gi kuong Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserve – ‘The Cableway’ chardonnay 2018, gi gwend mishkaki, eyi bam gweno motuch gi niang' mokete njugu moregi gi  glass mar kuong Durbanville Hill Collectors Reserve.

eng: For the main course we had Wagyu x Boran short ribs that was slow braised with a red wine infused with a glass of Nederburg ‘The Manor House’ Shiraz 2017.
luo: Ne chiemo e wang'e Wagyu x ng'et machieko mag Boran mane olosgi kuong' (red wine) ka ikowegi glas mar Nederburg ‘The Manor House’ Shiraz 2017.

eng: And I have to say my highlight for the night was a passion and lime sorbet, which was a palate cleanser as we geared up for the second course.
luo: Kendo nyaka awach ni gi parona motieno no en kuong' mar passion gi lime sorbet, en kaka gir luoko ekinde mane warito chiemo mar ariyo.

eng: The second main course meal was grass fed fillet 200 grammes with local salad and mixed salts, accompanied with a glass of Durbanville Hills Collectors Reserve ‘The Promade Pinotage’ 2017.
luo: Chiemo mar ariyo ne en grass fed fillet grams 200 gi local salad kendo moriwie chumbe, kiwowo gi glas mar Durbanville Hills Collectors Reserve ‘The Promade Pinotage’ 2017.

eng: To close the pairing, we dug into a raspberry panna cotta dessert with a glass of Durbanville Hills Collectors Reserve ‘The Lighthouse’ Merlot 2017.
luo: Mondo walore, ne watieko gi desert mar raspberry panna cotta gi glas mar  Durbanville Hills Collectors Reserve ‘The Lighthouse’ Merlot 2017.

eng: Kisumu's 63-year-old Ofafa estate set for Sh3 billion facelift
luo: Ofafa estate mosekao higni 63 kendo yudore Kisumu onego time lokruok maromo omenda Sh3 billion.

eng: The 63-year-old Anderson Ofafa Estate in Kisumu will undergo a Sh3 billion facelift thanks to the County Pension Fund and Laptrust Fund.
luo: Ofafa estate mosekao higni 63 biro yudo lokruok/neno manyien mar omenda maromo Sh3 billion erokamano ne County Pension Fund gi Laptrust Fund.

eng: The county authorities have embarked on a two-year low-cost housing project to give the estate a new look befitting Kisumu city status.
luo: Tend kanti osechako chenro mar higni ariyo mag udi ma nengogi ni piny mondo gi mii estetno neno manyien moromo kod nyadhi mar Kisumu city.

eng: On Wednesday, Governor Anyang' Nyong'o laid the foundation stone for the houses of retirees from the defunct Kisumu Municipality.
luo: Chieng' tich adek, Gavana Anyang' Nyong'o ne oketo ohinga mar udi mag joma oritaya e Munispal ma Kisumu.

eng: Some tenants have lived in the houses for more than 20 years and were paying as low as Sh4,000 for a one-bedroom or two-bedroom house.
luo: Jopango osebedo kodak e udi gi higni mokalo 20 kendo negichulo minyonge mok tinne Sh4,000 ne ot mar bedroom achiel kata two-bedroom.

eng: But now, the houses, which they have lived in for years, are set for an upgrade with a vision to make them homeowners in the noble low-cost affordable housing project mooted by President Uhuru Kenyatta.
luo: Koro sana, udi, ma gisedake kuom higni, owinjore loki kendo paro nitiere mar ketogi weg udigo e chenro mag udi ma nengogi oyweyo mane ochak gi Ker Uhuru Kenyatta.

eng: Kenya’s Affordable Housing Programme (AHP) was launched in December 2017 by President Kenyatta as one of the national government’s four pillars of growth.
luo: Kenya’s Affordable Housing Programme (AHP) ne oyangi Desemba higa mar 2017 gi Ker Kenyatta kaka achiel kuom dongruoge ang'wen mag sirkal mamalo.

eng: The Kisumu Housing Project comes at a time when the city's bulging population is continuing to pile pressure on housing demand amid an acute shortage of low-cost houses.
luo: Chenro mar gero udi Kisumu, biro eseche ma kwan mar jii medore e bomano kendo medo tielo presa, dwaro mag udi kaluwore gi tin mar ute ma nengogi oyweyo.

eng: Currently, demand for housing, according to the County Lands and Housing Executive Dickson Obungu is 250,000 annually against a supply of 50,000 as the city grows.
luo: Gi esani, dwaro mag udi, kaluwore gi jatend County Lands and Housing Dickson Obungu, en 250,000 e higa kopim gi yudruok mar 50,000 kaka bomano medo dongo.

eng: Currently, the proportion of the urban population in Kisumu has risen from 482,327 in 1979 to 664,086 in 1989 to 804,289 in 2009 968,909 persons with 474,687 males and 494,222 females.
luo: Gi esani, kwan mar jii e boma mar Kisumu osemedore koa 482,327 e higa mar 1979 nyaka 664,086 e higa mar 1989 kendo nyaka 804,289 e higa mar 2009 968,909 ka kwan mag jomachuwo en 474,687 gi  494,222 mar mine.

eng: The county's population stands at 1,155,574 as per last year's census.
luo: Kwan mar jii e kantino en  1,155,574 kaluwore gi census ma higa mokalo.

eng: Acting city manager Abala Wanga envisages Kisumu population will double in next 20 years.
luo: Jachung' ne weche boma Abala Wanga wachoni kwan mar oganda biro medore nyadiriyo Kisumu eyi higni 20 mabiro.

eng: Nyong'o said the growing population has necessitated fresh spatial planning. "So we have to look at the distribution of people and activities in urban areas and towns to improve their housing, economic and social environments," Prof Nyong'o said.
luo: Nyong'o ne owacho ni medruok mar oganda osemiyogi paro chenro mayien mar ngelo gedo. "Koro chuno ni nyaka wang'i ngelruok mag jii gi gik madhi nyime e bombe mondo gi med loso utegi, yuto gi chal mar dak e aluora," Prof Nyong'o ne owacho.

eng: Laptrust CEO Hosea Kili released a cheque of Sh76,000 each and an additional Sh100,000 to facilitate the relocation of the affected 1,200 families.
luo: Jatend Laptrust Hosea Kili ne ogolo cheque mar omenda maromo Sh76,000 moro ka moro kendo omedo omenda maromo Sh100,000 mondo otaa dar mar anyuola mag jii 1,200 ma wachni ne omako.

eng: The Andersen Ofafa Estate was home to 246 families staying in 39 blocks.
luo: Estate mar Andersen Ofafa ne en mier mag anyuola 246  mane odak e bloge 39.

eng: Each family was paid a year's rent based on a mutual agreement with CPF and LapTrust.
luo: Anyuol moro ka moro ne ochul pes ot mar higa achiel kaluwore gi winjruok gi gi CPF gi LapTrust.

eng: The former tenants will be given priority on buying the new modern housing units.
luo: Jodak machon ibiro keti e ong'ala manyime e nyiewo wudi moger e lony manyasani.

eng: According to the project's architect Peter Wasilwa, each of the one-bedroom houses will be offered to the former tenants at an affordable cost of Sh1.5 million.
luo: Kaluwore gi jagedo mar udigo Peter Wasilwa, ute mag one-bedroom ibiro chiuw ne jodak machon e nengo moyweyo mar Sh1.5 million.

eng: The tenants will have 10 years to offset Sh1.5 million for the one-bedroom houses, paying Sh12,500 monthly.
luo: Jodak ibiro mii higni 10 mar tieko chulo million Sh1.5  ne udi mag one-bedroom, ka gichulo omenda maromo Sh12,500 e due.

eng: The two-bedroom houses will go for Sh2.5 million, while a three-bedroom house cost Sh3.5 million.
luo: Ute mag two-bedroom biro nyieure enengo maromo million Sh2.5,ka ot mar three-bedroom ibiro nyieu e nengo mar million Sh3.5 million.

eng: Non-tenants will part with Sh1 million more for the units.
luo: Jooko biro medo Sh1 million ewi ot ka ot.

eng: Kisumu is the third-largest city in Kenya after Nairobi and Mombasa and is in Lake Victoria Basin Commission headquarters for East African countries.
luo: Kisumu en boma maduong' mar adek e Kenya bang boma ma Nairobi gi Mombasa, kendo oyudore e aluora mar nam Lolwe (Victoria basin Commision) kendo otelo ne pinje ma ugwe mayudore e aluora no.

eng: Why today’s Kalasha gala is an awards show like no other
luo: Gima omiyo Kalasha Gala en romo mar chiwo mich ma ok nyal pim gi moko.

eng: It is all systems go for this year’s Kalasha International Film and TV awards that will be held in Nairobi today.
luo: Yore tee orieyo nyasi mar higani mar Kalasha International Film and TV awards mabiro timore Nairobi kawuono.

eng: Timothy Owase, the Kenya Film Commission CEO promises a major show in the annual event that seeks to celebrate the crème de la crème of the local movie industry.
luo: Timothy Owase, jatend Kenya Film Commission chiko nyisruuok maduong e romo mabiro puoyo mit mar sinema magwa.

eng: Some of the films that are favourites include Sincerely Daisy, Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis, 40 Sticks and Uradi.
luo: Moko kuom sinema ma oher gin kaka Sincerely Daisy, Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis, 40 Sticks gi Uradi.

eng: While Sincerely Daisy has 13 nominations, Family Meeting, 40 Sticks and Midlife Crisis have 12 each while Uradi has nine.
luo: Eseche ma  Sincerely Daisy ni gi yiero 13, Family Meeting, 40 Sticks gi Midlife Crisis nitiere gi yiero 12 moro ka moro kendo Uradi nitiere go ochiko.
