eng: Now, in its 10th year, the event will also serve as a platform for showcasing some of the best TV shows and children’s productions.
luo: Sani, e hike mar 10, romono bende biro bedo kar nyiso moko kuom kipindi mabeyo e TV gi chenro mag nyithindo.

eng: The event will be attended by Joe Mucheru, the Ministry of Information, Communications and Technology Cabinet Secretary.
luo: Romono ibiro yuor gi jatend migao mag yore lony gi fwambo (ICT) Joe Mucheru.

eng: “From our research, there has been a growing need for content for children on our screens and as a result, the commission introduced the Best Children Production category to acknowledge those who have developed concepts to accommodate our young ones as screen audiences,” Owase said.
luo: “Koa e nonrowa, nitiere dwaro mar dongruok mag gige nyithindo e TV kendo kaluore gi dwarono, kamisenno osechako chenro mabeyo mag nyithido mondo ojiu jii mosegolo paro e kelo chenro ne jowa matindo,” Owase ne owacho.

eng: Maisha Magic’s Pete, Majuto, Kovi and Selina series have been nominated in  Best TV Drama category while their lead actors/actresses have also been nominated for their roles.
luo: Kipindi mag Pete, Majuto, Kovu gi Selina mabiro e Maisha Magic neoyier e kidieny mar  Best TV Drama eseche ma jotukgi bende neoyier.

eng: The awards ceremony at Sarit Centre will feature a few guests in line with Ministry of Health guidelines on social distancing.
luo: Romo mar chiwo mich mabiro timore Sarit Centre biro bedo gi welo matin kaluore gi chike mag migao mar thieth kaka bedo mabor gi jowadu.

eng: KFC has partnered with StarTimes, which is the official platform where nominated films had been uploaded for voting and viewing.
luo: KFC oseriwore gi kambi mar StarTimes, ma en kama ikete filim moyier mondo ogonegi ombulu kendo otang'gi.

eng: The films and actors in Sincerely Daisy, Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis, 40 Sticks have all landed in notable slots namely Best Original Screenplay, Best Sound Design, Best Director, Best Lead Actress and Best Lead Actor.
luo: Filimbe kod jotugo manitiere e Sincerely Daisy, Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis, 40 Sticks duto oseyudore e grube mineno kaka Best Original Screenplay, Best Sound Design, Best Director, Best Lead Actress kod Best Lead Actor.

eng: The awards are being held at a time when the local film industry is showing signs of growth and recovery.
luo: Romo mar chiwo mich timore e kinde ma kambi mayudore e kor gweng' nyiso ranyisi mag dongruok kod duogo e wang'e mar chal ng'ima dak.

eng: This year, a number of local films and TV drama shows have found their way to Netflix with KFC making deliberate efforts to promote film production.
luo: E higani, kwan moromo mag filimbe manuang'ore e kor gweng'e kod tuke mag nyisruoka ma itang'o e wang' liech, ne oyudore e Netflix kama KFC temo matek ting'o malo golo kod neno mag filimbego.

eng: The awards gala is being held at a time when focus is on the Kenya Film Bill 2020 that seeks to consolidate the legislative framework of laws relating to the film industry and to provide for the development, funding and regulation of the industry.
luo: Romo mar chiwo mich timore e kinde ma paro duto oket e chike mag Kenya Film Bill 2020, madwaro riwo chike mochomore gi kembe filim kendo kelo dongruok, omenda kod  chike mag tayo kembego.

eng: “For long, artistes have been complaining about being underpaid, poor working conditions and policies. In response, we are coming up with new guidelines to achieve the full potential, development and growth of the local talent,” Owase said.  He added that, through its parent Ministry of ICT, Innovation and Youth Affairs, KFC is championing a National Screen policy that will streamline funding, incentives, investment and capacity development.
luo: “Kuom kinde malach, jotugo osebedo kaywak ne chudo matin, lwasi marach mar tich kod ratiro. E duoko, wabiro gi yore manyien mag  yudo pok manyien gi dongruok,” Owase ne owacho.  Ne omedo ni kokalo e migao mar fwambo,tudruok kod lony (ICT), Innovation and Youth Affairs, KFC siro National Screen policy mabiro rieyo yore mag omenda, meto mag yuto, dongruok mar rieko kod keto mwandu.

eng: He noted that a film-friendly production environment will involve a shared, positive view of the industry across a range of different government departments, agencies and other entities.
luo: Ne ojiwo ni lwasi maler mar golo filim biro riwo paro maber moya kuom migepe ma opogore mag piny owacho gi jo okos.

eng: The Labour Statistics for Film and Related activities data from the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics 2020 economic surveys indicated that about 123,290 jobs existed directly in the film industry in 2018 with a 5.3 per cent increase recorded last year.
luo: Nonro dak koya Kenya Bureau of Statistics 2020 e lupot mar kwan mag jotich mag filim gi moko ma otudore kode ne osiemo ni machieg'ni ni tije 123,290 ne owuok aching' e chiro mar filim e higa 2018 gi medruok mar atamalo 5.3 e higa mokalo.

eng: According to the PWC analysis of trends shaping the entertainment and media industry in Africa – released last year – the total cinema revenue in Kenya is set to reach US$8.6 million (about Sh860 million) by 2023, up from US$6.2 million (about Sh620 million) in 2018, as production activity peaks for both feature films and TV drama.
luo: Kaluwore gi nonro mag PWC mane ogol higa mokalo e rieyo kit kembe mamiyo jii nyiero kod kembe mag fwambo, kwan nar yuto mag sinema  e Kenya chan chopo omenda maromo dola milion8.6 (modwaro romo milion Sh860) kachop higa mar 2023, kaouk dola milion 6.2 (madwaro romo milion 620) ehiga mar 2018, e seche ma yore mag golo tuke mag thuolo malach gi machuok medore.

eng: While Nigeria remains Africa’s film giant, Kenya has been tipped to join the continent’s major film countries in which is South Africa and Ghana.
luo: E seche ma piny Nigeria pod otelo e wechego mag filim, Kenya osewachore nidhi riwore kod pinje madong'o mag filimbe ma gin South Africa kod Ghana.

eng: Jamhuri Day fever- Must attend weekend events
luo: Jamhuri Day fever- Romo go mochuno chopie e giko wik.

eng: It is the festive season and a number of feelgood events are on cue this weekend to help you make the most of the coming holiday celebrations.
luo: En kinde sikuku kendo kwan mag ikruok mag nyasi timore e giko wik mondo okony e loso mang'eny mag nyasi mabiro timore e kinde rusa mabiro.

eng: Read Also: Inside a Covid gig - How corporates are adjusting to new trends
luo: Som kendo: Inside a Covid gig - Manyiso kaka riuruoge ikore ne lokruoge kod kido manyien.

eng: Alternate Sound, a fused four-man band boasting unique musical expressions, will be bringing African magic at the Just a Vibe event in Ngong Racecourse, Nairobi.
luo: Alternate Sound, band mar ji ang'wen ma pakore kod kit ngolo magigoyo, biro tero thuon nduma ne joafrika e nyasi mar mor mobagi Ngong Racecourse, Nairobi.

eng: Beloved Kenyan boy band Sauti Sol will be host to Sol Saturday - a limited tickets event -  at the Karen Waterfront which will feature must listen to special guests. Former Camp Mulla artist Miss Karun will at the Rebel Room for throbbing Afro Soul vibes alongside fast-rising songstress Xenia Manasseh and Nigerian singer Tems.
luo: Rawera moher kod jokenya e band mar Sauti Sol biro tayo nyasi mar Sol Saturday ,man kod otiko matin mag donjo,e  Karen Waterfront mabiro tang'o wende mochuno ne welo modhial. Jawer machon mar Camp Mulla  Miss Karun biro bet e Rebel Room e kinde ngolo mar Afro Soul kanyo achiel kod mikayi mawinjore ahinya Xenia Manasseh kod jawer Tems  mar piny Nigeria.

eng: Golden Ice Bistro will be having a special Jamhuri Eve hosted by Jay Ranking with DJ Kronixx behind the decks. Rapper Kahush, the son of Health CS Mutahi Kagwe, will be performing live at Clique Lounge in a must-attend event dubbed ‘Wanted in Nairobi’ which will also double as his album launch and listening party.
luo: Golden Ice Bistro biro bedo gi Jamhuri moyiedh ma ibiro taa gi Jay Ranking gi DJ Kronixx. Jathum Kahush, ma en wuod jatend migao mar thieth Mutahi Kagwe, biro gocho Clique Lounge enyasi mochuno miluongo ni ‘Wanted in Nairobi’ mabende biro riwo wendege duto kod mago mag nyasi.

eng: 254 Brewery will host some of the finest people in the contemporary music space such as Big Bear, Mix Master Lenny and Marcelo Cura for Kenyan Nights’ 11th edition in another limited capacity event.
luo: 254 Brewery biro luongo jothumbe mideo  kaka Big Bear, Mix Master Lenny kod Marcelo Cura enyasi mar Kenyan Nights’ 11th edition okang' machielo mar nyasi.

eng: The events industry has borne the brunt of the implications of Covid-19 to a very large extent this year.
luo: Kembe mag tayo nyasi e higani oseyudo midhiero mang'eny ma okel kod Covid-19.

eng: Typically one of the most lucrative industries when all factors are constant, this year has seen the demise of many money-making channels for many a stakeholder for months on end now.
luo: Gadiera jokanyo mag kembe mag nyasi mosebedo kadhi maber e ohala, osepodho e yore mag loso omenda kuom dueche mang'eny ehigani.

eng: As we edge closer to the end of this rather turbulent year, it also looks like organizers are buoyed to slowly bring back the events lifeline slowly by slowly.
luo: Esama wasudo machiegni gi giko higa mosedo matekni, chalo kagima jolos nyasi nigi geno mar duoko nyasi ewang'e mos mos.

eng: Except it is also not as easy as it sounds.
luo: Mak mana ni ok oyot kaka owachoreno.

eng: A few weeks ago, the annually controversial NaiFest went down and so much flack has been meted out against them after.
luo: Jumbe matin mokalo, nyasi mar NaiFest makelo ywaruok higa ka higa ne otimore kendo bang'e ne oyudo puoch moloyo duto.

eng: Questions have been asked as regards whether it is the right time to bring back showbiz or humanity should be prioritized over profits.
luo: Penjo osebedo mang'eny kaluwore gi duoko nyasi mag jodhum kata ng'iyo ngima dhano moloyo uyuto mag thum.

eng: Are there many event organizers willing to care less for the money and more for the lives of the human race?
luo: Bende nitiere jotaa nyasi madewo ngima dhano moloyo pesa?

eng: That is the million-dollar question amid the current events temperature.
luo: Mae e penjo penjore e kind chal ohand nyasi.

eng: Last weekend saw the last-minute cancellation of the much-awaited Mugithi in the Wild, a move that many arguably did not see coming.
luo: Giko juma ma okalo newaneno chungo mar nyasi mar Mugithi in the wild ma jii osebedo ka rito gino ma jii mang'eny ok noneno kabiro.

eng: “It is with sincere regret that I formally inform you that, after due consideration of our current circumstances, KWS management has come to the decision to stop the planned Mugithi in the Wild event. We apologize for the inconvenience caused,’’ read a part of the statement put out by Lekishon Kenana, an official at Kenya Wildlife Service South Conservation Area division.
luo: “Atimo mos makende kuom wachonu ni bang' ng'iyo chal masani, telo mar KWS osechopo e paro mar chungo nyasi mar mane ochan mar Mugithi in the Wild. Wagoyo mos kuom chochruok mosebete,’’ Som kidieny mar lupot moseket gi Lekishon Kenana, ma en apisa mar Kenya Wildlife Service South Conservation Area division.

eng: The much-hyped event was slated for November 21 and had big headliners like Samidoh, Jose Gatutura and Kareh B, with ticket prices going for as high as Ksh10,000.
luo: Nyasi mane olichi ne ochan kendo nyak Novemba tarik 21, mane nigi nyinge jothumbe mideo kaka  Samidoh, Jose Gatutura gi Kareh B, kendo nengo otiko ne odhi malo nyaka Ksh10,000.

eng: “It was devastating, to say the very least. A culmination of so many days of intense work with preparation went to the drains. It was not easy. Somewhat miraculously, people were very understanding and did not give us hell. So many people agreed that it was not our fault and had our backs. That was a really good feeling,’’ adds Shem, one of the key organizers of Mugithi in the Wild.
luo: “Ne jogo chuny, kawawacho matin. Tich matek mane oketi ne odhi nono. Ne ok yot. Ka hono jii nowinjowa kendo ne ok obadhogi. Jii mang'eny ne oyie ni ok ne en rem wa kendo negisirowa. Mano ne mor wa,’’ Shemma en achiel kuom jotaa naysi mar Mugithi in the wild ne omedo.

eng: ‘’The email from Kenya Wildlife Service was sent at 12am. Typically, no one really logs in to email at that hour. So, we only got to see the email at 8am in the morning. The shock that hit us is inexplicable. We had spent the previous night on final touches of the set, so the last-minute directive hit us rather hard. Nonetheless, we choose to focus on the bright side of things. We are already planning on a possible rescheduling and gearing up for another event, Reggae in the Wild, already. We are not slowing down anytime soon, ‘’ affirms Shem, who also doubles as a renowned corporate DJ.
luo: ‘’Jo Kenya Wildlife Service ne ooro barua mar mbuyi saa auchiel otieno. Kuom adier onge ng'at mang'iyoga mbuyi esechego. Koro, ne wayudo barua mar mbuyi saa ariyo okinyi. Buok mane wayudo tek pimo. Ne wakao otieno mokalo mar tieko ikruok, ema omiyo ndikono ne obuogowa. Kata kamano, ne wayiero neno ber. Wasechako pango chenro moro mar nyasi machielo, kaka Reggae in the Wild. Ok wabijok, ‘’ Shem mabende en DJ, jiwo.

eng: What about the safety and wellness of Kenyans?
luo: En ang'o kuom weche arita gi ngima mar jokenya?

eng: ‘’We had planned on handing out face masks and hand sanitizer to every single reveller who was coming to the event. We also had a great sitting arrangement that entailed haystacks, strategically placed within intervals of 1.5 metres, as per the health ministry’s social distancing directive. When it comes to security, the location is synonymous with that. It was beefed up to the core. We were not about to make the same mistakes as others, ‘’ he boldly confirms.
luo: ‘’Newachano chiwo abuog rombe kod sabunde luoko lwedo ne jobuor nyasi moro ka moro. Kendo newaloso yore bet mabor kod  ondamo 1.5 kaluore kod dwaro mar migao mar thieth. Kobiro eweche mag arita, kuonde tayo nyasi biro duaro arita machalo kamago. Ne omed rido weche arita. Ok ne wadwar timo makosa kaka jok mamoko, ‘’ ne osiro gi chir.

eng: Going by Shem’s statement, Mugithi in the Wild was bound to be a huge success.
luo: Kaluwore gi andike mar Shem, Mugithi in the Wild ne onego bed nyasi malich.

eng: He insists that the rescheduled event will be even bigger and better, and with all Covid19 rules adhered to.
luo: Ne omedo wacho ni nyasi mopangi manyien biro bedo maduong moloyo, kendo luwo chike duto mag Covid19.

eng: Enter Thrift Social, which earlier in the month was postponed - the much-awaited gig headlined by award-winning South African singer and songwriter, Samthing Soweto will be going down this Sunday.
luo: Thrift Social, mane oseriti kendo motelne gi jalo mich,jathum kendo jandik thumbe mar piny afrika mamilambo Samthing Soweto ,mane ochwal e chakruok mar dwee ibiro bag chieng' Jumapindni.

eng: This will be the first-ever post-Covid-19 edition, and suffice to say that many eyes are on them.
luo: Mae biro bedo nyasi mokuong'o tik bang' Covid-19, ma thoth oganda mang'eny wuoye.

eng: Critics are all up in arms in case the event fails to live up to the required health restrictions.
luo: Pogruok e paro biro bete ponono ni nyasino orem chopo dwaro migao mar thieth.

eng: Being their first-ever post-virus to gig, what are they going to do differently?
luo: Bedo ni en nyasigi mokuongo bang midhiero, en ang'o magibiro timo ma opogore?

eng: ‘’I do not want to dwell on that, seeing as my words could easily be twisted. I want to be very careful. As a matter of fact, I’d rather remain tight-lipped on any banter pertaining to Covid-19 restrictions and the event,’’ said a somewhat discreet Oliver, one of the key organizers of Thrift Social.
luo: Oliver, jalmariek kendo mane taa nyasi mar Thrift Social, ne owacho kama,‘’Ok adwar wacho mang'eny ewi mano, wechena nyalo winjore mopogre. Nyaka abed motang'. E adiera, oloyo dhoga omoki e walo maluore gi chike matayo Covid-19 kod nyasi.’’

eng: As to how the event will pan out on Sunday, we will have to wait and see.
luo: Wabiro rito neno kaka nyasi ibiro taa chieng' Jumapil.

eng: Meanwhile, questions abound on what the legal atmosphere hitherto looks like.
luo: Kata kamano, penjo en kaka aluora biro chalo sani kod kinde mabiro.

eng: What will befall those find themselves on the short end of the stick?
luo: Bende gima rach mabiro timore en yudruok kama opogore gi jok mamoko?

eng: The Public Health Rules 2020 impose a penalty of either a fine of up to KSh20,000, imprisonment for a period of up to six months, or both, for contravening the measures set out in public places: places to wash hands, social distancing and enforcement of wearing of masks and regular sanitization of the premises.
luo: Chike sirikal mag  thieth e higa 2020 (The Public Health Rules 2020) ne oketo kum mar fai maromo nyaka  omenda mar KSh20,000 kata twech kuom ndalo maromo dweche auchiel, kata tee, kuom ketho chike moket kuonde riuruok: kuonde logo lwedo, bedo mabor kod nyawadu, jiwo rwako abuog rombe kod keto ler seche duto e kwonde mag dak.

eng: This is stipulated under Rule 6.
luo: Mae oyangi e buo chik namba 6.

eng: As for revellers who contract the disease because they visited a public place or attended an event, this would be a caveat emptor situation.
luo: Ne jobuor nyasi mane ogamo tuo bang' yudore kuonde riuruok kata bang' chopo e nyasi,en gino mane inyalo geng'.

eng: The consumer is responsible for their actions and they cannot transfer this liability to the owner of the establishment.
luo: Jonyiewo ni kod ting' mar yierogi owuon kendo okginyal choro nyime ne wuon ohala.

eng: ‘’ Looking at the mysterious nature of the disease, that may be hard to prove as its still a medical discover the Public Health Rules 2020 impose a penalty of either a fine of up to KSh20,000, imprisonment for a period of up to six months, or both, for contravening the measures set out in public places: places to wash hands, social distancing and enforcement of wearing of masks and regular sanitization of the premises. This is stipulated under Rule 6, ‘’ informs Liz Lenjo, founder and Managing Consultant of MYIP Legal Studio. She specialises in Intellectual Property, Entertainment, Media and Fashion Law.
luo: ‘’Kawarang'o kido marach mar tuoni, manyalo bedo matek fuenyo e nonro mar thieth mar chike sirikal mar higa 2020 (Public Health Rules 2020) maketo kum mar maromo nyaka omenda mar KSh20,000 kata tuech kuom ndalo maromo dweche auchiel, kata tee, kuom ketho chike moket kuonde riuruok: kuonde logo lwedo, bedo mabor kod nyawadu,jiwo rwako abuog rombe kod keto ler seche duto e kuonde mag dak. Mae oyangi e buo chik namba 6, ‘’Jachak kendo jang'ad rieko mar MYIP Legal Studio(founder and Managing Consultant of  MYIP Legal Studio) Liz Lenjo, lero. Jalony e Intellectual Property, Entertainment, Media kod Fashion Law.

eng: ‘’Since March, the situation has changed. With the Government imposed restrictions the playing field can be anticipated. Now, events are being held under these guidelines. Some event managers and establishments are following these rules while some are flaunting them. The enforcement of these rules is rather wanting as there are instances it may be construed to be selective. That said, there is a rise in exclusive events and people seem ready and willing to pay premium. Perhaps owing to the eagerness to escape the boredom of staying at home, ‘’ she concludes.
luo: ‘’Chakre dwe mar adek, chal oselokore. Kaluore kod chike moket kod piny owacho, paro mabiro nitiere e pewe tuke. Gisani nyasi itayo e buo chikegi. Jotaa kod jolos nyasi mamoko sani luwo chikegi e seche ma jok mamoko kethogi. Keto e tim chikege dwaro lokruok nikech chike moko neno ka gima mar jomoko kendgi. E jiwo mano, nitiere medruok mag nyasi matimore seche mopogre opogre, ma oganda oyie chulo chon kapok chieng' nyasi ochopo, ma sechemoko kelo gombo mar hepo  jok maikelo kod bet dala.‘’ ne owacho e giko.

eng: Recently, rapper and events guru Muthoni the Drummer Queen caused a storm on social media after she blasted errant event organizers whose sole intention has been making many with negligent regard to people’s wellbeing.
luo: Ndalo matin mokalo, jathum kendo jataa nyasi Muthoni the Drummer Queen ne okelo paro mopogore kuonde mag tudruok manyasani bang'  kudho jotaa nyasi ma dwaro gi maduong' en jwang'o jii mang'eny kaluore kod chal masani mar  dak.

eng: Her words were echoed by fellow showbiz bigwig Reign Mwendwa who said that putting events on hold right now is the most prudent thing to do.
luo: Wechenego ne osir kod wadgi showbiz bigwig Reign Mwendwa mane owacho ni chungo nyasi sani en gima ber mokalo.

eng: With the festivities edging closer by the day, one cannot help but wonder what we’ll wake to come the New Year.
luo: Kod odiechieng' e sikuku chopo machieg'ni, one ng'atno manyalo konyo kata kamano nyalo mana wuoro kaka higa manyien biro chalo.

eng: However, it is more than evident for all and sundry that the dilemma to bring back events or have humanity on the top of organizers’ priority lists is a struggle that cannot be understated.
luo: Kata kamano jii tee neno paro matek ne jotaa chenro madong'o e pimo duogo kendo nyasi kata dich kod ngima dhano e kinde midhiero mar Covid-19 ma en lueny ma ok yot.

eng: Does the end justify the means?
luo: Bende giko kelo nyalo?

eng: How club owners are maximizing on profits despite pandemic
luo: Kaka weg nyasi yuto e kinde midhiero.

eng: There were mixed reactions after a video released by musician Muthoni the Drummer blasting her fellow event organisers in the entertainment industry who ignored the soaring numbers of the Covid-19 cases and went ahead to host gigs.
luo: Paro mopogore osebete kaluore kod bidio manene ogol kod jathum Muthoni the Drummer kakudho jotaa nyasi wetene, e kambi mar miyo jii nyiero, mane ochayo medruok mang'eny mar Covid-19 kendo odhi mbele bago nyasi.

eng: “It is extremely reckless. I’m ashamed of you. You know yourselves,” she ranted.
luo: “En jwangruok miwuoro. Ukuodo wiya. Ung'eru kendu,” ne odhao.

eng: Muthoni’s concerns seemed to have fallen on deaf ears with showbiz activities, which had been crippled for the better part of this year, going on uninterrupted in various entertainment spots throughout the country with little concern if any.
luo: Weche Muthoni nenore ni ne oluar e lwanda kaluore kod rochruok mag chenro mar showbiz mane ochan timo e kind higani e kuonde miyo jii nyiero ponono ne ong'e rochruok mora amora.

eng: The sad part is Kenyans will have to shoulder their own expenses.
luo: Kama lit ne ni jokenya ne nyaka yiengore kuom chudogi.

eng: Vineyard - The recently refurbished entertainment spot on Kiambu recently launched its Reggae Meets Live Music Night, which will feature a deejay with lapses involving various bands performing in between the intervals.
luo: Vineyard - Kar miyo jii nyiero ma nyocha ochier e gwenge mar Kiambu , machieg'ni nochako Reggae Meets Live Music Night, mane nyiso kendo tang'o deejay,e kinde bende goyo thumbe band mopogre opogre.

eng: The host, Deejay Double Trouble was hosting Graviti Band, Band Linda and was assisted on the decks by Steve Junior, Deejay Prince while MC Philipo put his hype skills to work.
luo: Jataa chenro,Deejay Double Trouble ne tayo Graviti Band gi Band Linda kane ikonye kod Steve Junior, Deejay Prince e seche ma MC Philipo neketo lony kod ng'eyo mare kinde tich.

eng: With revellers catching up after the disappointing Harambee Stars versus Comoros game, word soon went round that a police lorry had been spotted sending everyone into a panic.
luo: Kinde ma joyuor nyasi temo chopo e nyasi bang' chwanyruok e opich adhula e kind Harambee Stars kod Comoros , buok nobetie e kind jii bang' wachore ni none machieg'ni loch polise.

eng: Kitengela - It’s the new entertainment hub in Athi River with numerous clubs, piled on the same stretch try their best to outshine each other.
luo: Boma mar Kitengela manitiere kod kuonde mor kod math mang'eny moger machieg'ni  kod jowetegi, temo matek uso makelo  piem ekindgi.

eng: Such was the case last Sunday afternoon, with the two households clubs Pavillion and Halcyon playing a you can’t beat me game.
luo: Weche nechalo kamano e odhiambo mar chieng' jumapil mokalo kama kwonde math Pavillion kod Halcyon manitiere machieg'ni, netugo tugo mar onge ng'ama ber moloyo wadgi.

eng: Revellers came from as far as Nairobi just to have some fun.
luo: Joyuor nyasi maya mabocho kaka boma mar Nairobi ne omolo mondo giyud mana mor.

eng: Pavilion - It was a mega party showdown featuring some of the biggest names in the game.
luo: Pavilion ma en nyasi mar tugo mane oting'o moko kuom nyinge mideo.

eng: Hosted by SpinCycle entertainment deejay Mr T alongside MC Jose ushered Mejja whose hits are currently topping the charts with spinmaster Joe Mfalme on the ones and twos.
luo: Mane otaa kod deejay mar kambi miyo jii nyiero mar SpinCycle kod  Mr T ebath MC Jose ne oguelo Mejja ma thumbene sani winjore ahinya kanyakla kod spinmaster Joe Mfalme.

eng: Just from the parking lot, it was evident that the event was sold out.
luo: Ng'iyo bath kuonde chung'o nyamburko, nonyiso mipadhi e nyasi.

eng: According to MC Jose, body temperature test were conducted and “despite the huge turnout, we occasionally reminded revellers about the need to observing the health regulations like social distancing,” he said.
luo: Kaluwore gi MC Jose, ne otim pimo mag liet mag del kendo ka opogore kod kwan jii mang'eny, newakao kinde matin parone joyuoro nyasi chike mag piny owacho e kedo kod midhiero mar Covid-19 kaka bedo mabor kod nyawadu e kwonde romo,” ne owacho.

eng: Just a few metres, Kriss Darlin’s unit Dohty Family, was entertaining yet another full house during their weekly Reggae Sundays.
luo: Ma ok bor, jakanyo mar Kriss Darlin ma en Dohty Family bende nemoro oganda mang'eny e kinde chenro mar Reggae Sundays mane timore wik ka wik.

eng: This is the third consecutive month and we are still strictly adhering to health precautions.
luo: Ma en dwe mar adek mapod waluwo ahinya dwaro mag migao mar thieth.

eng: We encourage our clients to start with the afternoon brunch and are shut by 8pm,” said the club’s entertainment manager.
luo: Wagiyo jonyiewo mondo ochak kod kanyakla mar chiemo mar okinyi kod mano mar odiechieng' ma ibiro lor saa ariyo mar otieno,” meneja matayo yore mor, ne owacho.

eng: The Outdoor - In an outdoor event at the Carnivore themed park and chill where revellers got entertained in the comfort of their cars.
luo: Nyasi mar Outdoor midendoni park and chill en nyasi ma itayo oko mar ot matimore Carnivore Kama joyuor nyasi yudo mor e seche magiyueyo ei nyamburko.

eng: The Outdoor, which has constantly gained popularity was a success with various revellers seemingly because of the minimal contact as most prefer to sit in their cars.
luo: Nyasi mar Outdoor ne ong'ere ahinya e kind joyuor nyasi mopogore nikech dwoko chien yore mag romo e seche ma oganda mang'eny ohero bet ei nyamburko.

eng: The massive club along Mombasa road, The Tunnel, wasn’t left behind either and after hosting DJ Malaika, Saturday night was the ultimate battle of the siblings as DJ Nick Dee took on his younger brother DJ Moh in the Takeover themed night.
luo: Kar mor mar Tunnel mayudore e geng' Mombasa road ok owe chien kendo bang' gwelo DJ Malaika,chieng' ngeso gotieno ne en piem manonee e kind joot e seche mas DJ Nick Dee ne okawo kuom owadgi matin DJ Moh e piem miluongoni night.

eng: Sincerely Daisy, 40 Sticks lead in 2020 Kalasha Awards nominations
luo: Sincerely Daisy, 40 Sticks ne otelo e yiero mag Kalasha mane otimore e higa mar 2020 (2020 Kalasha Awards nominations)

eng: Only a month after it premiered on Netflix, Sincerely Daisy has emerged as the movie to beat during this year’s Kalasha International Film and TV Awards whose nominees have been unveiled.
luo: Dwe achiel kende bang'e nenore e Netflix, Sincerely Daisyosewuok kaka tipo mar vidio ma idhi tang' higani e kinde mar Kalasha International Film and TV Awards ma jochung' mare oseyangi.

eng: With 13 nominations in the 16 main Film categories, the film, an urban story about family, young love, timeless friendships and the reality of tough economic times leads in a list dominated by the biggest Kenyan films released in the recent past.
luo: Kod yiero 13 mag kidienj filim madong'o 16 , filim, an urban story about family, young love, timeless friendships kod the reality of tough economic times otelo e kwan ma filimbe mag Kenya mane ogol higni matin mokalo,ng'enye.

eng: The top four will battle it out in the ceremony’s traditional prestigious slots; Best Original Screenplay, Best Sound Design, Best Director, Best Editor, Best Lead Actress in a Film, Best Lead Actor in a Film and Best Production Design.
luo: Namba achiel nyaka ang'wen biro piem e nyasi malich e kidienje mabeyo miluongoni; Best Original Screenplay, Best Sound Design, Best Director, Best Editor, Best Lead Actress in a Film, Best Lead Actor in a Film gi Best Production Design.

eng: Other nominees have everything to celebrate for having made it to the lean list from a whopping 1,036 entries submitted this year.
luo: Jii moko ma oyier nigi mor mar chopo ekwan mar jii maromo 1,036 mane ochiwo kwayogi higani.

eng: Coming on the heels of Sincerely Daisy is Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis and 40 Sticks all with 12 nominations each, while Uradi has nine.
luo: Koa etiend Sincerely Daisy en Family Meeting, Midlife Crisis gi  40 Sticks duto moro ka moro oyier 12, seche ma Uradi oyier.

eng: It is a re-match of some of the biggest names that have dominated the winners' scorecard in the past such as Sarah Hassan and Nick Mutuma, newcomers have made a statement with a significant number of nominations.
luo: En piem kendo,nyinge jotuke madongo mosebet ka kao loch kaka Sarah Hassan gi Nick Mutuma, welo bende osegolo duondgi kaluwore gi kwan maduong' mar joma oyier.

eng: While Sincerely Daisy’s new acts got them recognised, 40 Sticks has an assortment of fresh talents in film production such as Enos Olik and Lucas Bikedo, both famous for music production.
luo: Ekinde ma tugo manyien mar Sincerely Daisy ne omiyo gi ng'ere, tugo mar 40 Sticks ne okelo jopok manyien echich golo filim kakaEnos Olik gi Lucas Bikedo, duto mong'ere e golo thum.

eng: The Kalasha Commission also introduced the Best Children category to fill in the gap of the growing need for children content.
luo: Kamisen mar Kalasha bende ne okelo kidieny mar tuke nyithindo mondo opong dwaro mar gige nyithindo mamedore.

eng: “From our Audience Development Strategy research, there has been a growing need for children content on our screens and as a result, the Commission introduced the Best Children Production category to acknowledge the producers who have developed concepts to accommodate our children as screen audiences,” said the Kenya Film Commission CEO, Timothy Owase.
luo: “Kuom ratiro mag dongo jo nenowa, dwaro osebetie mar dwaro tuke nyithindo e TV kendo mano osemiyo kamisen golo kidieny maber mar nyithindo kendo mar fwenyo jogol tuke nyithindo,” Jatend Kenya Film Commission Timothy Owase, ne owacho.

eng: “At the beginning of this year, it seemed as though Covid-19 would halt production and affect content creation altogether. However, our TV shows are on the rise and Kenyan films are being premiered on global platforms,” Owase remarked as he stressed the resilience of Kenyan filmmakers who have continued to make huge strides in these trying times.
luo: “E chak higani, ne nenore ka gima Covid-19 ne dhi chungo golo tuke kendo chacho loso tuke. Kata kamano, tuke mag TV osemedore kendo inyisogi kuonde nyis mag piny ngima,” Owase ne owacho kane omedo chwalo +A134ed nyagruok mag jolos tuke ma Kenya mosemedo go ondamo madongo ekinde mag tembe.

eng: “This year, the stories are more authentic and relatable and filmmakers are pushing the boundaries of creativity”, stated James Kanja, the Kalasha nine-member jury chairperson.
luo: “Higani, siganago gin adier kendo gi wuoye gik matimore to jolos tuke bende medo chwalo okang mag loso tuke," James Kanja jakom mar duol mar ochiko mar Kalasha ne owacho.

eng: Maisha Magic’s Pete, Majuto, Kovu and Selina dominated the Best TV Drama, Best Lead Actress in a TV Drama and Best Lead Actor in a TV Drama.
luo: Tuke mag Pete, Majuto, Kovu gi Selina minyiso e Maisha Magic, oselaro kidienje mabeyo mag Best TV Drama, Best Lead Actress in a TV Drama gi Best Lead Actor in a TV Drama.

eng: Popular TV drama show Maria got three nominations.
luo: Tugo mar TV mar Maria ne oyudo yiero didek.

eng: Pulse Music Video Awards 2020 submission deadline extended
luo: Tarik mar oro kwayo mar mich mong'ere kaka Pulse Music Video Awards 2020 ochwal nyime.

eng: As the momentum builds towards the region’s most prestigious music awards, the Pulse Music Video Awards (PMVAs), artistes have been given more time to submit their entries in the various competing categories.
luo: E seche ma ilo medore korieyo nyasi mogen , jothumbe osemedi thuolo mang'eny mar chiwo kwayogi epiem mag kidienje mopogore.

eng: Due to public demand, the entry submission deadline slated for this week has been moved to November 24, even as the submissions hit a record 1,000 yesterday.
luo: Kaluwore gi dwaro mar oganda, tarik mar oro kwayo mane ochan koro ose chwal nyaka Novemba  tarik 24, eseche ma kuayo ne osechopo 1000 kanye oromo nyoro.

eng: This year’s gala will enjoy an expanded approach that will factor in fresh categories.
luo: Romo mar mich ma higani, biro winjo mit mar medo kidienje manyien.

eng: Moving from the 11 competitive categories featured in the last five years, the December glitz affair will see four more awards dished out including Best Hip-hop Video of the Year and Virtual Concert of the Year.
luo: Koa e kidienje mag piem 11 mosekel e higni abich mosekalo, romo mag tuke ma Desemba biro neno mich moko ang'wen ma ibiro chiu moriwo Vidio mar higa mag Best Hip-hop gi Virtual Concert of the Year.

eng: The other categories include Video Vixen of the Year, Male Video of the Year, Female Video of the Year, New Artist of the Year, Best Gospel Video of the Year, Best Collaboration of the Year, Best Choreography of the Year, Best Breakthrough Video of the Year and Best Group Video of the Year.
luo: Kidienje moko oriwo Video Vixen of the Year, Male Video of the Year, Female Video of the Year, New Artist of the Year, Best Gospel Video of the Year, Best Collaboration of the Year, Best Choreography of the Year, Best Breakthrough Video of the Year kod Best Group Video of the Year.

eng: There will also be an award for the Best Producer of the Year, Viewers’ Choice Video of the Year, Best Virtual Concert of the Year, Best Virtual Deejay Mix of the Year, Best Music Video Dance Challenge of the Year and Best Virtual Band of the Year.
luo: Bende biro betie mich mar Best Producer of the Year, Viewers’ Choice Video of the Year, Best Virtual Concert of the Year, Best Virtual Deejay Mix of the Year, Best Music Video Dance Challenge of the Year kod Best Virtual Band of the Year.

eng: Stamping authority on the finest acts in Kenya’s showbiz scene, the annual event brings the entertainment industry players together in a live TV ceremony where winners are honoured. Last year’s big winners included Khalighraph Jones (Male Video of the Year for Leave Me Alone), Nadia Mukami (Female Video of the Year for Radio Love), Nviiri The Storyteller (New Artiste of The Year for Pombe Sigara) and Sailors who took home the New Wave Video, Best Group and Viewer’s Choice of The Year.
luo: Telo machuo kogno e tuke mabeyo mogik Kenya, e nyasi mar higa kelo jotugo kanyakla e romo kama joloch duto ibiro mi mich. Joloch madongo ma higa mokalo ne oriwo kaka Khalighraph Jones (Ma en loch e kidieny mar chuwo e vidio mar higa mar Leave Me Alone), Nadia Mukami (Kidieny mar mine e vidio mar higa mar Radio Love), Nviiri The Storyteller (Jathum mawendo e vidio mar higa mar Pombe Sigara) kod Sailors mane oting'o mich mar the New Wave Video, Best Group and Viewer’s Choice of The Year.

eng: How things fell apart for three Kenyan concerts this past weekend
luo: Kaka gik moko ne ok odhi kare ne nyasi adek giko juma mokaloni

eng: Ahealthy amount of financial mismanagement, poor security, artists mishandled, underage attendance - this concoction is what besieged Nai Fest this past weekend.
luo: Omenda mang'eny moselal, arita kuwe marach, tiyo marach gi jongolo, joyuoro matin - magi tee ne okedho budho mar Nai Fest giko juma mokalo.

eng: A number of artists who were scheduled to perform did not take to stage, including Reekado Banks, who was set to headline the event.
luo: Ng'eny jothum mane  onego gochi ne ok ogocho, nyaka Reekado Banks, mane owinjore otelne nyasi.

eng: And while socialite and event organiser, Bridget Achieng came out to blame the Government and curfew regulations, narrating in a post “The Government stopped the music, the main artiste (Reekado) could not perform, but revellers were happy."
luo: E kinde ma jataa nyasi ma rahuma, Bridget Achieng ne owuok oko kendo chayo  piny owacho kod chike mag loro wuodhe, ka osomo andike ma omi duong' ni "Piny owacho ochungo thum, jathum maduong' (Reekado) ok ne nyal gocho kata kamano joyuor nyasi to ne mor."

eng: "It was past curfew the rules have to be followed,” Reekado’s team told another tale.
luo: "Ne en bang' seche moket mag wuodhe kendo chike nya luu” riuruok mar Reekado ne owacho e gano.

eng: “The contract agreement was that Reekado was to be paid the remaining balance of his performance fee once he arrived in the country. The organiser was supposed to pay the remaining amount Sh540,000 on Saturday morning before Reekado would take to the stage later in the day,” a  member of Reekado Banks’ management team, who sought anonymity, revealed.
luo: “Winjruok eyor andike newacho ni Reekado ne onego ochul balang' mag gocho ponono ne odonjo e kenya. Jataa chenro nonego chieng' ngeso gokinyi chul Reekado balang' mar Sh540,000 kapok nobiro chako gocho,” achiel kuom jokanyo matayo yore omenda mag Reekado,ne owacho ka ok en kod adiera.

eng: Reports that an attendee died following injuries from Nai Fest during the weekend after a confrontation in unclear circumstances, is the boiling point of poor security measures to control an event.
luo: Lupode mane okoyangore maber ni e giko juma jayuor nyasi moro ne owito ngimane bang' yudo inyruok Nai Fest en wach mawachore ahinya ewi arita kwe mag tayo nyasi.

eng: A patient is said to have been brought in at Melchizedek Hospital along Ngong Road by a group of boys who later fled.
luo: Jatuono wachore ni noter kod rowere moko,mabende nodok, e hospital mar Melchizedek mayudore egeng' ndara mar Ngong.

eng: With 3,800 tickets sold according to a Nai Fest management crew, the later reported number of 7,000 plus turn-out was remarkable, but over half the ticket sale ratio made into the venue.
luo: Kaluwore kod jotelo mag Nai Fest otiko 3,800 ne ousi, bang'e kwan oganda mane onee moingo 7,000 ne gino maber mokalo kata kamano nus mag otiko emane ousi.

eng: Multiple cases of day-light theft, rape, and underage being allowed into the party have overshadowed the event’s turn-out success.
luo: Kwan jii mayuoro chenro oserocho timruok maber mag nyasi kaluwore kod kes mang'eny mag kuo odiechieng' alanga, bembo kod yiene nyithindo mapok oromo higni 18 donjo e nyasi.

eng: “Even though I’m proud that the gig could do such numbers, it’s fair to say that it was poorly handled, and there was a lack of professionalism.” Caesar Obare, a member of the organising committee said to Pulse.
luo: “Kata kamano amor ni thum ne nyalo kelo kwan jii marom kamano, ber wacho ni oknotaye maber kendo ne okoso rieko mar ng'eyo.” Caesar Obare ma en achiel kuom jokomiti mar tayo chenro ne owacho ne Pulse.

eng: Forget professionalism, basic decorum, respect and diligence was so costly.
luo: Ka iweyo koso ng'eyo rieko, chanruok , luor kod chir ok ne onere.

eng: Too many cases of battery, assault and attempted robbery took the shine of stellar performances.
luo: Kes mang'eny mag agoko, yenyo kod temo mecho oknomoro jothumbe mideo.

eng: More incidents took the air out of the room but party-goers continued to enjoy themselves amidst the chaos.
luo: Timbe moko mang'eny ne otimore oko kata kamano joyuor nyasi ne odhi nyime kod nyasi maok odewo tulo go.

eng: “I got robbed at NaiFest” quickly became a trend after influencer Shaq The Yungin opened the can of worms that then spewed on to many others sharing their experiences at the day time brunch gig.
luo: “Ne okuala NaiFest” en wach manewachore gi jok mamoko mane nigi ng'eyo e wachno, e kinde thum mar odiechieng'  bang'   Shaq The Yungin kwedo timbe aila machal kod mago.

eng: “You should be walking with a gang”, “You should buy a Glock”, “Sorry Shaq, Nairobi is crazy”, were the sentiments as friends and fans consoled with the embarrassed personality.
luo: “Onego uwuoth e grup”, “onego unyiew Glok”, “Watimo mos Shaq, Nairobi osebiro marach”, ne gin weche mane osiepe kod joherane netimogo mos ne jogo mane osekale maundugo.

eng: We were literally entering a den of thieves.
luo: Newadonjo e dago mar jokuoye.

eng: After the first Nai Fest, we thought they would have addressed the issues of the first edition, but we were wrong.
luo: Bang' nyasi mokuongo mar Nai Fest, newaparo ni oyudo giseloso ywak mokuongo, kata kamano ne ok en adier.

eng: At a point, it felt like we were fighting for our lives.
luo: Nochopo kama nechalo ni wakedo ne ngimawa.

eng: We went to a certain terrace that could oversee the event and you could just see the number of people who weren’t there to enjoy themselves, an anonymous attendee told Pulse.
luo: Jayuor nyasi ma ok noyang nyinge ne owacho ne  Pulse kama, "Koa e pith newanyalo neno ji duto kendo newaneno ji mathoth mane ok ne yud mor e kinde nyasi."

eng: In a graphic video uploaded to Instagram, radio presenter Shaquille Oduk was bruised and battered explaining his ordeal of being ambushed as he was leaving the event.
luo: E vidio mane oketi e Instagram nyiso kaka jalendo mar radio Shaquille Oduk ne oyudo gocho kod hinyruok e seche mane owuok e nyasi.

eng: He lost his iPhone during the incident.
luo: Kindego bende nowito simbe mar iPhone.

eng: The lack of readily-available transport was a major issue leaving the crowd stranded and vulnerable.
luo: Koso yudo yore wuodhe mapiyo nokelo pek ne oganda maqng'eny mane odiwo.

eng: It was a thief’s heaven and that’s exactly what it turned out to be.
luo: Ne en mor jokuoge kendo mano ekaka nobedo.

eng: “There was security hired, police did a sweep before the event, a partnership with Matter Hospital, but I think the organisation could do a better job at managing the events more thoroughly and ensure people’s safety,” Obare told Pulse.
luo: “Nenitiere jo arita kuwe manoguel, polise mane obiro kapok nyasi ochakore, mane oriwore kod hospital mar Matter Hospital, kata kamano aparo ni riwruogno nyalo tayo maber nyasi kod keto arita maber mar kwee e kind oganda,” Obare ne owacho ne Pulse.

eng: Gengetone Festival in Machakos caused an outburst from the performers due to non-payments and multiple no-shows.
luo: Nyasi mar Gengetone manotimore Machakos ne okelo koko koya kuom jothumbe kaluwore kod koso chudo kod koso timruok nyasi mang'eny.

eng: Complaints from artists made more headlines than the attempt at bringing together folks for a common good.
luo: Ywak mag jothumbe ne omii pek moloyo yore riwo kanyakla jobuor nyasi.

eng: First, it was Ex-ray of Boondocks Gang who led the rant-fest that acts could barely even make it to the event with basic riders not offered for performers.
luo: Mokuongo grup mar Ex-ray of Boondocks Gang ema nochako goyo thum mane ok nyal dhi nyime matut e kinde ma jothum maoknoguel ema negocho.

eng: “Respect artists.” He said in a long video.
luo: Ne owacho e bor vidiono ni,“Miuru jothumbe luor.”

eng: The Gengetone act went on to apologize to fans that purchased tickets to watch them live, stating that he needed the cash to provide a livelihood for him and his family.
luo: Jathum mar Gengetone nodhi nyime kwayo joherane mane onyiewo otiko mar nene ka ogo thum ng'uono, ka owachoni ne oduaro omenda mar konyruok mare owuon kod mano mar joode.

eng: Willis Raburu who was touted to be among organisers and made an appearance, and would later distance himself from the horror show.
luo: Willis Raburu mane onee kaka achiel kuom jotaa nyasi, ne osudo mabor gi rochruok mane dhi nyime.

eng: According to him, artists were cheated and outstanding balances are the reason as to why the event that stacked a line-up of Jua Cali, Mbogi Genje, VDJ Jones and many others to perform failed.
luo: Kaluwore kode, jothumbe ne owuondi kendo balang' ema omiyo jothumbe mane okete e lai kaka Jua Cali, Mbogi Genje, VDJ Jones kod mamoko ne otamre goyo thum.

eng: Furthermore, Kikwetu and Nai Fest have been poorly exposed for their ‘influencer-marketing strategy’ to sell tickets.
luo: Ewi mago, Kikwetu kod Nai Fest osefweny yore magitiyogo maricho mag uso otiko.

eng: The idea that influencers are crowd pullers is a myth.
luo: En wach awach ni paro mag jogo manitiere kod huma madong'o yuayo oganda machieg'ni kodgi.

eng: Kikwetu was fashioned to pull huge crowds, but it was false hype in reality despite artists’ dedication to put on a show.
luo: Kikwetu ne ober kaka mar yuayo oganda mang'eny, magadiera ne en owuora ka oweyo chuny mag jothumbe e chano  nyasi.

eng: Out of the many cars in the Drive-Inn concert, a quarter were complimentary tickets and this was again the case intimated that over 500 influencers were hired to promote Nai Fest and a high number of attendants had tickets handed out to them by organisers and influencers.
luo: Achiel kuom ang'wen mag weg nyamburko mane obiro e nyasi nenikod otiko kendo ne owachore ni jotieg weche 500 ne oguel mondo oland wach nyasi kendo kwan jii mang'eny mane oyuoro ne oyudo otiko kowuok kuom jotieg weche gi jotaa nyasi.

eng: Pseudo posters promoting artists that would not come such as Migos were also employed.
luo: Bende noket milome maonge wegi malando jothumbe mane ok nedhi yuoro kaka Migos.

eng: Tanasha Donna’s management tells Pulse she pulled out a day before the gig because, despite her performance fee of Sh350,000 being discounted by Sh100,000, the organisers could not afford to pay her to use her image to promote the event.
luo: Telo mar Tanasha Donna wachone Pulse ni ne othichre oko e giko odiechieng' mogik mar nyasi kata ne nengo goyo thum ne oduok chien koya sh350,000 nyaka Sh100,000 nikech jotaa nyasi ne ok nyal chule kuom tiyo kod pichane e lando nyasi.

eng: “Tanasha had fans from Kisumu, Nakuru, Coast and all over pull through just to see her and then the Nai Fest guys pull a shady move last minute saying they do not have even a deposit. She had agreed to perform with half the figure, and get paid later with a contractual agreement to seal the same, but it wasn’t to be after Bridget shortchanged this.” The La Vie singer’s management told Pulse.
luo: “Johera mag Tanasha mawuok Kisumu, Nakuru, Coast kod kuonde mamoko neoikore nene mak mana esaa mogik jo Nai Fest ne ochiwo buok bang' wacho ni nene tek mondo gichop kata chudo mokuong'o. Ne owinjore goyo thum komiye nus mar chudo kendo tieko chudo bang'e kaka winjruok mar orak lero kata kamano weche oknodhi kare bang' Bridget loko paro.” Telo mar jathum La Vie ne owacho ne Pulse.

eng: Other artists that are said not to have performed including Sailors who quote a Sh350,000 tag to perform also backed out after being snubbed at the last minute.
luo: Jothumbe mamoko mawachore ni ok nogocho gin kanyakla kod Sailors mane ogoyo neng'o gocho mar Sh350,000 mabende saa mogik nothich oko.

eng: While artists such as Boutross, Khaligraph Jones, and Otile Brown said to have gigged were paid the full amount.
luo: E seche majothumbe mamoko mane ogocho kaka Boutross, Khaligraph Jones, kod Otile Brown wacho ni negiyudo chudo gi te.

eng: The same bouncers hired to maintain order and a free-flowing event then became violent as things flared up backstage.
luo: Bonsa mane oguel eketo arita kwee kendo etayo chenro e yoo makare ne olokore mager bang' rochruok chako bete kachien.

eng: It’s no secret that an event doesn’t always go flawlessly perfect, Nai Fest 2 was however further desolated when it was reported that a female in rapper Gwaash’s entourage was harassed and beaten by security despite having a pass.
luo: Oknyal pandre ni nitie nyasi moro amora ma okosetaaga eyo makare, Nai Fest 2 ne odong' nono bang' yudo lupot ni jakony jathum moro mamiyo, Gwaash ne osandi kendo ogo kod joket arita kwee kata obedo ni ne en kod.

eng: Influencers associated with the event such as Fred Omondi responded harshly to backlash at the event’s incompetence with a now-deleted Instagram post.
luo: Jataa nyasi Fred Omondi ne oduoko gi ich wang' rochruok mane obetie kaluore kod andika mane oketo e Instagram ma gi sani noseruchi.

eng: He reiterated that it was the best event and the fans got premium value paying Sh2,000 for local acts rather than headliner Reekado.
luo: Ne owacho ni nyasi neber moloyo kendo johera noyudo dhadhu mar omendagi mar Sh2,000 eneno thumbe magwa wawuon moloyo mago mag Reekado ma en jathum momi pek.

eng: After the atrocious mishap that was Gengetone Festival the weekend prior, this was a moment of redemption for the events sector in particular but it now hangs in the balance after things transpired the way they did.
luo: Bang' koso mor e nyasi ma ne otimre giko juma mokalo mar Gengetone, ma ne en thuolo mar chiero mor kata kamano wachni pod tek pimo bang' rochruok mano betie.

eng: The event is planning a follow-up edition on a reported date of December 12th.
luo: Nyasi chano golo andike mar luwo kaka weche nobedo e odiechieng' ma ibiro landi tarik 12 dwe mar desemba.

eng: Tanasha’s management, however, says they would not be interested in getting into business again.
luo: Jotend Tanasha kata kamano owacho ni ok gibidwaro kendo timo kodgi ohala.

eng: On top of that health security is a major concern according to fans that have been privy to these events.
luo: Ewi mano, kaluore kod johera maosebedo kayuoro nyasi, arita kuwe makare en gino maduong' moloyo.

eng: There is food, music, lights, everything, but masks and sanitization points.
luo: Nitiere chiemo,ler,gimoro amora maok oweyo abuog rombe kod kuonde logo lwedo.

eng: "Corona lives in these events, and it’s hard to imagine how they market it as no mask, no entry yet no one gives a hoot on the grounds,” said a reveller Simon at Kikwetu.
luo: Simon ma en jayuor nyasi ne owacho ka entie Kikwetu ni, "Tuo mar Corona yudore kwonde nyasigi, kendo tek paro kaka jotaa nyasi lendo maonge dewo, koso donjo e nyasi maonge abuog rombe,”

eng: Additionally, propaganda that Mo Sound went ahead and cut off the sound at Kikwetu, and that guys never even wanted to travel out of town for an event at Gengetone Fest because of Curfew regulations are some of the drama in these shows.
luo: Kimedo, wachore ni Mo Sound ne odhi nyime kendo ng'ado thum Kikwetu, kendo joyuoro ne ok dwar wuotho oko mar boma e nyasi mar Gengetone Fest nikech chike kafiu mabende chalo kaka tuke e nyasigi.

eng: Artists are short of stage-time in line with Covid-19 government protocol so the idea that you will get a fully-fledged show is something to consider when attending these concerts.
luo: Jothum bende onge thuolo malach kaluwore gi chike mag Covid-19 ma sirkal oketo, koro paro ni ibiro yudo seche mang'eny e nyasi gi onego ipar ahinya saa ma idhi enyasigi.

eng: The manner in which Nai Fest brand will reconcile the damage and losses to the affected will be a light step towards how serious showbiz events in Kenya can be judged.
luo: Yoo ma nyasi mar Nai Fest biro losogo kethruok gi lal mosebedo ne joma ne oyudo chandruok biro bedo okang' mayot e yore minyalo pog go nyasi mag jothum mitimo Kenya.

eng: This weekend, Thrift Social featuring Amapiano and Kwaito artist Samthing Soweto, will have to carry the events sector and prove Covid physical outdoor concerts can be pulled off Safe
luo: Giko jumani, Thrift Social kanyakla gi Amapiano kod Kwaito artist Samthing Soweto, biro tayo nyasi kendo nyiso ni nyasi mar romo elaru ekinde mag corona nyalore eyo makare.

eng: Spectacular night show returns to illuminate sky above Fort Jesus
luo: Nyasi ma timoro gotieno oduogo kendo dhi medo ler e bor polo ma ni e wi Fort Jesus

eng: The Mombasa night sky above Fort Jesus Museum exploded in a blaze of colour on Wednesday following the reintroduction of a spectacular pyrotechnics event.
luo: Nyasi mar Mombasa night sky above Fort Jesus Museum ne ochako gi moro chieng' tich adek kaluwore gi nyasi mar chier mar pyrotechnics.

eng: A huge 270-kg firework display by Jay Pyrotechnics Ltd illuminated the dark skies and signaled the launch of the Fort Jesus Enchanting Sound and Light Multimedia Show.
luo: Pilni mar mach maromo kilo 270 mane onyis gi kambi mar Jay Pyrotechnics ne okelo ler e mudho mane ranyisi mar yango chenro mar Multimedia kod duol mar Fort Jesus.

eng: Pyrotechnics MD Jayshree Suchack said the 40-minute shows, which includes 3D projection mapping and holograms that depict Mombasa's rich history, will be held on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.
luo: Jatelo mar Pyrotechnics Jayshree Suchack ne owacho ni nyasi mar dakika 40, moriwo 3D projection mapping kod holograms manyiso sigand Mombasa, biro timore kochakore chieng' tich ang'wen, abich, Ngeso nyaka Jumapil.

eng: Sports and Culture Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed led Mombasa residents and guests from the hospitality industry in unveiling the show.
luo: Jatend migao mag weche tuke gi yore dak Amina Mohamed ne otayo jodak ma Mombasa kanyakla gi welo moa e chirni mag ruako welo, e yango nyasino.

eng: "We are delighted to be gathered at this historic fort to witness the launch of yet another milestone that serves not only to create awareness on culture and heritage, but also reposition Mombasa as a popular tourist destination," said Dr Amina.
luo: Dr. Amina ne owacho ni, "Wamor romo e nyasi matimore fort mondo wane yengo mar okang machielo mar kelo ng'eyo eweche mag ndalo gi kido, kendo bende gi keto Mombasa okang maber ne jowuoth."

eng: Kenya Tourism Federation chairman Mohamed Hersi said: "We are happy that we have something positive in this crisis over and above beach and bush."
luo: Jakom mar Kenya Tourism Federation Mohamed Hersi ne owacho kama: "Wan gi moro ni nitiere gimoro maber ekind midhiero ewi  dhowath (beach) kod bunge."

eng: Coast Guard destroys Sh. 4 million illegal fishing gears in Kisumu
luo: Joarita mag naam (Coast Guard) neoketho gige lupo ma oklong'o mag omenda maromo Sh. 4 Million Kisumu

eng: The Kenya Coast Guard Service (KCGS) on Friday destroyed illegal fishing gears worth Sh. 4 million in Kisumu.
luo: Duol mar Kenya Coast Guard Service (KCGS) chieng' tich abich ne oketho gige lupo ma oklong'o maromo Sh. 4 million Kisumu.

eng: The illegal fishing gears were detained through enforcement patrols within Lake Victoria to curb indiscriminate fishing which has seen fish production in the lake drop.
luo: Gige lupo ma oklong'o ne omaki ekinde mane itimo patrol mar duoko chien lupo mag rech matindo e naam Victoria mosemiyo rech dok piny.

eng: The 45 illegal nets ranging from monofilament, undersize gillnets, mosquito seine nets and beach were torched at Kisumu pier to deter fishermen from the vice.
luo: Nede 45 ma oklong'o kochakore gi monofilament, undersize gillnets, mosquito seine nets kod beach ne owang' Kisumu mondo otam jolupo kuom tiyo kodgi.

eng: KCGS Director General (DG) Brigadier Loonena Naisho who spearheaded the exercise said over 100 offenders have been arrested in Kisumu, Siaya and Homa Bay counties and will be arraigned in court and charged.
luo: Brigadier Loonena Naisho ma en jatelo maduong (DG) mar KCGS  mane otayo wang'o mag nedego ne owacho ni osemak jii mokalo 100 gi ketho mar lupo e gwenge mag kanti ma Kisumu, Siaya kod Homa Bay kendo ibiro tergi e yim doho.

eng: He said KCGS has enhanced patrols within the lake to enforce the law and ensure that prohibited fishing gears and methods are not exacerbated.
luo: Ne owachoni KCGS osemedo patrol e aluora mag naam mondo oket chike kod neno ni gige lupo kod yore lupo ok okethore.

eng: “Reports indicate that overfishing by organized crime syndicates in Lake Victoria could drive 76 percent of fish species to extinction,” he said.
luo: “Lupode wachoni lupo mokalo wago molosi gi jomahundu manitiere Lake Victoria nyalo lalo atamalo 76 mag kit rech,” Ne owacho.

eng: The use of illegal fishing gears, he added was also to blame for cases of fishermen being harassed by neighboring security agencies.
luo: Lupo gi gik ma oklong'o, ne omedo ni emanyalo miyo jolupowa imonjo gi aritakuwe mag pinje libamba.

eng: The DG called for collaboration with Beach Management Units (BMU) and court officials to eradicate illegal fishing in the lake.
luo: DG bende ne okuayo riuruok mar duol mar Beach Management Units (BMU) kod apisa mag kot mondo otiek lupo mag akuo eyi naam.

eng: Loonena cautioned the BMU’s against destruction of boats and fishing gears of others without following due process of the law.
luo: Loonena bende ne ochiwo siem ne BMU kuom ketho yiedhi kod gige lupo ma ok giluwo ratiro mag chike.

eng: “We have noticed criminal activities where some beach management units take the law unto themselves by destroying boats and nets of others,” he said.
luo: “Waseneno timbe mag achije moko, sechema moko kuom jokanyo mag beach management units makao chik elwetgi kendo gi ketho yiedhi gi nede jomoko,” ne owacho.

eng: He challenged the BMU’s to sensitize fishermen on changing and adapting sustainable modes of fishing to rebuild fish stocks in the lake.
luo: Ne olieko ne BMU’s mondo otieg jolupo e yore mag lokruok kod yieruok e yore lupo mabudho mondo gi ger yuto mag rech e naam.

eng: Raila in Kisumu ahead of Madaraka Day
luo: Raila nitire Kisumu mokuongone nyasi mar Madaraka Day

eng: ODM party leader Raila Odinga is in charm offensive in the lakeside city of Kisumu ahead of President Uhuru Kenyatta’s visit to celebrate Madaraka Day.
luo: Jatend ODM Raila Odinga, nitiere e kampen mar osiep e gwenge mag boma ma Kisumu motelone limbe mar Ker Uhuru Kenyatta e nyasi mar  Madaraka Day.

eng: Raila asked the people of Kisumu to come out and welcome visitors.
luo: Raila ne okwayo jo Kisumo mondo owuog oko mondo orwak welo.

eng: He visited the newly refurbished Jaramogi Oginga Odinga sports complex before addressing residents at the bus terminus, Kondele before heading to Mamboleo, Jomo Kenyatta Sports Complex stadium the venue of the celebrations on 1st June 2021.
luo: Ne olimo Jaramogi Oginga Odinga sports complex mane oyudo neno mayien kapok owuoyo kod jodak e stage mar nyamburko ma Kondele kapok odhi Mamboleo, e paw tuke mar Jomo Kenyatta Sports Complex stadium kama nyasi mag Jun tarik 1 2021 biro timore.

eng: He took the opportunity to assure the residents that BBI is not dead and reggea will be on again.
luo: Ne okawo thuolo mar nyiso jodak ma Kisumu ni BBI pok otho kendo reggea biro duogo.

eng: He says the court process is temptations which they have sent a team of lawyers to argue to the end.
luo: Ne owacho ni gik matimore e doho gin mana tembe kendo giseoro okinde mondo ochwal wach nyaka giko.

eng: Raila says what Kenyans had been promised in the BBI will not go in vain as they prepare a titanic battle in the court of law.
luo: Raila ne owacho ni gima ne ochikne Jo Kenya e BBI ok be dhi nono ekinde ma gi ikorene lweny mager enyim doho.

eng: MOTHERS, NEWS BORNS DETAINED OVER HOSPITAL BILLS
luo: MINE KOD NYITHINDO MAYOM OMAKI NIKECH POK GICHULO OSIPTAL

eng: Over ten mothers and their newly born babies have been detained by St. Akidiva Hospital, in Suna West sub-county of Migori over failure to pay medical bills.
luo: Mine mokalo apar ka achiel kod nyithindgi omaki  ekar thieth ma St.Akidiva, Suna West sub kanti ma Migori ewi koso chudo mar thieth.

eng: The mothers include two whose newly born babies died in the facility said clarity on reference was not availed as they were referred from other facilities whose workers are on strike or overpopulated yet their Linda Mama and NHIF were rejected.
luo: Mine go oriwo ariyo mane nyithindgi otho kar thieth miwacho ler mar ote mar kama negiaye ok ne ochiu nikech ne giaye e osiptende ma jotich ne ogomo kata ne gin gi jotuo mang'eny ka Linda Mama kod NHIF ne otamruok.

eng: George Odhiambo who lost his child in the facility and had earlier given time to bury him said that they arrived at the hospital a week ago and after successful delivery through C-section could not leave with his wife because of the unpaid bill.
luo: George Odhiambo mabende ne olalo nyathine e ospitandno kendo ne osemiye saa mar iko nowacho ni negi chopo e osiptal juma achiel mokalo kendo bang jaode konyre kokalo eyor pala ne ok onyal wuok kod jaode kaluwore gi nengo mapok ochul.

eng: He said the hospital required between Ksh 10,000 to Ksh. 30,000 from them but not allowed to go and look for money adding that they are only allowed access to the toilet and to wash clothes.
luo: Ne owacho ni osiptal ne dwaro omenda mayudore ekind Ksh 10,000 nyaka Ksh. 30,000 koa kuom gi to okne oyiene dhi manyo pesa, komedo ni oyienegi mane dhi echo gi luoko lepgi.

eng: Bernard Odhiambo and Kevin Arwa said they’ve been forced to look for other sources of funds yet they were informed that NHIF and Linda Mama will cater to all bills.
luo: Bernard Odhiambo kod Kevin Arwa ne owacho ni neochunogi manyo yore moko mag yudo omenda kata obeto ni ne owachnegi ni Linda Mama kod NHIF biro chulo pes duto madwarore.

eng: They claimed that their bills had accumulated yet they still have a balance.
luo: Negi wacho ni omenda mibandhogi ne omedore kata obedo ni podi gin gi balang.

eng: According to the hospital’s director Dr. Idagiza Akidiva, they received a circular from NHIF offices not to discharge any patient urging the government to sort out technicalities so that they have smooth operation and patients are released.
luo: Kaluwore gi jatend osiptandno Dr. Idagiza Akidiva, ne gi yudo ote koa apisi mar NHIF machikogi ni kik gi gony jatuo moro amora nyaka piny owacho los ng'ikruok mabiro konyo golo jotuo mayot.

eng: Prepare for another political betrayal, Kuria West Mp Robi
luo: Ikri ne ndhoko machielo mar siasa,Prepare for another political betrayal, jaod bura ma Kuria Robi

eng: As the window for political realignments narrows ahead of the 2022 general elections, bigger political parties are positioning themselves for the big seat, yet to be declared vacant after president Uhuru Kenyatta retires from politics.
luo: Ekinde ma duond buche mag siasa chanre korieyo yiero maduong' mar higa 2022, duond buche madongo ikore ne telo madongo, mochiegni ket ayanga bang ker Uhuru Kenyatta weyo siasa.

eng: The Jubilee Alliance affiliate party United Democratic Alliance (UDA) staunch supporters are however at cross roads, not knowing which side to throw their wait after their exit from the umbrella party.
luo: Johera mag dound bura mar United Democratic Alliance (UDA) mowuok kuom Jubilee Alliance kata kamano, nikod kiawa kaluwore ni gikia koma gi siro bang wuok e duond bura maduong.

eng: UDA’s Mathias Robby of Kuria West has however cautioned ODM party of a looming political betrayal, which he claimed is in the offing.
luo: Joad bura ma Kuria West Mathias Robby maen ja UDA kata kamano ne osiemo duond buch ODM kuom ndhoko mar siasa maowacho ni ng'were.

eng: Mathias said the opposition chief Raila Odinga should stay woke following his previous experience and make valid choices if he expects to win the presidential seat.
luo: Mathias ne owacho ni jatend bura mabalo kod piny owacho Raila Odinga onego chieu kaluwore gi lonyne kendo otim yiero mongirore kapo odwaro kao kom ker.

eng: The legislator while speaking at a burial within his constituency said the recent court ruling that declared the Constitution Amendment Bill (2020) null and void should be awake up call to Raila.
luo: Jaod burano kane wuoyo eyik e constituency ne, ne owacho ni bura mane ong'ad machiegni mane okuedo loko mar chike (Constitution Amendment Bill (2020)) onego chieu Raila.

eng: As Minority groups, he added, their interests were not captured in the document despite Uhuru and Raila vouching for it.
luo: Kaka dhoudi matindo, ne omedo ni dwachgi ne ok oketi e andikago kata obedoni Uhuru kod Raila ne osirogi.

eng: Mathias added that Raila should forget about any political endorsement or support from Mount Kenya region but should instead work towards gaining support from minority communities.
luo: Mathias ne omedo wacho ni wii Raila onego wilgi rueko kata siro mar siasa koa gwenge mag Mount Kenya to onego may siro koa kuom dhoudi matindo.

eng: Migori senator ,Ochilo Ayako while speaking at the same function, said that of importance to electorates at the moment is service delivery.
luo: Seneta mar Migori , Ochilo Ayako kane wuoyo e nyasi nogono, ne owacho ni malichne jopiny en chopo singo mane omigi.

eng: Ayacko took issue with the I’ll fated Migori Governor Okoth Obado , whom he accused of advancing his political agenda and abdicating his other responsibilities.
luo: Ayacko ne loso ewi gavana Okoth Obado, mane owacho ni ne tayoma agenda mage mag siasa kendo ne oweyo ting moko.

eng: Sexual Gender Based Violence on the rise in Nyakach
luo: Rocho ratiro mag terruok omedre Nyakach.

eng: Residents of Nyakach in Kisumu County are questioning the existence of a gang that has continued to rape and defile locals at will.
luo: Jodak ma Nyakach eyi kanti ma Kisumu penjo betie mar jonjore mosebedo kabambo kendo ketho ratiro mag jogweng'.

eng: Horrific stories of the gang atrocities have been told over time and security authorities, according to victims have failed to act on information shared.
luo: Mbekni mag jonjore makelo luoro osego kinde ka mang'eny kendo jochiu arita kaluwore kod joma neoyudo chandruok, pok otimo gimoro ewi wachno.

eng: A non-state actor, Inuka Success Organization has been in the forefront to document cases of sexual gender based violence in the sub county.
luo: Migao ma ok mar piny owacho mong'ere kaka Inuka Success Organization osebedo ong'ala ma nyime mar ndiko buche mag rocho ratiro mag terruok e sub kanti.

eng: The organization coordinator, Victon Onyango, says they are a member organization of the Sexual Gender Based Alliance Kisumu County tasked with the responsibility to coordinate assistance to the survivors.
luo: Jata riwruogno, Victon Onyango, wachoni gin jokanyo mag riuruok mar  the Sexual Gender Based Alliance Kisumu County mane omi ting mar tayo kony ne jokma osekalo etembe gi.

eng: Onyango explains that during the documentation of the SGB violence in the area, it has come to their attention that the stories of the perpetrators are almost similar, an indication that it is a roaming gang.
luo: Onyango lero ni kinde mane gindiko weche mag SGBV e gweng, oseyudore ni sigand achijego chiegni chal, ranyisi ni gin jonjore mawuotho ao yaye.

eng: “It looks like a coordinated rape scenario, because we find similar cases happening same night, where people, two or three breaking into houses, they have same apparatus, torch knife,” he said.
luo: Ne owacho ni“Ochalo bembo mochani, nikechi wayudo buche machalre ka otimore otieno achiel, kama jii ariyo kata adek turo ot kendo gin gi gik machalre kaka torch pala.”

eng: A resident, Jared Ochieng, not his real name, due to the sensitivity of the case, narrates how the gang breaks into the house where his daughters were sleeping and in turn defiled them.
luo: Jadak, Jared Ochieng, ok nyinge sie, kaluwore gi chal mar wachni, gano kaka jonjore ne oturo ot kma nyige ne ninde kendo bambogi.

eng: “My daughters woke me at 2 am to report that some people gained entry into their sleeping room and defiled them,” he said.
luo: “Nyiga ne ochiewo saa aboro otieno go lupot ni jomoko ne oturo ot mane gininde kendo bambo gi,” ne owacho.

eng: Ochieng says he sought medical attention for his three daughters before pursuing justice.
luo: Ochieng neowacho ni ne omanyo thieth mokuongo ne nyige adek kapok neomanyo ratiro mag chike.

eng: His case is among many in the area where rapes, defilements are order of the day and night with no action being taken.
luo: Buche chal gi moko mang'eny e kor gweng ma bembo, rocho ratiro en ng'iyo mapile kendo onge gima otime.

eng: Ochieng noted that her daughters had recognized the voice of one of the perpetrators and police were given the information but little has been done.
luo: Ochieng ne olieko ni nyige ne ofwenyo duond achiel kuom achijego kendo wach ne ochopo ne polis to gima tin manotimore.

eng: “We did report to the police about one of the suspects who is a local, however, we were told to inform the police whenever we spotted the suspect, that sounds crazy,” says Ochieng.
luo: Ochieng ne owacho ni, “Ne wago lupot ne polis ewi achiel kuom achije ma en jagweng, kata kamano, ne owachnwa ni wakone polis saa asaya ma mawaneno achijno, ne owinjore marach.”

eng: For the cases that find their way into the courts, they get frustrated as suspects walk scot free after placing bonds and fines.
luo: Ne buche machopo e doho, jok nitiere ka achich wuotho oko bang chulo bonds kod fwayi.

eng: Onyango says they have followed a number of cases, some stuck in courts, but their ultimate goal is to ensure justice is served.
luo: Onyango wachoni giseluwo buche mang'eny, moko podi omoko e doho, to lek gi maduong' en neno ni ratichgi oyudi.

eng: “We just make sure that justice to the survivors is achieved, we also trace cases that have stalled and see why and the reasons behind the delay,” he said.
luo: “Wadwaro mana neno ni ratich jomo osekalo e litni oyudore, kendo bende waluwo buche mosebudho kendo ng'eyo gima osemiyo gibudhi,” ne owacho.

eng: The organization has conducted a number of awareness creations among the public on the need to report cases of sexual gender based violence.
luo: Riuruogno osetimo kampen mag keto ng'eyo kendo ber mar goyo lupot mag rocho ratiro kod terruok ekind oganda.

eng: “Most of the cases that we have been able to get currently are as a result of the conversations we have had in the community,” he said.
luo: “Ng'eny buche mawasebedogo gi sani gin duoko mag twak mawasebedogo e gweng,” ne owacho.

eng: The conversations have also targeted police officers and administrators in the community.
luo: Twakgo bende osechimo apisa mag polis kod jondong gweng.

eng: “Cases have been reported but surprisingly nobody follows these cases after they happened, they are reported and end that way,” said Onyango.
luo: “Lupode osechiu makmana ni kuom hawi marach onge ng'ato maluwo buchegi bang timruok, igo dhok kendo girumo kamano,” Onyango ne owacho.

eng: Kisumu Medical and Education Trust, (KMET) an indigenous Kisumu based non-governmental organization established to promote quality health and education services across the country has so far since March this year documented six cases of gender based violence within a village in Nyakach.
luo: Kisumu Medical and Education Trust, (KMET) ma en NGO  osebudho Kisumu mane ochak mondo ochwal weche ngima kod somo maber epiny, kochakore due mar adek higani osendiko buche auchiel mag rocho ratiro mag jii e gwenge Nyakach.

eng: Patricia Orao, KMET advocate in policy lead gender justice project says that in collaboration with Equality Now, they are determined to see the six cases go through the judicial process.
luo: Patricia Orao, KMET en okil mar ratiro mag weche chenro mar gender justice wacho ni kagi riwore gi Equality Now, kendo gin kod kinda mar neno ni buche auchielgo okal e yore doho.

eng: “We are taking police officers through capacity building in investigations because what happens if the investigation is shoddy, such cases always collapse,” she says
luo: “Watere apisa mag polis e puonj mar mediro rieko eyore mag timo nonro nikechi gik matimore gin nonro morem, ma mang'enygi podho,” ne owacho.

eng: Orao says the officers are being strengthened on documentations of evidence to be able to take to court water tight cases as a way of discouraging sexual gender based violence cases.
luo: Orao neowacho ni apisa imedo rieko eyor ndiko weche aneno mondo gi bed kod nyalo mar tero kes motegno enyim doho kaka yoo mar tieko rocho ratiro mag terruok (sexual gender based violence).

eng: A local chief, Elizabeth Achieng representing Agoro location, the epicenter of sexual gender based violence, says from October last year, the area has recorded a number of cases on gang rapes and defilements.
luo: Chief, Elizabeth Achieng mar Agoro location, ma en chuny sexual gender based violence, wacho ni kochakore October higa mokalo,  gwengni osendiko kes mang'eny mag bembo.

eng: Achieng says she had made emphasis during her routine public meetings that cases of defilement and rape should be reported immediately after seeking medical attention.
luo: Achieng wachoni ne osejiwo oganda e barasa ni kes mag bembo kod ketho ratiro mag jii onego chiu lupodgi mapiyo kendo mgi manyo thieth. .

eng: “I normally tell my people to report such cases to the authorities after the victims are taken to the hospitals for medication,” she says.
luo: “Ajawacho ne jii mondo ogo dhok mag wechegi ne telo bang yudo thieth e osiptal,” ne owacho.

eng: Locals in Nyabondo protest over poor health services.
luo: Jodak ma Nyabondo ogomo ewi weche thieth mokowinjore.

eng: Locals in Nyakach, Kisumu County, have staged a demonstration over poor health services at Nyabondo Mission Hospital.
luo: Jodak ma Nyakach, Kisumu County, oseketo gomo ewi yore thieth moknikare Nyabondo Mission Hospital.

eng: Carrying placards and twigs, the locals stormed the mission hospital alleging that the management had run down the medical facility.
luo: Kagiting'o oboke, negi muomo mission hospital kagiwacho ni telono ne oseduoko kar thiethno piny.

eng: Levy Hawi, a local, says the management of the hospital has deteriorated over time and it is time to fix the mess.
luo: Levy Hawi, jadak, ne owachoni telo mar ospitandno osebedo kadok piny kuom kinde malach kendo en saa mar loso kethruok.

eng: He says some officers have been looting the hospital without any shame at the expense of the sufferings of patients.
luo: Owachoni apisa moko osebedo ka kualo osiptal maonge wich kuot ewi chandruog jotuo.

eng: Hawi says patients are going without proper food despite being billed and the conditions of the wards are wanting.
luo: Hawi wachoni jotuo dhi maonge chiemo malong'o kata obedo ni gi chudo kendo chal mar wards richo.

eng: Speaking after failing to get an audience with the management at Nyabondo, Hawi says staff at the hospital are ready to work but the management is not ready to avail the required tools.
luo: Kowuoyo bang koso yudo thuolo kod telo mar Nyabondo, Hawi wachoni jotich mag osiptal oikore mar tich to telo ok oikore mar golo gige tich maduarore.

eng: He noted that most of the medical facilities are being bought from outside the hospital at the cost of the patients.
luo: Ne olieko ni gige thieth mang'eny inyiewo oko mar osiptal ewi nengo jotuo.

eng: Hawi says more often patients have failed to get treated due to lack of essential medical facilities.
luo: Hawi wacho ni ng'enyne jotuo chando thieth nikech onge mag gige thieth mochuno.

eng: The locals are calling for an overhaul of the management and a proper vetting of new management with capabilities to run the facility.
luo: Jodak luongo lokruok mar telo kod puotho maber mag telo manyien man kod nyalo mag tayo osiptandno.

eng: None of the management team was at the hospital when the locals stormed in to register their displeasure.
luo: Onge jatelo moro amora mane nitiere e osiptal kinde mane ng'anyo mar jodak nochop mondo oket litgi.

eng: Nyabondo Medical Training College Principal Juma who was also mentioned as those behind the failing of health standards in the facility dismissed the allegations.
luo: Jatend Nyabondo Medical Training College, Juma, mabende ne oluongi kaka achiel kuom jok ma duoko osiptal chien ne okuedo wechego.

eng: Juma says clan politics is at play and they will continue to discharge their duties as required despite the noise.
luo: Juma ne owacho ni siasa mag anyuola netugore kendo gi biro dhi nyime gi timo tijegi kaka duarore maok odeo koko.

eng: Kolwa Central ward in partnership with a Non Governmental Organization has launched a program targeting youth for enrolment at a vocational training.
luo: Ward ma Kolwa Central e winjruok kod migao ma ok mar piny owacho(Non Governmental Organization) oseyango chenro mang'iyo rowere donjo kar tiegruok.

eng: The area MCA George Olwal says the program will benefit young people who are out of school.
luo: MCA magweng'no, George Olwal, neowacho ni chenrono biro konyo rowere mane oweyo skul.

eng: Olwal says the program will be run by Akado Youth Polytechnic and will target youths between the ages of 18 to 35.
luo: Olwal wacho ni chenrono ibiro taa gi Akado Youth Polytechnic kendo biro ng'iyo rowere majohigni 18 nyaka 35.

eng: He says more emphasis will be given to girls noting that those who will be selected will be given a monthly stipend.
luo: Ne owacho ni jiipo mang'eny ibiro mii nyiri kolieko ni jogo ma ibiro yier ibiro mi gimoro matin due ka due.

eng: Speaking to the press in his ward, Olwal called upon the youth who have completed class eight or form four to step out and apply for the short courses.
luo: Kowuoyo ne jofwambo e wardne, Olwal ne oluongo rowere mositieko klas aboro kod mostieko kla apar kod ariyo mondo owuog oko mondo ondikre ne puonjgo.

eng: James Misanze, the facilitator of the organization, community progress youth empowerment institute says they are given hope to young people.
luo: James Misanze, maen jataa riuruok mar, community progress youth empowerment institute wacho ni gi chiwo geno ne joma tindo.

eng: Misenze says some youth dropped out of school may be due to school fees and the program is coming to support them.
luo: Misenze wacho ni nitiere rowere moko mane oweyo skul nikech skul fis kendo koro chenroni biro miyogi kony.

eng: He says the three courses they are offering will give the young people an opportunity to look for jobs elsewhere or start off their businesses.
luo: Owachoni kidienje adek mag somogo magichiwo biro miyo rowere thuolo mag manyo tije kuonde moko kata chako ohandgi gi wegi.

eng: Kenya reports progress in saving the northern white rhino with four new embryos produced
luo: Kenya lando ondamo mar konyo kano kodhi mar northern white rhino kod kodhi ang'wen manoyudore.

eng: Kenya announced Thursday that four new northern white rhino embryos had been produced as efforts to rescue the iconic giant land mammal from extinction gathered momentum.
luo: Kenya ne olando chieng' tich ang'wen nikodhi ang'wen mag northern white rhino mane oyudore ne ogol kaka yoo mar konyo lee maduong kuom lal.

eng: Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS) and a consortium of international scientists said the embryos were produced in March from 19 immature eggs (oocytes) that were harvested from one of the only two surviving female northern white rhino called Fatu.
luo: Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS) kod riuruok mar jotim nonro e piny ngima (international scientists) ne owachoni tonge mane ogol e due mar adek koa e tonge mapok oikore (oocytes) mane ogol kandalogi pok oromo koa  kuom achiel kuom northern white rhino ma mon ariyo miluongo ni (Fatu).
