luo: Owadgi Mark ne owacho ne joma ne obiro e liel niya; “Ji osewacho kendo osendiko gik mang'eny e wi nyaminwa. Kata kamano, Caroline ma uwinjo ka ji woyoe kata ma ji ndiko weche kuome, ok e Caroline ma wang'eyo. Caroline ne en nyako mobolore kendo ne wamor kinde moro amora ma ne en kodwa.”

eng: If my sister did anything wrong, then it was by mistake.
luo: Kapo ni nyaminwani ne otimo gimoro marach, ne obothne.

eng: It has not been confirmed by the DCI whether she killed anyone or not.
luo: DCI pok onyisowa gadier kabe ne onego ng'ato kata ooyo.

eng: He said his sister was religious and often went to the nearby St Joseph’s Catholic Church, Anin, for prayers.
luo: Ne owacho ni nyamin-gi  ne ohero weche din kendo ne ojadhi lemo e kanisa man machiegni kanyo mar St Joseph’s Catholic Church, Anin.

eng: Kangogo’s uncle Robert Kipkorir, who was the family’s spokesman, said until yesterday, the family was yet to know whether Kangogo committed suicide or she was murdered.
luo: Nera mar Kangogo, ma ne wuoyo e lo joodgi ne owacho ni nyaka chop nyoro, jodala ne podi ok  ong'eyo gadier ka Kangogo ne odere kata ne onege.

eng: “It is only God and Caroline who know what caused her death,” Kipkorir said.
luo: Kipkorir ne owacho niya; “En mana Nyasaye gi Caroline ema ong'eyo gima ne onege."

eng: On various occasions, the latest being July 21, 2021, President Uhuru Kenyatta has vowed that Kenya will not cede even an inch of its territory to anyone.
luo: Ker Uhuru Kenyatta osegabedo ka wacho kinde ka kinde ni Kenya ok bi chwalo tong' mare kata mana inji achiel ne piny moro amora. Machiegni moloyo, ne owacho kamano  Julai, tarik 21 2021.

eng: The president, who was addressing security personnel training in Boni Forest, Lamu County, was most likely referring to the Kenya-Somalia maritime dispute.
luo: Ker ne owacho kamano, kane owuoyo gi joma tiego jorit kuwe Boni Forest, Kaunti ma Lamu. Nenore ni ne owuoyo e wi ywaruok mosegabedo e kind Kenya gi Somalia e wi tong' mar Pige Nam Chumbi.

eng: Sadly, the determination to protect our territory seems to be taken with the seriousness its deserves only in the case of Somalia.
luo: Gima lit en ni, wach rito tong' mar pinywa imiyo pek madwarore mana sama iywaruok gi  Somalia.

eng: Kenya and Uganda have been wrangling for years over their common boundary in Lake Victoria, including the location of islands such as Migingo and Mageta.
luo: Kenya gi Uganda osebedo ka yware kuom higni e wi tong' mar pige Nam Viktoria, moriwo chulni kaka mag Migingo kod Mageta.

eng: And although these islands have for decades been inhabited by Kenyans, Uganda seems to have the upper hand on them.
luo: Kata obedo ni jo Kenya osedak e chulnigo kuom higni pieche, jo Uganda timore ka gima ginie weg chulnigo.

eng: It is common for Ugandan security officers to raid the islands and the waters around them and arrest Kenyan fishermen on flimsy grounds, only to set them free after they part with hefty bribes.
luo: Kinde mang'eny polise ma Uganda biroga e chulnigo kendo gimako jolupo gi weche moko matindo tindo kae to gigonyogi ka gisechulogi asoya mang'eny.

eng: Some of the Kenyans are held for days in dingy cells on the Ugandan side.
luo: Moko kuom jo Kenya iketo e sel maricho richo mag Uganda man loka machielo kuom ndalo mogwaro.

eng: In Mageta, Ugandan authorities reportedly force Kenyans to pay Sh8,000 per month for every fishing boat.
luo: Wachore ni e chula ma Mageta, jo Uganda chuno jo Kenya mondo ochul pes Kenya siling' 8,000  dwe ka dwe, ne moro kamoro kuom yie mag lupo.

eng: Yet, such gross mistreatment and exploitation of Kenyans doesn't seem to bother our government.
luo: To kata obedo ni itimo ne jo Kenya marach kamano, kendo isandogi e yo ma kamano, sirkal ok odewo.

eng: Granted, Kenya and Uganda are friendly nations. We cherish the friendship.
luo: En adier ni Kenya kod Uganda gin osiepe. Kendo wageno osiep manie kindgino.

eng: But friendship is only genuine where there is mutual respect.
luo: Kata kamano, ka osiep en madier, nyaka luor bedie e kindgi.

eng: That clearly is not the case here.
luo: Nenore ayanga ni onge luor ma kamano e wachni.

eng: It's a shame for the government to do nothing while its citizens are abused and extorted.
luo: En wichkuot ni sirkal ok tim gimoro amora sama isando raia kendo imayogi pesgi.

eng: Kenya must draw the line.
luo: Kenya nyaka chung' motegno.

eng: While we do not advocate for Kenya to take up arms against our neighbours, the government must demand that Ugandan officers keep off Kenyan fishermen.
luo: Kata obedo ni ok wadwar ni Kenya ochak lweny kod jirendene, wadwaro ni sirkal one ni polise ma Uganda owere gi jolupo ma Kenya.

eng: It should also call for the resumption of the stalled Lake Victoria demarcation exercise.
luo: Onego gi chak kendo chenro mar keto tong' ne pige mag Nam Viktoria.

eng: Ugandans must not be allowed to turn Kenyans into punching bags.
luo: Ok onego owene jo Uganda thuolo mar timore gi jo Kenya ka gima gin mana gik tugo.

eng: The Director of Criminal Investigations (DCI) George Kinoti has alleged that detectives recovered Sh5.7 million from a woman who they claim was to deliver the cash to judges.
luo: George Kinoti ma en  Director of Criminal Investigations  (DCI) ne owacho ni polise ma jonon wach ne oyudo miyo moro milion 5.7 ma ne otero ne jong'ad bura.

eng: In a replying affidavit sworn by Chief Inspector Felix Karisa to a suit filed by the judges’ association, the DCI claimed detectives raided Justices Aggrey Muchelule and Said Chitembwe’s chambers after a tip-off that they were about to receive Sh7 million bribe.
luo: E afidavit moro ma Felix Karisa ma en Chief Inspector osingorego kodwoko riwruok mar jong'ad bura, DCI ne owacho ni polise ne odhi mako jong'ad bura Aggrey Muchelule kod Said Chitembwe e ofisegi bang' ng'ato kwalonegi wach ni jong'ad burago idhi mi asoya mar milion 7.

eng: “From the onset, we want to put the record straight that the judges were not arrested or harassed as they claim, but they willingly agreed to accompany us to the DCI headquarters to record their statements over the bribery claims,” swore Karisa.
luo: Karisa ne osingore niya; “Wadwaro chako gi keto weche maler ni, ne ok omak jong'ad burago bende ne ok ochandgi kaka giwacho, to ne giyie giwegi mondo gidhi kodwa e ofis maduong' mar DCI mondo gindik stetment e wach asoya mawachore ni ne gikawo."

eng: Karisa said he had been tasked to investigate complaints on some judges and judicial officers accused of graft and had received credible information that some people acting as brokers had approached the judges to procure favourable decisions in some matters.
luo: Karisa ne owacho ni ne omiye ting' mar nono ywak moro, ni jong'ad bura gi opisa mamoko matiyo e doho ne odonjo e timbe mag mibadhi kendo ne oyudo weche madier ni nitie joma oor mondo owuo gi jong'ad burago mondo kes odog konchiel.

eng: He swore that on July 21 he received information from a complainant that a series of meetings between a certain judge and broker had taken place and they agreed on a Sh7 million bribe to be delivered to the judge’s residence.
luo: Ne osingore ni Julai tarik, 21 ne oyudo ywak moro ni jang'ad bura moro kod ng'at ma ne oor ire osebedo ka romo kuom kinde, kendo giseyie ni ibiro ter milion 7 e od jang'ad burano.

eng: However, Karisa swore that the meeting venue was abruptly changed to Milimani High Court, where the broker was to deliver the money.
luo: Kata kamano, Karisa ne owacho ni ne giloko kar romo apoya mondo obed Milimani High Court, kendo ne onego oter pesa kuno.

eng: He stated that on July 22, they laid a trap at Milimani High Court and waited until around 2pm when they received information that the meeting with the broker was to take place at Justice Muchelule’s chamber while being facilitated by Justice Chitembwe. “
luo: Ne owacho ni Julai, tarik  22, ne giketo obadho Milimani High Court mi girito nyaka gimoro 8:00 modiechieng' kendo ne giyudo wach ni romono ne dhi bedo e ofis mar Jang'ad bura Muchelule  kendo ni Jang'ad bura Chitembwe ne dhi konyo e wechego.

eng: We proceeded to the two judges chambers and introduced ourselves after which we conducted a search on the occupants, which resulted to the seizure of USD50,000 (Sh5 million) from a woman who was present at Justice Muchelule’s chamber,” swore Karisa.
luo: Karisa ne osingore niya; "Ne wadhi e ofise jong'ad bura ariyogo kae to wafwenyorenegi kendo wagoyo joma ne nikuno peksen. Ne wayudo miyo ma ne ni kanyo gi dola 50,000 mag Amerka kata siling milion 5.”

eng: According to the investigator, they recovered another USD7,000 (Sh700,000) from Justice Chitembwe.
luo: Kaluwore gi janon wachno, ne giyudo Jang'ad bura Chitembwe gi dola 7000 mag Amerka kata siling 700,000.

eng: He accused the Kenya Magistrates and Judges Association (KMJA) of misleading the court to stop DCI from arresting or charging the two judges.
luo: Ne owacho ni riwruok mar Kenya Magistrates and Judges Association (KMJA) ne owuondo doho mondo gigol chik ni DCI kik mak kata donj ne jong'ad bura ariyogo.

eng: “The DCI was only undertaking lawful investigations into grave allegations related to corruption and cannot be interpreted to mean an encroachment on the independence of the Judiciary. The petition to shield the judges is an attempt to stifle and frustrate our work,” swore Karisa.
luo: Karisa ne osingore niya: “DCI ne luwo chik kendo ne nono ketho maduong' motudore gi mibadhi. Omiyo ok nyal wach ni ne gidonjore gi Judiciary. Kwayo mar geng'o ni kik mak kata donjne jong'ad burago en yo mar geng'onwa mondo kik wati tijwa kaka dwarore.”

eng: On claims that the DCI did not obtain a search warrant to raid the judges’ chambers, the investigator stated that it was impractical to obtain the search warrants from a court since they had a short notice from the time they got information that the bribery was going to take place.
luo: DCI wacho ni wach mar ni ne ok oyudo barua mar doho ma ne oyiene mondo odhi omak jogo en wach ma ok nyal chung', nimar ne onge seche mag timo kamano,  ne onyisgi molewo wach asoyano kendo ne gin mana gi kinde matin mar dhi mako jogo.

eng: The two judges were summoned last week but Justice Muchelule and KMJA filed a petition and obtained orders stopping the DCI from summoning, arresting or prosecuting them over the bribery allegations.
luo: Ne oluong jong'ad bura ariyogo e doho juma mokalo, kata kamano, Jang'ad Bura Muchelule kod KMJA ne okwayo ni otam DCI mondo kik oluonggi e doho, kik omakgi kata kik odonjnegi gi wach mar asoyano, mi doho  neo otimo kamano.

eng: KMJA, through lawyer Danstan Omari, argued that the DCI officers illegally stormed Muchelule and Chitembwe’s chambers without any search warrants and did not recover any bribe money as alleged.
luo: KMJA, katiyo gi okil Danstan Omari, ne owacho ni opisa mag DCI ne oketho chik kuom mwomruok kendo donjo e ofise mag Muchelule kod Chitembwe ma ok omigi barua mar doho kendo ne ok giyudo pesa mag asoya kaka giwachono.

eng: Muchelule swore that the search by DCI officers did not yield anything after which the officers arrested and him took him to DCI headquarters and interrogated him.
luo: Muchelule ne okuong'ore ni onge gima ne opisa mag DCI oyudo e ofise, ni ne gimake amaka kae to gitere e ofis maduong' mar DCI kendo  gipenje penjo.

eng: When the matter came up before Justice James Makau, he extended the orders stopping the judges’ arrests and directed the other parties to file responses before October 18.
luo: Kane wachno ochopo e nyim Jang'ad Bura James Makau, ne omedo chwalo kesno nyime kowacho ni kik mak jong'ad burago, kendo ne owacho ne joma odonjonegigo mondo giter wechegi e doho kapok tarik 18 Oktoba ochopo.

eng: A 23-year-old Egerton University student was among three people found dead yesterday in unclear circumstances.
luo: Achiel kuom joma ne oyud nyoro kotho e yo ma ok nyal ler malong'o en japuonjre  ma mbalariany ma Egerton. Ne en wuoyi ma jahigni 23.

eng: The student was found a day after he went missing.
luo: Ne oyud japuonjreno ndalo achiel bang' lalne.

eng: Njoro Sub-county Police Commander Jonathan Kisaka said the student's body was retrieved from a garden at the university following a search on Sunday night.
luo: Jonathan Kisaka, Polis Kamanda ma Njoro sab-kaunti  ne owacho ni ne oyud ringre japuonjreno Jumapil gotieno e puodho moro mar mbalarianyno ka ne imanye .

eng: "The student, identified as Edward Jage, was last seen on July 24," said Kisaka.
luo: Kisaka ne owacho ni, "Japuonjre ma nyinge en Edward Jage, ne one mogik Julai, 24."

eng: According to the police, Jage is said to have been battling depression.
luo: Polis wacho ni Jage ne nigi tuwo mar dipreson.

eng: Elsewhere, police in Narok South are investigating the death of a 17-year-old girl in Tendwet.
luo: Polis ma Narok South bende nono wach tho mar nyako ma jahigni 17, Tendwet.

eng: According to County Police Commander Kizito Mutoro, the girl was found hanging from the wall of her bedroom at around 6.30am yesterday.
luo: Kizito Mutoro, ma en Kaunti Polis Kamanda wacho ni ne oyud nyakono nyoro gimoro saa 12:30 mokinyi koliero e kor ot kama ne onindoe

eng: “She died on the way to the hospital,” said Mutoro.
luo: Mutoro ne owacho ni; “Nyakono ne otho e yo kitere e osiptal.”

eng: Area Chief Patrick Kosgei said the girl had reportedly demanded for a new pair of school shoes as her old ones were torn.
luo: Patrick Kosgei ma en Chif ma alworano ne owacho ni nyakono ne oramo ni odwaro wuoche manyien mag skul nikech wuoche ma yande en-go oyiech.

eng: In Homa Bay County, residents of Rang'i village were shocked to find the body of village elder Dancun Ong’ong’a hanging from a tree.
luo: E Kaunti ma Homa Bay, jogweng' ma Rang'i ne obwok ahinya kane giyudo ringre Dancun Ong’ong’a, ne en  jaduong' gweng' kaliero e yath.

eng: His body was found dangling on a rope tied to an avocado tree near his parents’ home on Sunday.
luo: Ne oyud ringrene Jumapil kaliero e tol motwe e yadh abokado, e bath dala jonyuolne.

eng: Ong’ong’a is said to have had a row with some members of his family barely a week after marrying a second wife.
luo: Wachore ni Ong’ong’a ne oyware gi joodgi mana  juma achiel kama bang' kendo dhako mar ariyo.

eng: Environmental activists yesterday called on Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) boss George Kinoti to speed up investigations into the murder of conservationist Joanna Stuchburry.
luo: Joma kedo mondo orit alwora ne okwayo George Kinoti, jatelo mar  Directorate of Criminal Investigations  (DCI) mondo onon mapiyo tho mar Joanna Stuchburry, miyo ma ne kedo mondo orit alwora.

eng: Under the umbrella of the Kenya Network of Land and Environment Defenders (LED), the activists joined President Uhuru Kenyatta in condemning the brutal murder of Stuchburry.
luo: Jogo ne oriwore gi Ker Uhuru Kenyatta e bwo Kenya Network of Land and Environment Defenders (LED), kane osiemo mager joma ne onego Stuchburry e yor mahundu.

eng: Stuchburry was famous for her relentless efforts to conserve Kiambu Forest.
luo: Stuchburry ne ong'ere gi lweny ma ne okedo mondo kik keth Kiambu Forest.

eng: She was shot dead on July 15, with detectives ruling out robbery since nothing was stolen from her.
luo: Ne ogoye bunde Julai tarik, 15. Polise wacho ni ne ok onege mondo okwale nimar onge gimoro amora ma ne okaw kuome.

eng: Centre for Justice, Governance and Environmental Action Executive Director Phyllis Omido, who led the group, said Stuchburry’s killers must be brought to book.
luo: Phyllis Omido ma en jatelo mar Centre for Justice, Governance and Environmental Action ma ne otelo ne grubno ne owacho ni jogo ma ne onego Stuchburry nyaka mak mi kum kaka owinjore.

eng: Other organisations that signed the statement were Human Rights Agenda, Kwale Community Development Programme, Big Ship, Prohome, Green World Kenya, Chema Initiative, Malindi Rights Forum, Preserve Africa Initiative, Eco Ethics Kenya, Tree Growers Association of Kenya, Power Youth Network, Mica Miners and Friends of Lake Turkana.
luo: Riwruoge mamoko ma ne oketo seyigi e stetmentno ne gin; Human Rights Agenda, Kwale Community Development Programme, Big Ship, Prohome, Green World Kenya, Chema Initiative, Malindi Rights Forum, Preserve Africa Initiative, Eco Ethics Kenya, Tree Growers Association of Kenya, Power Youth Network, Mica Miners kod Friends of Lake Turkana.

eng: Omido said Stuchburry worked relentlessly to protect Kiambu Forest and Kenya’s natural resources.
luo: Omido ne owacho ni Stuchburry ne okedo ma ok ool mondo kik keth Kiambu Forest kod mwandu mamoko mag  Kenya masieko kendgi.

eng: They also sent their messages of condolence to the deceased’s family.
luo: Bende ne gigoyo mos ne joodgi miyono.

eng: “The disregard for the life of environmental activists in Kenya seems to be the current norm and we wonder for how long the community will continue to be subjected to acts of violence, intimidation, police brutality, enforced disappearance and judicial harassment with no counter action from the State,” she said.
luo: Ne owacho niya: “Ocha ngima jogo makedo ne alwora e piny Kenya, kendo wapenjore ni nyaka karang'o mibiro dhi nyime timonwa mahundu, isiko ibwogowa, polise hinyowa, moko kuomwa lal alala nono, kendo doho chandowa, to onge gima sirkal timo.”

eng: Two police officers accused of killing fourteen year old Kwekwe Mwandaza at her home in Kinango on August 2014 have now been convicted of manslaughter.
luo: Polise ariyo ma ne odonjne ni ne ginego Kwekwe Mwandaza ma ne en nyako ma jahigni apar gang'wen e dalagi Kinang'o koro ong'adnegi bura ni ne ok gineko goyiem. Ne ginego nyakono Agost 2014.

eng: The two former kinango DCIO Veronicah Gitahi and police constable Issa Mzee have been remanded a port police station awaiting the determination of their sentence this Friday.
luo: Polise ariyogo ma ne gin Veronicah Gitahi, DCIO ma Kinango kod Issa Mzee ma en Polis Constable otwe e sel kirito bura mibiro ng'adnegi Tich Abich ma Jumani.

eng: High Court Judge Martin Muya cancelled bond for the duo after the prosecution raised security concern of Kwekwe’s kin.
luo: Martin Muya, Jang'ad bura mar Doho Mamalo ne orucho bond ma ne omi polise ariyogo bang' kane owachne ni inyalo hiny wede  Kwekwe.

eng: Ahead of Fridays decision, today’s judgement yet again opens the gruesome pages of the heinous murder of the primary school girl who died by the bullet in the dead of the night allegedly triggered by the officers as they searched for a murder suspect said to be a kin of the family.
luo: Ka podi irito bura mibiro ng'ad Tich Abich, bura ma ne ong'ad kawuono paro ne ji kaka ne oneg nyathi skulno malit e chuny otieno kane polisego manyo janek ma ne wachore ni en watgi.

eng: Kwekwe’s case has been on the radar of human rights crusaders.
luo: Joma kedo ne ratiro mag dhano osekedo matek e wach nek mar Kwekwe.

eng: A case that would attract lots of attention prompting a court order that would see even the exhumation of her remains for an independent autopsy to be conducted.
luo: Nekno ne okelo wach, mi doho ne owacho ni okuny ringre nyathino ma noyudo oseiik kendo odhi opime gi joma opogore mondo ong'e gadier ni ang'o ma ne onege.

eng: The home of businessman S.K Macharia played host to several musicians, politicians and other businessmen Tuesday, for the Kenyan musicians’ musical show.
luo: Chieng' Tich Ariyo ne otim nyasi mar jothum ma Kenya e dala S.K Macharia ma en ja ohala. Jothum mang'eny ne nikuno kaachiel gi josiasa kod jo ohala mamoko.

eng: The event taking place at Macharia’s Ndakaini home in Gatanga, Murang’a County is dubbed Skiza Thanksgiving Luncheon program- aimed at highlighting the plight of musicians and gather support for Kenya’s identity.
luo: Nyasi ma timore e dala Macharia Ndakaini, Gatanga, Kaunti ma Murang’a idendo, ni  Skiza Thanksgiving Luncheon program. Idwaro ni nyasino oket e lela pek ma jothum romogo kendo oriwgi lwedo mondo giting' nying Kenya malo.

eng: Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) leader Raila Odinga arrived just minutes to 12 pm in the company of his wife Ida and Governors Mwangi Wa Iria (Murang’a) Alfred Mutua (Machakos), and Wycliffe Oparanya (Kakamega), breaking into song and dance.
luo: Raila Odinga ma en jatelo mar Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) ne ochopo dakika matin kapok ochopo saa 6 modiechieng'. Ne en gi jaode Ida kod Gavana adek Mwangi Wa Iria (Murang’a) Alfred Mutua (Machakos), kod Wycliffe Oparanya (Kakamega), kane gidonjo ne gi toye mana wer gi miel.

eng: The artists said they want to express their gratitude to President Uhuru Kenyatta for exempting ringtones from excise duty.
luo: Jowergo ne owacho ni gigoyo erokamano ne Ker Uhuru Kenyatta kuom weyo ma ok oketo osuru e thum ma ma ng'ato winjo sama igoyone simu.

eng: The move, which took effect on July 1, 2021 will see an increase in artists’ earnings from their songs on mobile devices.
luo: Okang' ma ne okaw Julai tarik 1, 2021 biro miyo jothum oyud ohala momedore kowuok e wendegi manie simu mag ji.

eng: Speaking to Citizen TV, musician Ben Githae stressed how artists had suffered since the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic, but was glad that there was now a ray of hope.
luo: Ben Githae ma en jathum ne owacho ne Citizen TV, ni jothum osechandore ahinya chakre masira mar Korona, kata kamano, koro omor ni nitie geno ni weche biro dhi maber.

eng: “Musicians tumekuwa tukiumia sana. Wakenya wamekuwa wakidownload nyimbo zetu kwenye skiza lakini ile percentage tunapata ni kidogo sana. (Kenyan musicians have suffered for long considering the small amounts we got from skiza tunes), the Tano-Tena hitmaker lamented.
luo: Jal ma ne owero wer mong'ere ahinya mar Tano-Tena ne oywak niya; “Musicians tumekuwa tukiumia sana. Wakenya wamekuwa wakidownload nyimbo zetu kwenye skiza lakini ile percentage tunapata ni kidogo sana.  (Jothum ma Kenya osechandore gaming'a nikech pesa matin ma ne wayudogo kowuok e skiza tunes)

eng: Raila, who is the Chief Guest humored Kenyans on social media, noting how musicians are getting creative with song lyrics.
luo: Raila, ma ne en wendo modhial ne onyungo ne jo Kenya e intanet ni jower medo lungo wendegi i wendegi.

eng: “Mejja’s Tabia za Wakenya hit was playing somewhere this morning and it got me thinking it is true! Masaa na mkenya lazima atachelewa lakini sherehe?!..” he tweeted.
luo: Ne ondiko niya e intanet, “Ne iwero wend Mejja mong'ere ahinya, mar Tabia za Wakenya kamoro, kawuono gokinyi, kae to awacho mana e chunya ni, donge en adier! Masaa na mkenya lazima atachelewa lakini sherehe?!..”

eng: ODM leader Raila Odinga and other political leaders arrive in Gatanga, Murang’a for the Kenyan musicians’ musical show.
luo: Raila Odinga Jatelo ma ODM kaachiel gi jotelo mag siasa mamoko chopo Gatanga, Murang’a e nyasi mar jothum ma Kenya.

eng: Several political leaders are in attendance among them Governors James Nyoro (Kiambu), James Ongwae (Kisii), host MP Nduati Ngugi (Gatanga), Devolution Cabinet Secretary Eugene Wamalwa, Siaya Senator James Orengo and former presidential aspirant Peter Kenneth.
luo: Jotelo mag siasa mang'eny ni kuno moko kuomgi gin, Gavana James Nyoro (Kiambu), Gavana James Ongwae (Kisii), wuon nyasi Nduati Ngugi Jabunge ma (Gatanga), Eugene Wamalwa ma en Devolution Cabinet Secretary, James Orengo, ma en Senata ma Siaya kod Peter Kenneth jal ma ne kinde moko ochung' kolaro kom mar ker.

eng: Others are MPs Kimari (Mathioya), Maina Kamanda) Maoka Maole (Igembe North).
luo: Jobunge mamoko ma ne ni kuno ne gin Kimari (Mathioya), Maina Kamanda) Maoka Maole (Igembe North).

eng: Popular Kenyan-based Congolese Gospel artist Solomon Mkubwa and several local musicians drawn from different parts of the country are also in attendance.
luo: Solomon Mkubwa jawer mong'ere gi wende din, ma en ja Congo modak Kenya, kaachiel gi jothum mang'eny mowuok kuonde mopogore opogore e Kenya bende ne ni kuno.

eng: Kenyan creatives, among them artistes suffered a huge blow brought forth by the pandemic.
luo: Jo Kenya manie ohala mag tuke, moriwo jothum ne ochandore ahinya nikech pek mar masira Korona.

eng: In his new year’s address, President Uhuru termed the entertainment industry a “critical plank of our economy” and promised to focus on it this year to revitalise the economy.
luo: E twak ma ne Ker Uhuru ogolo higani, ne owacho ni ohala mar tuke “omako kama duong' e yore yuto mag pinywa” kendo ne osingo ni obiro neno ni higani ibiro sir ohendnigo mondo gichung' kendo.

eng: He promised to have some legacy issues that have long plagued copyright holders resolved, and proposed to have all rights holders register on a National Rights Registry.
luo: Ne owacho ni obiro neno ni otiek ywaruok mosegabedo e wi kaka chik onego oti ne weg wende, kendo ne owacho ni jogo duto ma nigi ratiro mag wende ondik nyingegi e rijista ma ginyalo luongo ni National Rights Registry.

eng: “To receive royalties, content service providers will be required to channel all payments of royalties through a single, centrally managed account at the Kenya Copyright Board,” Uhuru said, noting that this would ensure oversight by the regulator.
luo: Uhuru ne owacho ni, “Ibiro ketne kembe ma uso thumbe chik, ni pesa duto michulogi odhi e akaunt achiel mochung'ne gi Kenya Copyright Board, eka ichulogi pesagi.” Mano biro miyo onon kembe ma uso wende.

eng: Part of the strategy entails improving the diagnosis of Leishmaniasis by developing new mapping, tracing and diagnostic tools.
luo: Achiel kuom yore ma inyalo tigo e pimo tuo mar Leishmaniasis en ka watemo loso yo mar yude kama entie ka imanye gi yor map kod tiyo gi gik ma sani ma nyalo fwenye mapiyo.

eng: In 2018 we recorded about 900 cases but that does not mean those were the only cases.
luo: E higa mar 2018 ne wandiko kit tuoni maromo ji  900. Kata kamano, ma ok onyiso ni mago kende e kwan mane ofwenyore.

eng: We realized that there are more and more counties with the cases but they were being misdiagnosed as skin diseases.
luo: Ne wa fwenyo ni nitie sirikal momoko mag gwenge mang'eny mantie gi tuoni to ne giparo ni en tuo ma chamo pien dhano.

eng: This strategy will help us to correctly determine all the areas which are prone to the disease.
luo: Yo ma sani waluwoni biro konyowa ng'eyo kuonde ma tuo ni yudore e pinywa ka.

eng: Leishmaniasis classified as a neglected tropical disease (NTD) is a parasitic disease that is found in parts of the tropics, caused by infection with Leishmania parasites, which are spread by the bite of a phlebotomine sandfly.
luo: Leishmaniasis en tuo ma yudore kunde ma otuo ma sirikal ok ose bedo ka ng'iyo maber. En tuo mar achuogra ma iyudo kuode ma otuo ahinya e Africa ma ikelo gi achuogra Leishmania ma medo landore nikech lwang'ni marach ma yudore kama kuoyo nitie.

eng: The disease comes in two forms, visceral leishmaniasis (kala-azar) and cutaneous leishmaniasis.
luo: Tuoni biro e yore ariyo ma Kisungu luongo ni visceral leishmaniasis (kala-azar) kod cutaneous leishmaniasis.

eng: In 2014, it was decided by the world health assembly that countries establish programs to eliminate neglected tropical diseases.
luo: E higa 2014, ne bura mar piny magima ma ngima weche mag ngima dhano - the World Health Assembly  ne ong'ado ni pinye mondo oket chenro mar tieko tuoche ma yudore e pinje ma otuo ma ok ose bet ka imiyo nonro maber.

eng: According to Dr Joyce Onsongo, a representative from the World Health Organization, leishmaniasis is given priority in WHO policies, strategies and roadmaps.
luo: Kaluwore gi wach Dr Joyce Onsongo, ma ochung' ne World Health Organization, leishmaniasis WHO oketo nyime e chenro mar gi.

eng: “Our target is that by 2025 we should be able to control morbidity by 75 per cent and 85 per cent in 2030 in the 13 endemic countries in Africa." She said. "We have partnerships in Kenya to enable us to achieve this and we will continue working with national and county governments."
luo: “Wadwaro ni ka ochop 2025 owinjore ni wanyalo doko tuoche man e piny gi kwan maromo 75 ewi mia kendo 85 e higa mar 2030 e pinje 13 ma tuoche ngenyie e Africa." Ne owacho kamano. "Wan gi joma watiyo go e Kenya ma biro miyowa chopo gol ni kendo wabiro dhi nyime gi tiyo kod sirikal ma piny kod mamalo e loso yorego."

eng: Onsongo further appealed to all stakeholders to use the strategy as a tool to negotiate, advocate and monitor the elimination of leishmaniasis in order to achieve Universal Health Care.
luo: Onsongo bende omedo jiwo jo kanyono mondo chenro man tie mondo kaka yoo ma ginyalo wuyo go kendo kendo matek mar neno ni tuo mar leishmaniasis orumo e piny mondo ji duto obed ni nyalo dak e yor ngima maber.

eng: “Over the last decade, efforts have been undertaken to prevent, control and eliminate the disease. National and county governments take lead in implementing strategy,” said Dr Rashid Aman
luo: "E higni 10 ma ose kalo, nitie chenro ma ose bedo ka dhi nyime kuom kedo gi tuoni e yor genge, neno ni ok plandore kuonde mangeny kod tieke e piny.  Sirikal ma duong kod piny owacho mag kor ngenge ema neno ni chenro no odhi nyime,” Dr Rashid Aman ne owacho kamano.

eng: Aman added that the implementation of the strategic plan will require a huge financial commitment of Sh2 billion for the next five years.
luo: Aman ne obedo wacho ni mondo chenro mar sirikal no mar kedo gi tuoni otimre maber pesa dwarore maromo million 2  e higni abich ma biro.

eng: If you think being a workaholic is a badge of honour, think again.
luo: Ka ng'ato paro ni tich matek kelo pak to par diriyo.

eng: The World Health Organisation (WHO) has warned that long working hours threatens life expectancy, risks strokes and heart-related diseases.
luo: Riwruok mar piny magima ma iluongo ni World Health Organisation (WHO) ogolo siem ni tich kuom seche mang'eny nyalo ng'ado ngima dhano machiek, nyalo kelo tuo mar kul bat (stroke) kod tuoche adundo.

eng: Let your bossy boss know that data from WHO and the International Labour Organisation (ILO) revealed that long working hours (more than 55 a week) led to 745,000 deaths from stroke and ischemic disease in 2016, a 29 per cent increase from 2000.
luo: Omiyo ber ka jatend ni iongeyo ni nonro mar WHO kod riwruok mar jotich e piny mangima - International Labour Organisation (ILO) ne oyango ni tiyo mar seche mageny ma ohingo seche 55 e juma ne okelo dhoo mar dhano maromo 745,000 kuom tuo mar kul bat kata stroke kod tuo mar ischemic  e higa mar ma ne en bedruok  mar kwan dhano 29 e wi mia achiel mane obedo e higa 2000.

eng: In its study, WHO concluded that working for 55 hours and more per week is associated with an estimated 35 per cent higher risk of stroke, and 17 per cent of dying from ischemic heart diseases, as compared to working between 35 and 40 hours a week.
luo: E nonro margi, WHO ne ong'ado ni tiyo kuom seche ma oloyo seche 55 e juma achiel ema kelo 35 re wi mia mar tuo stroke kendo ji maromo 17  e wi mia bende thoo gi tuo mar adundo ka ipimo gi joma tiyo mar seche manyalo romo kind seche 35 kata 40 e juma.

eng: Ischemic heart diseases are a result of an inadequate supply of oxygen and blood to heart muscles.
luo: Tuoche mag adundo biro nikech nok mar muya ma iyweyo kod remo e leche mag adundo dhano.

eng: Despite the increased number of health complications and deaths, more people are working longer hours globally and “this trend puts even more people at risk of work-related disability and early death,” cautions WHO, adding that the burden of work-related diseases is higher in men who account for 72 per cent of the deaths.
luo: Kata obedo ni nitie bedruok mar tuoche kod thoo mangeny e piny, nenro wacho ni ji mangeny tiyo kuom seche mangeny e piny mangima kendo ngima machalo ka ma miyo ji mangeny nyalo yudo ngol kendo nyalo miyo gi dho chon ka pod gitedno” . WHO owacho kamano ka omedo ni joma thoo nikech tuoche ma okel gi tiyo mar seche mangeny ngeny kuon chuo ma nyalo romo kwan ji 72 e wi mia achiel.

eng: WHO established that the Covid-19 pandemic saw many employees working longer than usual and that “teleworking has become the norm in many industries, often blurring the boundaries between home and work” besides massive layoffs seeing the few remaining working longer.
luo: Riwruok mar piny mangima ma ng'iyo ngima dhano (WHO) ne ofwenyo ni tuo mar Covid-19 omiyo jotich mangeny tiyo kuom seche mang'eny ma ohingo tong' kendo sani tije ma itimo e yor sime ema koro kembe mangeny tiyo go; ma miyo fwenyo tong' matiyo ofisi kod tiyo dala bedo matek, ka waweyo wach mar ji ma ose riembi mageny ka tich ma omiyo jotich ma odong' matin tiyo kuom seche mageny.

eng: Aman reports to work carrying a laptop bag, but no lunchbox inside.
luo: Aman dhi ga tich ka oting'o bag mar computa matin mar Laptop  to onge mifuko ma okete chiemo ma ichamo sa odiechieng'.

eng: Lunchtime will see him trooping to a restaurant or the office cafeteria.
luo: E seche ma ichamo chiemo mar odiechieng ' to inene ka odhi kar chiemo oko kata kama jotich chieme.

eng: A woman, on the other hand, will carry hygiene products and spare shoes, but also snacks, fruit salad, a water bottle and home-cooked lunch.
luo: Miyo moro to ting'o gik mag kelo ler, wuoch ma irwako ma onyalo loko ka tich kendo otingo' chiemo mayot ma obiro chamo  ma oted dala kod pii ma oting'o e chupa.

eng: Why is it not logical for men to carry lunchboxes considering the prevailing harsh economic times yet it is healthier and cheaper?
luo: Ang'o momiyo chuo ok ne ber mar ting'o mifuko mar lunch kaluwore ni ngima sani tek kendo ka wangiyo ni en chiemo maber kendo ma ok okaw pesa mang'eny?

eng: Joseph Waithuki, a credit risk manager, says a lunchbox is impractical and cumbersome for a bachelor who doesn’t cook often and uses public transport due to that small matter of spilling the food and the attendant stress that causes.
luo: Joseph Waithuki, jatelo ma miyo ji hola, wacho ni tingo chiemo ka ngato dhi tich ok en gima yot ahinya kuom ngat no ma pok onyombo ma ok ted ode pile kendo ma hidho matatu ka dhi tich nikech chiemo nyalo pukorene kendo paro ma tich ma kamano nyalo miyo ngato.

eng: But the pandemic forced many to work from home, changing perceptions. “I would spend around Sh300 each day, a cost which can be avoided,” says Waithuki, adding lunchboxes are easier for those who drive as the cars accord them privacy and comfort.
luo: Kata kamano, tuo mar Corona ochuno ji mangeny mar tiyo e udi ma sani loko pach ji kuom tich macahalo kamano.  “Ne atiyo gi shilling 300 pile , pesa mane ok owinjore oti,” Waithuki wacho kamano, ka omedo wacho ni tingo mifuko mar chamo chiemb saa auchiel nyalo bet mayot ne jogo ma dhi tich gi mitokni gi ma obet mos ma onge gima chando gi.

eng: Henry Mwenda, a client delivery manager at a bank, says carrying packed lunch for him was during the early days of the pandemic when eateries were limited and fear of infection was high, but “I would otherwise never carry packed lunch,” he says, arguing it would interfere with his lifestyle. “Imagine going to the club with a lunchbox - it is such a no-no!” says Mwenda.
luo: Henry Mwenda, jago ma ochungne weche mag jongiewo e bank, wacho ni dhi gi chiemo ma ose tedi  e tich ne otimo diere ma tuo mar corona odonjo e piny sama ne otende mageny mag chiemo ne olor kendo ji ne oluoro yudo tuo mar korona no. ka ok mano,di ne ok atingo chiemo ka adhigo tich,” ne owacho kamano , ka otemo lero ni tingo chiemo no biro ketho ne kaka odwaro ni odagi. “Par ane kaka ngato nyalo dhi kar madho kuong' gi box mar chiemo - mano gima ok nyal timore." Mwenda wacho kamano.

eng: But carrying lunchboxes was normal for Kenyans who lived abroad.
luo: Katakamano, tingo bocx mar lunch ne en gima yot the jo Kenya ma odak e pinje ma oko.

eng: “In the States, offices have what they refer to as brown bag meeting rooms, also called lunch and learning lessons rooms, where colleagues enjoy their packed lunch as they engage in informal discussions at lunchtime,” says Andrew.*
luo: “E piny jo America, ofise nigi kuonde ma giluongo ni kar romo mar jogo man gi Brown Bags, ma samoro bende iluongo ni kar chamo lunch kod somo. Magi e kama jotich chamo e lunch kod jowte gi ka gigoyo mbaka sama gidhiye gweyo mar chamo lunch,” Andrew wacho kamano.*

eng: Victoria Muthoka, a wife and Law School student packs lunch for her husband who’s in manufacturing.
luo: Victoria Muthoka, dhako ma onyuom kendo somo weche mag chike miyo chuore chiemo ma otedo e ot mondo odhigo tich ocham saa lunchd kaam gitiye ma giloso e gik ma iuso.

eng: She includes vegetables, starch, fruit and a healthy beverage.
luo: Oketo ne chuore alot, chiemo makelo teko, olemo ma ichamo kendo gima imadho.

eng: Eating homemade lunches has great benefits as such meals are healthier, safer, cheaper and balanced giving one “control of the food chain” including storage, says Faith Kariuki, a nutritionist at Afya Bora Nutrition and Wellness Centre.
luo: Chamo chiemo ma olos e ot kata dala nigi gik mabeyo ma okelo e del; onge gik maricho mageny ma oriwe go; ok okaw pesa mageny kendo otingo gik ma opogore ma miyo ngima dhano bedo maber ka luwore gi kaka okane” Faith Kariuki ma somo kaka ji onego chiemo ma tiyo kama iluongo ni Afya Bora Nutrition and Wellness Centre wacho kamano.

eng: Though he was reluctant at first, he now rarely complains of stomach upset.
luo: Kata obedo ni ndalo ma okuongo ne ok ihikore mar tingo chiemo ka oa go ot, tinde ok oja wacho ni iye ok ber kata ni muore.

eng: She adds that city restaurants have limited choices. “If you want traditional vegetables with brown ugali, you either wouldn’t find it offered, or it would only be available for a limited amount of time.”
luo: Omedo wacho ni hotele man Nairobi onge gik mangeny ma ngato nyalo yiero mar chamo. “Ka idwaro a lot ma oa e ngweng' kod kuon ma rabuor mondo icham, ok ibi yudo ka otede; ka ok kamano, to ibiro yudo ni itede mana mar kinde matin” .

eng: Besides, restaurants tend to overcook vegetables, whose vitamins and minerals are destroyed by light and heat, but with “a packed lunch you also have control over your choices of fats and oils.
luo: Ka iweyo mano, otende temo tedo a lot ma okadhore, ma gik ma kelo ber e del ma ose kedhi gi ler kod liet. To ka itingo lunch ma otedi e ot, inyalo yiero kit chiemo ma idwaro chamo.

eng: Vegetable oils are much healthier than most fats used in hotel cooking.
luo: Mo ma yudore e a lot ber gi del moloyo chiemo ma itedo e hotel.

eng: Raphael Tuju was appointed Minister for Information and Tourism in the first Cabinet of former President Mwai Kibaki in 2003.
luo: Raphael Tuju ne oyier bedo minista mar fwambo kod weche ma kelo mwandu e Kenya e yor welo mabiro e piny ka e higa ma okuongo mar loch mar Ker Mwai Kibaki  mane ocjhakore higa 2003.

eng: His assistant at the ministry was Beth Mugo.
luo: Jalupne e migawo no ne en Beth Mugo.

eng: Tuju, a renowned journalist, was no doubt a good fit for the role.
luo: Tuju, ma osomo weche mag fwambo gi keyo ne ngama owinjore gi tich mane omiyeno.

eng: An alumnus of the University of Leicester, United Kingdom, Tuju had in the late 1980s and early 1990s worked as a part-time television news anchor.
luo: Tuju mane osomo University of Leicester, United Kingdom, e higni mag 1980 kod chak higni mag 1990 ne otiyo kaka achiel kuom jolendo e TV.

eng: Besides, he had produced and directed several documentaries, television and radio commercials for international agencies, private sector bodies and public institutions.
luo: Ka iweyo mano, ne ogolo weche mageny mag fwambo kod keyo e TV kata radio ne kembe madongo man oko, kembe mag ji kod bede sirikal ma opogore opogore.

eng: And he had been a columnist for local newspapers, particularly the East African Standard.
luo: Osebet ka ondiko e oboke man Kenya ka ahinya e East African Standard.

eng: Tuju’s professional background gave him first-hand experience of how critical media freedom was in a democratic and progressive society.
luo: Bedo ni Tuju ne en achiel kuom joma osomo weche mag lwando weche ne omiyo ongeyo maber duong mar bedo gi thuolo mar wuoyo e weche ma chando jopiny.

eng: It, therefore, did not come as a surprise that while he was at the helm of the Ministry of Information and Tourism, the Kibaki administration nurtured greater freedom of expression.
luo: Kuom mano ok en gima nyalo buogo ngato ni diere mane en e migawo mar Fwambo kod rwako welo e Kenya, loch Kibaki ne omiyo jo fwambo thuolo mar wuoyo e piny Kenya.

eng: State House kept its hands off media content and tolerated criticism. Further, the voice of the civil society got louder than it had been before.
luo: Od piny owacho maduong ma Ker odakie ne ok ochando jo fwambo kod keyo kendo jondiko ne inyalo wuoyo kuom piny owacho maonge ywaruolk mageny. Kendo jogo ma ngiyo ratiro mar dhano bende ne nigi duol e kenyya ka ahinya ma oloyo kinde mane ose kalo.

eng: In a bid to have Kenya retain her position as the regional centre for international news, Tuju made liberalisation of the airwaves a priority of his ministry.
luo: Mondo mi Kenya ne bedo kaka kama ji biroye wuoyo gi jopiny e East Africa, Tuju ne oneno ni jogo mane dwaro lwando weche e Kenya ka ne ni thuolo mar fwambo kod keyo maonge ywaruok gi sirikal.

eng: Under the Kanu regime, privately-owned radio stations were only allowed to broadcast in limited spaces, but the State-owned Kenya Broadcasting Corporation (KBC) enjoyed unlimited airwaves access.
luo: E loch mar KANU, kembe mane ji ochako ne ok oyiene gi lando weche mageny; en mana Kenya Broadcasting Corporation (KBC) ema ne nigi thuolo mar lendo gik mageny.

eng: It was during Tuju’s time at the Ministry of Information and Tourism that vernacular radio stations began popping up in large numbers.
luo: Ne en diere Tuju ka ne en minista mar Fwambo kod Welo Welo e piny Kenya ema ne radio stations mag dho udi ma opogre opogore ochako lendo e Kenya ka.

eng: Privately-owned vernacular radio stations such as Kameme FM, which broadcasts in Gikuyu, Kass FM, which broadcasts in Kalenjin, and Ramogi FM, which broadcasts in Dholuo, among others came into existence.
luo: Joland weche e dok ma opogore opogore e Radio machalo Kameme FM, ma lendo gi dho Kikuyu, Kass FM mar Kalenjin kod Radio Ramogi mar Jo-Luo kod ma moko ne ochakore.

eng: Under Tuju’s leadership, the television sector also grew.
luo: E ndalo Tuju, udi mag television ne omedore e Kenya.

eng: New players such Sayare TV (2004) and K24 (2007) arrived on the scene.
luo: Kembe manyien machalo Sayare TV (2004) kod K24 (2007) ne ochaki.

eng: In addition to other privately-owned television stations such as the Kenya Television Network (KTN), started in 1990, and Nation TV (NTV), started in 1999, the new players in the television sector offered Kenyans a range of sources of information in Kiswahili, Kenya’s lingua franca, English and other indigenous languages to choose from.
luo: Ka omedore gi television stations mamoko ma ok mag piny owacho machalo  kaka Kenya Television Network (KTN), mane ochaki e higa 1990, Nation TV (NTV), mane ochakore 1999, kembe mag TV manyien go ne miyo jo Kenya weche e dhok Kiswahili, dho jo franca, English kod dhok kabila mmamoko mag jo rotenge ma ngato ohero kata ongeyo.

eng: Print media, too, did well thanks to the media freedom occasioned by the change of guard.
luo: Jo fwap weche mag ndiko bende ne odhi maber kaluwore gi telo manyien mar Raphael Tuju.

eng: The two leading dailies, the Daily Nation and the East African Standard maintained their dominance of the Kenyan market.
luo: Jo gazede ariyo madongo ma ongere mar jo Daily Nation kod East African Standard ne omedo bedo gi huma maduong e Kenya ka gin ema ji mangeny ngiewo gi.

eng: But by the end of the first term of the Kibaki Presidency, the number of newspapers in the country had shot up to eight.
luo: To ka ochop gik mar loch mar Ker Kibaki e tich ne ma okuongo, kwan gasede ne omedore e Kenya ma ochopo aboro.

eng: Nation Media Group launched the Business Daily whose beat was finance and economic affairs.
luo: Nation Media Group ne ochako gazet manyien ma iluongo ni Business Daily mane ndiko weche mag pesa kod dongruolk mar piny.

eng: Patrick Quarcoo’s The Star newspaper also came into existence around the same time.
luo: Ngat ma iluongo ni Patrick Quarcoo bende ne ochako The Star Newspaper e diere mane Rapahel Tuju ne jatend migawo mar fwambo kod rwako welo e Kenya.

eng: Aware of what potent tools media outlets are in the construction of a people’s popular culture, Tuju insisted that the local media creates room for local content.
luo: Nikech Tuju ne ongeyo ka jo lendo nyalo gero kit ngima jopiny, Tuju ne okone jo fwambo kod keyo ni nyaka gi ne ni weche mag jo Kenya bende omi thuolo e lendo magi.

eng: On August 8, 2003, Tuju announced that from January 1, 2004, local television stations would be required to broadcast a minimum of 20 per cent local content.
luo: Tarik  8 dwe mar Aboro 2003, Tuju ne olando ni jo fwambo kod keyo man Kenya (TVs) ibiro dwar ni mondo ka ochopo tarik 1.1.2004, mondo obed ni lando ma ok tin ne 20 mag weche matimore e Kenya.

eng: For radio stations, he set the ratio at 30 per cent. Tuju’s directive was not successfully executed then.
luo: Ne jo Radio, ne okone gi ni nyaka gine ni gilando weche ma jo Kenya timo maromo saja 30 e wi mia. Kata kamano, chik mane Tuju ogolo no ok ne otigo kaka dwarore e ndalo go.

eng: It, however, brought the subject of suitability of media content to the national discourse table.
luo: Kata obedo ni mago ne ok otimore e seche go, jo Kenya ne ochako wuoyo e ber mar chike mane Tuju ogolo go.

eng: As the Minister for Information and Tourism, Tuju took Kenya’s image redemption campaign to the global arena.
luo: Kaka jatend migawo mar fwambo kod rwako welo e Kenya, Tuju ne otero weche Kenya e piny mangima.

eng: Fed up of what in media parlance is called bad press, Tuju attempted to take Kenya’s broadcasting voice to the United Kingdom.
luo: Ka ok omor gi mying marach mane Kenya nigo e yore mag fwambo kod keyo weche, Tuju ne otero wach Kenya e piny wasungu mar British.

eng: His intention was to reverse the 50-year one-way broadcasting regime that Kenya and Britain had maintained.
luo: Gima ne odwaro maduong ne en kaka onyalo loko kaka jo Britain kod Kenya ne ose bet lwando weche kuom higni 50 mane ose kalo.

eng: In November 2003, Tuju and Wachira Waruru, then the head of the KBC, visited London to apply for an FM radio station licence to enable KBC to be heard in the UK.
luo: E dwe mar apar ga achiel 2003, Tuju kod Wachira Waruru, mane jatend KBC diere go ne odhi Britain kwayo barua mar yawo Radio station e piny no mar lando weche mag KBC.

eng: The FM station, in Tuju’s view, would offer an alternative voice to that of the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC).
luo: Ka luwore gi paro mar Tuju, Radio Station mar KBC no ne biro miyo jo Britain thuolo mar yudo weche ma olandi gi station ma opogore gi British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC).

eng: Tuju argued that unlike the BBC, the Kenya-owned FM radio station would give Kenya unbiased media coverage.
luo: Tuju ne neno ni KBC ne biro lando weche jo Kenya maber ma oloyo BBC.

eng: It turned out that British broadcasting laws only allowed European companies to run radio stations in Britain.
luo: Ne gi bedo kod buok ni chike mag jo Britain oyiene mana kembe mag jo pinje mag wasungu man Europe yawo station mar Radio e piny mar Britain no.

eng: Besides, at the time all the licences for the London FM spectrum were booked up to 2010.
luo: Ka iweyo mano, seche duto tee ne okonegi ni chiwo barua mar yawo Radio Station ne ok nyal timore nyaka higa mar 2010 nikech ne nitie jogo mane ose ose mi thuolo no.

eng: Even though the law has since changed and non-nationals can now apply for licences and run FM stations in the UK, the challenge of limited FM spectrum persists.
luo: Kata obedo ni sani chike ne ose loki ma yiene joma oa e pinje mamoko mondo oyaw Radio Station e Britain, yudo thuolo ma Radio station manyien nyalo tiyo go pod tek.

eng: Tuju’s fight against the bad press Kenya was getting in the wake of Al Qaeda terrorist attacks was boosted by the fact that it enjoyed the support of Kenyans.
luo: Kedo mane Tuju okedo go gi huma marach mane Kenya obedo go e diere wach Al Qaeda mane ketho gik moko e Kenya ne oung lwedo gi jo Kenya duto.

eng: As a result, Kenya’s tourism industry, the third largest foreign exchange earner in the country, had lost $125 million (Sh13.5 billion) since the 1998 US Embassy bomb attack in Nairobi.
luo: Nikech huma marach no, welo mane biro Kenya mame kelo ne jo Kenya nwengo mageny mar adek mag pesa ma oa oko, ne owito pesa maromo milion 13.5 chakre higa 1998 mane go US Embassy gi bomb ei Nairobi.

eng: Immediately after the attack, European and American authorities released travel advisories to their citizenry citing Kenya as an unsafe destination.
luo: Bang ma timre, pinje mag wasungu ma Europe kod America ne olando ne joge gi ni ok ber ka gibiro Kenya nikech nitie jo jore ma nego ji.

eng: The situation had been aggravated by the ban of UK flights to Nairobi and Mombasa by the British government in May 2003.
luo: Weche ne obedo bedo matek kane jo UK ne oloro huyo mar ndeke gi ma biro Kenya mane piyo Nairobi kod Mombasa e dwe mar Abich 2003.

eng: The ban was anchored on the fear of terrorist attacks on western targets.
luo: Loro no ne otimore nikech wasungu ne oluor ni joge gi ibiro negi gi jo njorego man Kenya.

eng: After his bid to establish an FM station in the UK flopped, Tuju changed tack.
luo: Bang ka ne ok omedo gi thuolo mar yawo Radio station Britain, Tuju ne oloko paro mar tich.

eng: He made a series of appearances on international radio and television stations.
luo: Ne otemo wuoyo e Radio kod TV mag pinje man ooko.

eng: Tuju gave one message at each of the talk shows.
luo: Tuju ne lando mana wach achiel e station ka station mane owuoye go.

eng: He informed the world that even though Nairobi was concerned about the terrorism threat, it had taken all the necessary precautions.
luo: Ne olando ne ji piny mangima ni kata obedo ni Nairobi ne ok mor gi weche mag jo njore man Kenya go, piny owacho ma Kenya ne ose kawo atua mar neno ni ji odak gi kwe.

eng: He emphasised that Kenya was not any more vulnerable to terrorist attacks than other tourist destinations.
luo: Ne omedo lando ni Kenya koro ok ni marach ahinya korka weche ma jo njorore maloyo kunde mamoko ma wasungu dhiye.

eng: Tuju’s crusade paid off.
luo: Kinda mar Tuju ne okelo lokruok e piny Kenya.

eng: The UK lifted the Nairobi and Mombasa flight ban.
luo: Jo UK ne koro oyiene ndeke gi mondo obi Nairobi kod Mombasa.

eng: He served Kibaki’s administration as the Information and Tourism Minister until 2005.
luo: Tuju ne obedo kaka jatend fwambo kod welo ma biro Kenya e diere loch Ker Mwai Kibaki nyaka higa mar 2005.

eng: His later stint in the Cabinet had much to do with the convulsions that engulfed Narc in the lead up to the 2005 referendum.
luo: Tije ma ogik e bedo e sirikal ne obedo gi weche mageny e diere ma riwruok mar NARC ne dhi bedo gi goyo ombulu mar ngeyo pach jopiny e chike manyien - referendum - mane otimore higa 2005.

eng: Within months of clinching power, cracks emerged in the coalition.
luo: Bange dweche matin ka ne NARC oyudo loch, okak ne ochako bede e kind jo tend riwruok mar siasano mane oloso sirikal.

eng: These cracks assumed the form of a Kibaki-Raila Odinga power-sharing tussle.
luo: Ywaruok ne obede e kind Kibaki kod Raila Odinga kaka ginyalo tiyo kanyakla.

eng: Odinga claimed that his party and Kibaki’s had signed a pre-election Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) that spelt out how they would share power after winning elections.
luo: Odinga ne owacho ni chama mare kod chama mar Kibaki ne obedo gi winjruok ma ondiki kuom kaka ne gibiro tiyo e sirikal kane gise yudo loch bang goyo ombulu.

eng: The MoU supposedly stipulated a 50-50 power sharing formula between Kibaki’s and Odinga’s parties.
luo: Winjruok gi no ne owacho ni gibiro pogo lemo gi e diere (50-50) e kind chama mag gi mag siasa go.

eng: Jubilee Party head of secretariat Raphael Tuju reminds himself how to use a camera before addressing the press at Elementaita country lodge in Nakuru on November 13, 2016
luo: Jatend Jubilee Party ma en Raphael Tuju temo paro kaka ngato owinjore oti gi picha ka pok owuoyo gi jo fwambo kod keyo e kar nindo mar Elementaita e ngeng' ma Nakuru tarik 13.11.2016

eng: Kibaki never disowned the existence of the MoU.
luo: Kibaki ok ne owuok oko mar kwedo mar mar winjruok mane gibedo go gi Raila Odinga (MoU).

eng: His position, however, was that the MoU was limited to Cabinet slots.
luo: Gima ne owacho en ni MOU ne owuoyo mana kaka ne gibiro pogo tije mag jotend migepe.

eng: He disagreed with Odinga’s demand that the MoU extended to the civil service.
luo: Ne ok oyie gi Odinga ni MOU ne owuye kaka ibiro ndik ji tich e piny owacho.

eng: Odinga and his supporters wanted the MoU to overlap to government jobs, diplomatic appointments, State corporations and security services.
luo: Joge Odinga ne dwaro ni wach mar winjruok no obedi e ndiko ji e sirikal, joma ioro tiyo e pinje ma oko kaka ambassodors, joma tiyo e bede sirikal ma opogore opogore kod joma tiyo e migawo mar rito ngima kod mwandu mar Kenya.

eng: The Kibaki-Odinga feud caused divisions in Kibaki’s first Cabinet.
luo: Lweny mane obedo e kind Kibaki kod Odinga ne okelo pogruok e od bura maduong e sirikal mar jotend migawo ma iluongo ni Cabinet mane Kibaki oloso.

eng: It was in this scenario that Tuju, and former vice presidents Moody Awori and George Saitoti switched allegiance to Kibaki.
luo: En e diere ni ma Tuju kod jalup Ker machon Moody Awori kachiel gi George Saitoti ne olokere odok kor ka Kibaki.

eng: The gap between Odinga’s camp and Kibaki’s was further widened by their divergent stances on constitutional reforms.
luo: Pogruok mane omedo e kind Odinga kod Kibaki ne omedore kaluwore gi pogruok mane gibedo go e wach mar loko chike mag Kenya.

eng: Odinga’s faction used the 2005 proposed Constitution referendum to get even with Kibaki.
luo: Joge Odinga ne otiyo gi wach mar goyo ombulu mar loko chike mane otimore higa 2005 mondo gi ked gi joge Kibaki.

eng: They rallied their supporters to reject the proposed Constitution.
luo: Ne giwuoyo gi johera gi mondo kik kal chike mane joge Kibaki dwaro ni mondo obedi e Kenya diere goyo ombulu mar referundum mane otimore higa mar 2005.

eng: Odinga and his supporters wanted an autonomous premier with a ceremonial president while Kibaki and his supporters wanted the opposite of this arrangement.
luo: Odinga kod joge ne ne dwaro Prime Minster man gi teko mar rito sirikal ka gitiyo gi President mateko ne odok chien. Ma wach mane okwedi gi joge Kibaki kane gin gidwaro ni President obed gi teko mangeny ma ohingo Prime Minister.

eng: The government lost the referendum.
luo: Sirikal ne oyombi e ombulu mar referendum mane owinjore olok chike Kenya.

eng: A day after the government lost the plebiscite something historical happened.
luo: Mana bang odiechieng achiel ka piny owacho ne oyombi e kura mar referundum no gimoro ne otimore e Kenya.

eng: Kibaki fired his Cabinet save for Vice President Awori and Attorney General Amos Wako.
luo: Kibaki ne oriembo jotend migepe (ministers) mak mana jalup Ker Moodi Awori kod jatend chike (Attorney General) Amos Wako.

eng: In his terse message to Kenyans, Kibaki clarified that the referendum results had prompted him to reshuffle his ministers and assistant ministers for harmony and efficient service delivery to the people.
luo: E barua mane ooro ne jo fwambo, Ker kibaki ne olero ne jopiny ni duoko mar kura mar referendum no omiyo oneno ni okel lokruok kuom ministers mage kod jolup gi mondo ket joma nyalo tiyo kanyakla ne jo Kenya.

eng: In the new Cabinet that he announced a fortnight later, he excluded Odinga (Roads, Public Works and Housing), Kalonzo Musyoka (Environment), Ochilo Ayacko (Gender and Sports), Linah Jebii Kilimo (Home Affairs and Registration of Persons), Anyang’ Nyong’o (Planning and National Development), Najib Balala (National Heritage and Culture) and William ole Ntimama (Office of the President — Public Service).
luo: E duond od bura mar sirikal (Cabinet) mane olando bang jumbe ariyo, ne ok olando bad migawo mar Raila Odinga mar yore, gero ote piny owacho (Ministry of Roads, Public Works and Housing), Kalonzo Musyoka (Environment), Ochilo Ayacko (Gender and Sports), Linah Jebii Kilimo (Home Affairs and Registration of Persons), Anyang’ Nyong’o (Planning and National Development), Najib Balala (National Heritage and Culture) and William ole Ntimama (Office of the President — Public Service).

eng: In the new Cabinet Kibaki appointed Tuju Minister for Foreign Affairs.
luo: E cabinet manyien no Kibaki ne oyiero Tuju Minister mar weche pinje ma ooko (Foreign Affairs).

eng: From a purely bureaucratic point of view, Tuju’s brief was to advance the government’s foreign policy.
luo: Ka orange e yo mar tich, tij Tuju ne en siro chike mag sirikand Kenya ma wuoyo kuom kaka onyalo tiyo kanyakla gi pije mamoko.

eng: But from a political angle, Kibaki’s elevation of Tuju to the Foreign Affairs docket was a strategic move.
luo: Ka ongiye e yor siasa, keto Tuju momdo otel ne migawo mar Foreign Affairs ne en gima nigi lengo mare.

eng: Empowering Tuju was one of Kibaki’s ways preparing for the 2007 political duel with Odinga.
luo: Miyo Tuju teko e sirikal mare ne en plan mar Kibaki mar kedo gi Odinga e wach mar siasa e yiero mane biro timore higa mar 2007.

eng: In the run up to the 2005 referendum Tuju formed the People’s Progressive Party.
luo: Kane ji chiegni dhi e 2005 referendum, Tuju ne ochako chama ma iluongo ni  People’s Progressive Party.

eng: Political analysts considered Tuju’s party an outfit whose aim was to eat into Odinga’s support base and consequently reduce Odinga’s camp’s chances of winning the referendum.
luo: Joma ngiyo yore mag siasa ma tut ne neno ni party mane Tuju ochakono ne idwaro ni mondo oma Odinga ombulu e piny jo Luo mondo kik obed gi thuolo mar loyo ombulu mar referendum.

eng: Tuju served as the Minister for Foreign Affairs until the end of the first term of the Kibaki Presidency.
luo: Tuju ne obedo Minister mar weche ma ooko (Foreign Affairs) nyaka loch Kibaki ma okuongo mar bedo president orumo.

eng: Interestingly, Tuju, who served as the Member of Parliament for Rarieda between 2003 and 2007, got into Narc thanks to his affiliation with Odinga’s Liberal Democratic Party (LDP).
luo: Gima ne timore e ndalo no, Tuju, mane obed kaka jaod bura ma Rarieda  e kind higa 2003 kod 2007, ne oyier dhi e od bura gi otiko mar Narc ka oluwo chama mar Odinga ma ne iluongo ni Liberal Democratic Party (LDP).

eng: This explains why his fallout with Odinga resulted in him losing the Rarieda seat.
luo: Ma nyiso maler gima omiyo ka ne giwere gi Odinga to ne ok oyiere kendo Rarieda kaka jachung mar gi.

eng: The political animosity between him and Odinga worked to his disadvantage since the electorate considered it a betrayal to their community kingpin.
luo: Lwenye gi Odinga ne ok ochwake nikech jo Luo ne neno ni okedo gi jatend gi mar siasa.

eng: In spite of his loss at the 2007 polls, Tuju did not slide into a political oblivion.
luo: Kata obedo ni ok ne oyiere e kura mane otimore e higa mar 2007, Tuju ne ok olwar e yor siasa.

eng: In a demonstration of the high regard which President Kibaki had for him, Tuju was appointed as Special Envoy and Presidential adviser in the government.
luo: Kaluwore gi kaka President Kibaki ne ogene, Tuju ne Ker oyiero kaka ja ote mare kendo ja ngad rieko ne piny owacho.

eng: Tuju worked alongside Kivutha Kibwana.
luo: Tuju ne otiyo kanyakla gi Kivutha Kibwana.

eng: Whereas Kibwana advised Kibaki on Constitutional affairs, Tuju advised him on Media and Management of diversity or Ethnic Relations.
luo: Ka ne Kibwana ne en jangad rieko ne Ker Kibaki e weche mag chike, Tuju ne ngado ne rieko e weche mag fwambo kod keyo kod kaka dho udi mag Kenya nyalo bede achiel.

eng: Tuju served Kibaki as one of his advisers until 2011 when he resigned to focus on his 2013 Presidential bid.
luo: Tuju ne obedo kaka achiel kuom jo ngad rieko ne Ker Kibaki nyaka ne ochopo higa 2011 mane oweyo e tich mondo one ane kaka onyalo manyo kura mar bedo ker mar Kenya e ombulu mane dhi timore e higa mar 2013.

eng: Afterwards, he formed Party of Action (POA), the political vehicle through which he purposed to run for the Presidency.
luo: Bange mano, ne ochako chama mar siasa ma iluongo ni Party of Action (POA), mane omanyo go bedo president mar Kenya.

eng: Tuju was born on March 30, 1959.
luo: Tuju ne onyuol tarik 30.3.1959.

eng: He went to Majiwa Primary School from where he joined Starehe Boys’ Centre.
luo: Ne osomo Majiwa Primary School kama ne oaye ka odhi Starehe Boys’ Centre.

eng: Tuju holds a Master of Arts degree in Communication from the University of Leicester, United Kingdom.
luo: Tuju nig digri mar ariyo e weche mag fwambo kod keyo (Master of Arts degree in Communication ka oa e University mar Leicester, United Kingdom.

eng: Before joining politics, Tuju worked as a consultant in design and implementation of public communication programmes.
luo: Kane pok odonjo e siasa, Tuju ne tiyo kaka jangad rieko e weche mag tudgruok mar piny.

eng: Among other organisations and agencies he consulted for were the World Health Organization (WHO), the United States Agency for International Development (USAid), the World Bank, the Department of International Development (DfID) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).
luo: Kuom riwruok mane otiyo negi gin World Health Organization (WHO), the United States Agency for International Development (USAid), the World Bank, the Department of International Development (DfID) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

eng: Between 1992 and 2001, Tuju was the Founder and Director, Ace Communications.
luo: E kind higa mar 1992 kod 2001, Tuju ne en ngama ne ochako kendo jatend (Founder and Director) kambi ma iluongo ni Ace Communications.

eng: At 3am tomorrow, the men’s 3000m steeplechase - a race that has been dominated by Kenyans for 37 years, will take place at the Tokyo Olympics.
luo: Saa 9 kiny okinyi, tugo mar chuo ma iluongo ni 3000m steeplechase - tugo ma jo Kenya ose bed ka loyo kuom higini 37 ma ose kalo, biro timore Tokyo Olympics.

eng: Kenyan men have won the Olympic steeplechase gold medals since 1984.
luo: Chuo Kenya ose bed ka loyo Olympic steeplechase gold medals chakre 1984.

eng: With the absence of defending champion Conseslus Kipruto who did not complete the race during the national trials in June, extension of Kenya’s winning streaks will be on Leonard Bett, Abraham Kibiwot, and Benjamin Kigen who took the top three slots respectively.
luo: Sama koro jangwech ma thiri nginyi ma iluongi ni Conseslus Kipruto ne ok odhi nyime bang weyo ngwech ma itemo go pinje mane otimore e dwe mar auchil higani,Kenya koro nigi geno kuom Leonard Bett, Abraham Kibiwot, kod Benjamin Kigen mane oluwore e kawo namba achiel nyaka adek e tugono.

eng: But a tough challenge awaits the Kenyan squad in Tokyo as African countries field steeplechasers with decorated resumes in the distance.
luo: To jo Kenya man Tokyo nigi tich matek mar kelo loch dala nikech pinje mangeny mag Africa oro jogegi maring omaber e tugo no.

eng: From Lamecha Girma and Getnet Wale of Ethiopia to Morocco’s Soufiane El Bakkali, Kenya’s stranglehold in 3000m steeplechase will be put to test.
luo: Ka ochakore Lamecha Girma kod Getnet Wale ma aa Ethiopia kachiel gi Soufiane El Bakkali ma aa Morocco, bet ma Kenya ose bedo ka loyo e tugo mar  3000m steeplechase ni wang ni ok bei bet mayot.

eng: Winner of the national trials, former Africa champion Abraham Kibiwott, is seen as the Conseslus Kipruto’s successor.
luo: Ngat mane oloyo e tugo mar temo jnogo ma oa pinje ma opogore pogore, jalo mane ne jaloch e Africa kinde ma okalo ma iluongo ni Abraham Kibiwott, ema koro ineno ni biro kawo kar Conseslus Kipruto e tugo ma Tokyo no.

eng: He trains with Conseslus in Mosoriot, Nandi County.
luo: Otiegore e yor ngwech ka giringo gi Conseslus in Mosoriot, ei Nandi County.

eng: Kibiwot, 25, has proved that he is ready to defend Kenyan dominance at the Olympics given his performance at the senior ranks.
luo: Kibiwot masani ja higni 25, ose nyiso ratiro ni oikore mar duogo loch e Kenya etugo ma dhi timore Tokyo Olympics ka ingiyo kaka ose bet ka oringo e chenro mar joma dongo.

eng: He won bronze at the African championships in 2016, silver at the Commonwealth Games in 2018 before coming in seventh at World championships in 2019.
luo: Ne oyudo bronze e tugo mar jo Africa mane otimore 2016; ne ochako oyudo  Silver e Commonwealth Games mane otimore higa 2018 kane pok obedo numba 7 e tugo mane oriwo piny mangima - World championships mane otimore 2019.

eng: On the other hand, Kigen, 28, takes to the start line his monstrous kicks. He is seen as the biggest threat for gold.
luo: Kama chielo, Kigen, 28, dhi e line mar ngwech ka en gi ilo. En ema inene kaka ngama nyalo yudo loch mar gold.

eng: Kigen, who won the Rome Diamond League in 2019, in a time of 8:06.13 can’t be wished away.
luo: Kigen, mane oloyo e tugo mar Rome Diamond League mane otimore e higa 2019, e saa mar 8:06.13 ok nyal buon e tugoni.

eng: He has previously beaten El Bakkali and Conseslus at the Diamond Leagues. Back in 2018, he outclassed Kipruto to take Prefontaine Classic before beating El Bakkali on home soil to win in Rabat.
luo: Ediere ma okalo, ne oloyo El Bakkali kod Conseslus e ngwech mar Diamond Leagues. E higa mar 2018, ne odhiero wang Kipruto e tugo mar Prefontaine Classic kane pok oyombo El Bakkali e piny gi mane omiye loch Rabat, kama ne ji piemore.

eng: He has also shown incredible speed with a 3:31 1500 pb in Doha in May, won the only major steeple of 2020 in Monaco, and won his only steeple of 2021 in comfortable fashion, clocking 8:08 in Florence on June 10.
luo: Kigen bende ose nyiso ni en ja ngwech mathiri nginyi man gi speed maromo 3:31 1500 pb kane oringo e Doha dwe mar abich; ne oloyo e ngwech maduong  steeple mane otimore  e higa mar 2020 mane otimore Monaco. Ne ochako oloyo e ngwech mar steeple ma otimore higani 2021 e yoo mayot, ka oringo gi saa mar 8:08 mane otimore Florence tarik 10 dwe mar auchiel.

eng: Although Leonard Bett, 20, is yet to show the world what he is made of, three-year-old career is rich in spectacular wins.
luo: Kata obedo ni Lenard Bett ma ja higi 20, pok onyiso piny mangima nguvu mare, ngwech ma ose bet ka oringo mar higini 3 ose bet maber nikech ose bet ka oyudo loch.

eng: Bett won the national trials but was beaten in Gateshead, his only Diamond League of the year, finishing second to American Hillary Bor.
luo: Bett ne oloyo e pimruok matin mar pinje kata kamano ne oloye e tugo mar Gateshead, mane opieme e tugo mar Diamond League mane otimore higani, ka obet namba ariyo kuom Hillary Bor ma ja America.

eng: When Bett was just a 16-year-old in 2017, he won the World U18 title in Nairobi.
luo: Diere mane Bet mane en jahigni 16-year-old e higa mar 2017, ne oloyo tugo mar manyo bedo jaloch mar World U18 mane otimore Nairobi.

eng: A year later, when he was 17-year-old, he ran away with a silver medal at the World Under20 championships before winning the 2019 Africa junior title as an 18-year-old.
luo: Bang higa achiel,kane en ja higini 17, ne oyudo midila mar silver e pimruok mar  World Under20 championships kane pok oloyo e 2019 tugo mar jo Afrika matindo (Africa Junior Title kaka ja higni 18 mane nitie e tugono.

eng: Morocco’s Soufiane El Bakkali is of the Olympic steeple favorites. He has recorded impressive performances in recent years.
luo: Soufiane El Bakkali ma ja Morocco en achiel kuom joma ji ohero e tugo mar Olympic steeple. Ose bedo gi nying maber e higi ma okalo machieng' ni.

eng: A Wang'uru court in Kirinyaga County has sentenced to death four men found guilty of robbery with violence.
luo: Doho ma Wang'uru man Kirinyaga County nyocha otweyo ji agwen twech mar ngima gi duto kuom kosa mar mayo ji gi yor angenge.

eng: Principal Magistrate Gideon Mutiso convicted Isaak Kariuki Ndambiri, Kennedy Gachoki Kanguru, James Gitonga Wawira and Christopher Bundi Mbogo of killing two people and maiming two others in a robbery incident.
luo: Jangad bura maduong Gideon Mutiso ne otweyo Isaak Kariuki Ndambiri, Kennedy Gachoki Kanguru, James Gitonga Wawira kod Christopher Bundi Mbogo kuom nego ji ariyo kendo hinyo ji ariyo mamoko e seche mane gidhi mayogi ka giun gi gigo mag maundu.

eng: The four, jointly with others not before the court, are said to have committed the offence on July 1, 2018, at a nightclub in Ndindiruku, Mwea East sub-county.
luo: Ji angweno go ka omakore gi joma moko mane onge e od bura, wachore ni ne otimo kethno tarik 1 dwe mar Abiro 2018, kane e gin kar madho kongo moro man  Ndindiruku, Mwea East sub-county.

eng: Ms Margaret Wanjiku Mwangi was robbed of Sh200,000 and killed alongside Stephen Muriithi Mwangi.
luo: Nydendi moro ma iluongo ni Margaret Wanjiku Mwangi ne oma shiling 200,000 kendo ne onege kachiel gi migosi Stephen Muriithi Mwangi.

eng: The court heard the four, armed with an AK 47 rifle, also shot and maimed James Kimani and Kelly Nyawira, who can no longer fend for themselves.
luo: Od bura ne owinjo ni ji agwen go mane negi bunde mar AK 47 rifle, ne okielo ma ohinyo James Kimani kod Kelly Nyawira, ma sani ok nyal tiyo tich moro amora sani.

eng: It also emerged that Robert Mwangi, the husband of Ms Mwangi and brother of the late Kimani, was impacted by the robbery since his liquor business went under.
luo: Bende ne ofwenore ni Robert Mwangi, mane en chuor myadendi Margaret Wanjiku Mwangi kod owadgi Kimani mane otho, ne jomecho go oweyo marach nikech ohala mane gigoyo no ne ogore piny.

eng: Mwangi asked the court to give a maximum sentence to the four persons.
luo: Mwangi n e okwayo ja ngad bura mondo omi kuom mager ne jo njore agwen go.

eng: “When they gunned down my wife, I was left with an infant whom I continue to nurture. And under such circumstances, I can hardly go for any meaningful employment,” he said amid tears.
luo: “Kane ginego jaoda gi bunde, ne adong gi nyathi ma kidoro ma pod arito nyaka sani. To seche ma gima kama otimore, ok anyal dhi manyo tich moro maIongo"Mwangi ne owacho kamano ka pii wange chuer.

eng: Ms Nyawira, who was maimed in the robbery incident, pleaded with the court to sentence to death the four men.
luo: Nyadendi Nyawira, mane jo njorego ohinyo ma omiyo songa, ne okwayo ja ngad bura mondo otwe jonyore agwen go e ngima gi duto.

eng: “I was forced to quit employment due to the serious injury I sustained. I urge this court to send them to the gallows," said Nyawira.
luo: “Ne ochuna mondo awe tija mane atimo nikech ne ahinyora ahinya. Kuom mano, akwayo kot mondo ongad bura mar nek ne jonjore agwen gi," Nyawira ne owacho kamano.

eng: Defense lawyer Nduku Njuki, in his mitigation, told the court that his clients were still innocent and the police were yet to arrest the perpetrators of the heinous crime.
luo: Advocate mane ochung ne jonjorego Nduku Njuki, e kwayo ne, ne onyiso kot ni jok mane ochung nigi go ne pod onge ketho kendo polis ne pok omako joma ne otimo tim marach no.

eng: Justice Mutiso ruled that the convicts had not shown any remorse despite committing the serious crime.
luo: Jangad bura Justice Mutiso ne ongado bura ni jogo ,ame omaki ok ne oyie ni ne gitimo marach kata obedo ni gima ne gitimo ne rach ahinya.

eng: “I find the convicts have no respect for others and even upon being given an opportunity for mitigation, they continue to deny having committed the crime which the prosecution and the witnesses proved beyond reasonable doubt,” Mutiso ruled.
luo: “A ayudo ni joma ne omaki gi onge luor gi joma momoko kendo kata obedo ni omigi thuolo mar kwayo nguono, pod gitemo mana dagi ni ok ne gitimo kosa kata obedo ni sirikal kod joneno to ose nyiso maber ni ne gitimo wach marach no. maonge kiawa,” Mutiso ne ongado bura kamano.

eng: The magistrate also said, although the death sentence was discretionary, the four deserved it.
luo: Jangad bura no bende ne owacho ni kata obedo ni twech mar nek en gima judge ema ngado, jo njore agwen gi to owinjore gi tho nikech gin be ginego ji.

eng: Four ex-police officers charged with the murder of British aristocrat Alexander Monson will know their fate on October 28, after both parties closed their submissions yesterday.
luo: Polise agwen mane omaki kuom nek mar ja Britsh ma iluongo ni aristocrat Alexander Monson biro ngeyo kaka ongad buch gi  tarik  28 dwe mar Apar, bang kane joma ochung ne sirikal kod joma ochung ne jonek wuoyo od bura nyoro.

eng: The defense lawyers said the prosecution failed to call the bouncer of a club to testify on what transpired inside the entertainment joint before Monson was ejected and later arrested.
luo: Okil kama loka mane ochung' ne joma iwacho ni ne oneko go ne owacho ni sirikal ne ok oluongo jarit ,ame rito kar od math kama ji ne nitie mondo owachi ni to ango' mane otimore e od math kanyo kane pok Monson ne ogol oko kato bange omake.

eng: Jared Magolo said prosecution and Independent Police Oversight Authority (IPOA) had failed to establish the cause of the fatal injury on Monson's death. He said the state failed Monson's family.
luo: Jared Magolo ne owacho ni joma ochung ne sirikal kod migowo ma mgiyo kaka polis tiyo e Kenya - Independent Police Oversight Authority (IPOA) ne ok onyiso maler gima ne okelo hinyruok mar Monson mane omiyo otho. Ne owacho ni jo sirikal ok otiyo maber ne anyuola mar Monson.

eng: He said that the prosecution failed to call the bouncer of the famous Tanduri night club in Diani that had called police on the deceased after he was allegedly caught smoking cannabis outside the club.
luo: Ne owacho ni joma ochung ne piny owacho ne ok oluongo jarit mane rito kar math ma ongere ni Tanduri Night Club e Diani mane oluongo polis mondo omak jogo ma othono kane oyude ka obadho jaga oko mar clubu no.

eng: “Looking at the circumstantial evidence, investigations let the court and the family of the deceased down by not getting the correct information. There was evidence that a bouncer from the club called the police but he was never called to testify what prompted him to call police,” said Magolo.
luo: “Ka angiyo gima omiyo omaki joma oachung' ne ka, jogo mane timo nonro ok otimo maber ne kot kod anyuola mar ngat ma otho no mikech ok gitimo nonro makere mondo gi yud gima omiyo ngatno ne otho. Nitie gima nyiso ni jogono mane rito kama ne ji mathe no, ne oluongo polis tokata kamano, ne ok oluonge e od bura mondo owach thoge kuom gima ne otimore kanyo chieng no, mane omiyo oluongo polis,” Magolo ne owacho kamano.

eng: Police Constable John Pambe, Naftali Chege, Charles Munyiri Muganda and Ismael Baraka were charged and with the murder of Monson in May 2012.
luo: Polise ma iluongo ni John Pambe, Naftali Chege, Charles Munyiri Muganda kod Ismael Baraka ne odonj negi gi ketho mar nego Monson e dwe mar Abich higa 2012.

eng: Justice Eric Ogoia had found the four had a case to answer and placed them on their defense.
luo: Jangad bura ma iluongo ni Justice Eric Ogoia ne oyudo ni polise agwen go ne nigo kosa kendo mano ema omiyo ne okel gi e kot mondo giwach gima ne otimore e tho mar Monsion.

eng: Magolo said calling for police reinforcement meant that there was confrontation at the club.
luo: Magolo ne owacho ni mondo ne luongi polise mamoko mondo omed biro e kar mathno nyiso maler ni ne nitie ywaruok moro e club kanyo.

eng: “The investigation has never bothered with what happened during the arrest and by leaving out those two areas, they denied you to find out if the injury was caused at the club or at the time of the arrest,” said Magolo.
luo: “Joma nyocha timo nonro mar jogo ma otho no ne ok oneno ni en gima ber mondo gi non ane gima ne otimore sama ne imako ma otho no kendo weyo mar timo nonro kuonde ariyo go, ne gitami ngeyo ka jagono ne ohinyore e clubu kama ne gimethe no kata sama ne imake oko,” Magolo ne owacho kamano.

eng: Magolo said the court and the public will never know who caused the injury and at what stage the injury was caused.
luo: Magolo ne owacho ni kot kod jo piny ok chieng' no nge  ngama ne ohinyo jago ma otho no kendo ni ne ohinye seche mage.

eng: “There is no evidence direct or circumstantial showing that his client contributed to causing the injury or assaulting the deceased,” said Magolo.
luo: “Onge gima nyiso ni jogo ma ochung' negi ema ne ogoyo kendo ohinyojogo ma otho no,” Magolo ne owacho kamano.

eng: He said Monson may have been injured at the cells, police office, during the arrest or at the club.
luo: Ne owacho ni Monson ne nyalo bedo ni ne ohinyore kama ne otere kar keno (cells), e ofisi mar polis, sama ne imake kata sama ne pod en e kar matho kuong'.

eng: “I therefore urge that you find the unfortunate as it is, we have been let down by police and Independent Police Oversight Authority IPOA and left you with no evidence and urge you to acquit the third accused,” said Magolo.
luo: “Kuom mano, ajiwi ni tem mondo inge gima ne otimore kaka en; ok wamor gi nonro mar polis kod migawo ma ngiyo polis (Independent Police Oversight Authority IPOA) ma ok omiyi ;er maber kuom gima ne otimore. Kuom mano,daher mar kwayi ni mondo iwe ngato mar adek ma odonj ne gi ketho mar nek ni,” Magolo ne owacho kamano.

eng: The DPP senior Counsel Alexander Muteti urged the court to find guilty and convict the four police officers charged with the murder of  Monson in 2015 at Diani Police Station.
luo: Jalup ngat mane ochung' ne sirikal e bura ni senior Counsel Alexander Muteti ne otemo jiwo kot mondo otwe polise agwen mane omaki go kuom nego Monson e higa mar 2015, Diani Police Station.

eng: “I urge the court to find the four accused guilty as charged, the deceased having died in their hands,” said Muteti.
luo: “Atemo jiwo kot mondo oyangi ni polise agwen go ne otimo kosa mana kaka sirikal ose lero e andike ma ne wakelo e kot, nikech jago mane otho no ne otho e lwet gi,” Muteti ne owacho kamano.

eng: Muteti urged the court to determine the circumstantial and forensic evidence in determining the cause of death.
luo: Muteti ne omedo jiwo kot mondo ongi gima omiyo iwacho ne polse agwen go ne oneko ma sirikal ne okelo e kot mondo mano ema okony judge ngado bura makare kuom gima ne okelo tho mar Monson.

eng: He said the court should also consider the credibility and believability of the accused in all human reasonable considerations of their defense.
luo: Muteti bende ne omedo wacho ni kot bende owinjore orangi adieri man tie kuom gik ma joma omaki go wacho ka dhano e temo nyiso ni ne ok gitimo makosa .

eng: “I focus on the defense because your lordship you have to deal with the issue of contradictory evidence from the accused persons much so touching on basis of where the assortment of drugs was discovered which is at the center of the arrest,” said Muteti.
luo: “Atemo wuoyo kuom joma omaki nikech - jatelo - nyaka koro irang ane gima omiyo polise ma omaki gi, golo thok ma opogore e wach tho ngatni, ahinya kuom kama ne nyasore mane omake go ni ne oyudore';ma e gima ne omiyo omake maduong',” Muteti ne owacho kamano.

eng: Defense lawyer Daniel Wamotsa said the prosecution was advancing theories that Monson’s injuries were inflicted between 3 AM and 6 AM while he was in police custody but failed to call any witness to prove the same.
luo: Okili ka maloka machielo mane ochung ne joma omaki go Daniel Wamotsa ne owacho ni  sirikal temo wacho ni Monson ne ohiny  e kind saa ochiko otieno kod saa apar gariyo okinyi kane en e lwet polis; to katakamano, onge janeno mane giluongo mondo obi owach gima ne oneno.

eng: Wamotsa said there was no way the age of the injury could be determined as alleged by the prosecution.
